Indonesian: <glee>Omong-omong, akan lebih baik jika kamu bisa meletakkannya di suatu tempat.
Italian: <glee>In ogni caso, se potessi posizionarlo da qualche parte, sarebbe fantastico.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>En cualquier caso, si pudieras colocarla por allí, sería genial.
Portuguese: <glee>Bem, seria ótimo se você pudesse colocá-la em algum lugar.
Turkish: <glee>Bunu bir yere koyarsan çok memnun olurum.
German: <glee>Naja, es wäre toll, wenn du sie irgendwo ablegen könntest.

English: <yes>Be sure to check it every so often.
French: <yes>Assure-toi de le consulter régulièrement.
Russian: <yes>Не забывай проверять время от времени.
Japanese: <yes>こまめにチェックするのを忘れずに。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>記得要常常去看看喔。
Thai: <yes>อย่าลืมแวะเวียนไปดูมันบ่อยๆ ล่ะ
Indonesian: <yes>Pastikan untuk memeriksanya sesering mungkin.
Italian: <yes>Assicurati di controllarlo di tanto in tanto.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Asegúrate de echarle un vistazo a menudo.
Portuguese: <yes>Certifique-se de dar uma olhada de vez em quando.
Turkish: <yes>Sık sık kontrol etmeyi unutma.
German: <yes>Du solltest regelmäßig nachsehen.

English: <yes>Anything you find in it is up for grabs, so feel free to take it!
French: <yes>Tout ce que tu trouves dedans est à toi, alors n'hésite pas à le prendre !
Russian: <yes>Все, что найдешь внутри, можешь забрать, не стесняйся!
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>里面的东西都可以随意拿取！
Japanese: <yes>見つけたものは君のものだから、持って行ってくれ！
Korean: <yes>여기에 들어 있는 건 줍는 사람이 임자니까, 마음껏 가져가렴!
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>裡面有什麼東西你都可以拿，隨便拿沒關係！
Thai: <yes>ไม่ว่าจะเจออะไรในนี้ เธอก็เอาไปได้เลยนะ!
Indonesian: <yes>Apa pun yang kamu temukan di dalamnya bisa kamu ambil, jadi silakan ambil!
Italian: <yes>Tutto ciò che trovi qui è disponibile: puoi prendere qualsiasi cosa liberamente!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Todo lo que encuentres está disponible, así que toma lo que quieras.
Portuguese: <yes>Qualquer coisa que encontrar aqui está disponível. Portanto, sinta-se à vontade para levar!
Turkish: <yes>İçinde bulduğun her şeyi alabilirsin!
German: <yes>Alles, was du darin findest, ist zum Mitnehmen, also greif zu!

English: I'm ready!
French: Je suis prêt(e) !
Russian: Могу начинать!
Chinese (Traditional): 我準備好了！
Thai: ฉันพร้อมลุย!
Indonesian: Aku siap!
Italian: Sono pronto!
Turkish: Hazırım!
German: Ich bin bereit!

English: Not yet.
French: Pas encore.
Russian: Еще нет.
Chinese (Traditional): 還沒。
Thai: ยังไม่ใช่ตอนนี้
Indonesian: Belum.
Italian: Non ancora.
Turkish: Henüz değil.
German: Noch nicht.

English: Okay! I'm going to get you to place some land deeds.
French: Ok ! Je vais t'obtenir des actes pour des terrains.
Russian: Ладно! Я дам тебе разместить кое-какие документы на землю.
Chinese (Simplified): 好的！我准备派你去放置一些土地地契。
Japanese: よし！では、土地の証書を設置してもらおう。
Korean: 좋아! 토지 건축 허가를 몇 개 놓아 볼까.
Chinese (Traditional): 好喔！我要請你幫忙放置一些地契。
Thai: โอเค! ฉันต้องขอให้เธอเอาโฉนดที่ดินไปวางหน่อย
Indonesian: Oke! Aku akan memintamu untuk meletakkan akta tanah.
Italian: Ok! Ti farò posizionare alcuni atti di proprietà di terreni.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Bien, dejaré que coloques algunas escrituras de tierra.
Portuguese: Vou fazer com que você coloque algumas escrituras de propriedade.
Turkish: Tamamdır! Şimdi senden birkaç tapu yerleştirmeni isteyeceğim.
German: Gut! Ich werde dich dazu bringen, einige Gebietsurkunden zu platzieren.

English: These deeds will show people where they can build their houses or businesses.
French: Ces actes montreront aux gens où ils peuvent construire leur maison ou leur entreprise.
Russian: Эти документы покажут людям, где они могут строить дома или предприятия.
Chinese (Simplified): 这些地契将标明允许建造房屋或经营生意的地方。
Japanese: 証書は、住居や事業所を建てられる場所を示すものだ。
Korean: 건축 허가는 사람들이 집이나 가게를 지을 수 있는 곳이 어딘지 알려주지.
Chinese (Traditional): 這些地契會告訴大家可以在哪裡蓋房子或開店。
Thai: โฉนดเหล่านี้จะแสดงให้ทุกคนเห็นว่าจะสามารถสร้างบ้านหรือธุรกิจได้ที่ตรงไหนบ้าง
Indonesian: Akta-akta ini akan menunjukkan kepada orang-orang di mana mereka dapat membangun rumah atau bisnis mereka.
Italian: Questi atti di proprietà indicheranno alle persone dove possono costruire le loro case o attività.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Estas escrituras les indicarán a las personas dónde pueden establecer sus casas o negocios.
Portuguese: Estas escrituras mostrarão às pessoas onde elas podem construir suas casas ou negócios.
Turkish: Bu tapular insanlara evlerini veya işletmelerini inşa edebilecekleri yeri gösterecek.
German: Diese Urkunden zeigen den Leuten, wo sie ihre Häuser oder Unternehmen bauen können.

English: Use this Axe to clear the land where you want to place the deed.
French: Utilise cette hache pour nettoyer la terre là où tu veux placer l'acte.
Russian: Очищай этим топором землю, на которой хочешь разместить документ.
Chinese (Simplified): 遇到想放置地契的地方，就使用这把斧头将其清理干净。
Japanese: 証書を置く場所を、この斧で整地するんだ。
Korean: 이 도끼를 사용해서 건축 허가를 놓을 곳을 깨끗하게 정리해 보렴.
Chinese (Traditional): 用這把斧頭清理你想放置地契的土地吧。
Thai: ให้ใช้ขวานอันนี้เพื่อถางพื้นที่บริเวณที่เธอต้องการวางโฉนด
Indonesian: Gunakan Kapak ini untuk membersihkan tanah tempat kamu ingin meletakkan akta.
Italian: Utilizza questa ascia per ripulire il terreno su cui vuoi posizionare l'atto di proprietà.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Usa esta hacha para despejar la tierra en la que quieras colocar la escritura.
Portuguese: Use este machado para limpar o terreno onde pretende colocar a escritura.
Turkish: Bu Baltayı kullanarak tapuyu koymak istediğin araziyi temizle.
German: Nutze diese Axt, um das Land zu roden, auf dem du die Urkunde platzieren möchtest.

English: Land deeds can only be placed on clear and levelled land.
French: Les actes pour les terrains ne peuvent être placés que sur de la terre nettoyée et mise à niveau.
Russian: Документы на землю можно разместить только на очищенной и ровной поверхности.
Chinese (Simplified): 土地地契只能放置在干净平整的地面上。
Japanese: 証書は整地された、平らな地面にしか設置できない。
Korean: 토지 건축 허가는 깨끗하게 정리되고 평평한 토지에만 놓을 수 있어.
Chinese (Traditional): 地契只能放在平整又清理乾淨的地上。
Thai: เพราะพื้นผิวต้องราบเรียบและโล่งเตียน เราถึงจะวางโฉนดที่ดินได้
Indonesian: Akta tanah hanya dapat ditempatkan di tanah yang bersih dan rata.
Italian: Gli atti di proprietà di terreni possono essere posizionati solo su terreni liberi e livellati.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Las escrituras de tierra solo se pueden colocar en zonas despejadas y niveladas.
Portuguese: Escrituras de propriedade só podem ser colocadas em terrenos limpos e nivelados.
Turkish: Arazi tapuları yalnızca temiz ve düz arazi üzerine konabilir.
German: Gebietsurkunden können nur auf geräumtem und ebenem Land platziert werden.

English: Come back and talk to me once you have placed the deed.
French: Reviens me parler une fois que tu auras placé l'acte.
Russian: Когда разместишь документ, приходи ко мне, поговорим.
Chinese (Simplified): 放完地契之后回来找我。
Japanese: 証書の設置が終わったら、また話しかけてくれ。
Korean: 건축 허가를 놓고 나서 다시 얘기하자꾸나.
Chinese (Traditional): 等你把地契放好後，再回來找我聊聊吧。
Thai: พอวางโฉนดที่ดินเสร็จแล้วก็ให้มาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: Kembalilah dan temui aku setelah kamu meletakkan akta tersebut.
Italian: Torna a trovarmi dopo aver posizionato l'atto di proprietà.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Vuelve y háblame una vez que hayas colocado la escritura.
Portuguese: Volte e fale comigo depois de você ter colocado a escritura.
Turkish: Tapuyu yerleştirdikten sonra gelip benimle konuş.
German: Komm wieder und sprich mit mir, wenn du die Urkunde platziert hast.

English: Not a problem! I'll let you have a look around for now.
French: Pas de problème ! Je te laisse regarder autour de toi pour le moment.
Russian: Не проблема! Я сейчас дам тебе взглянуть по сторонам.
Japanese: 大丈夫！とりあえず見て回っておいで。
Chinese (Traditional): 沒問題！你先隨便逛逛吧。
Thai: ไม่มีปัญหา! ฉันจะปล่อยให้เธอไปลองเดินเลือกดูแล้วกัน
Indonesian: Tidak masalah! Aku akan membiarkanmu untuk melihat-lihat dahulu.
Italian: Nessun problema! Per ora ti lascio dare un'occhiata in giro.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¡No hay problema! Te dejaré que eches un vistazo.
Portuguese: Sem problema! Vou deixar você dar uma olhada pelas redondezas.
Turkish: Sorun değil! Şimdilik etrafa göz gezdirebilirsin.
German: Kein Problem! Ich lasse dich erst mal in Ruhe schauen.

English: Have a look around, and then come back when you're ready.
French: Regarde autour de toi et reviens me parler lorsque tu sera prêt.
Russian: Осмотрись и возвращайся, когда подготовишься.
Chinese (Simplified): 你先到处看看吧，准备好后再来。
Japanese: 下見が終わって準備ができたら、戻ってきてくれ。
Chinese (Traditional): 你先四處逛逛，準備好了再回來找我。
Thai: ลองสำรวจดูให้ทั่วๆ แล้วถ้าพร้อมเมื่อไหร่ก็กลับมาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: Ayo lihat sekelilingmu, lalu kembali lagi jika sudah siap.
Italian: Dai un'occhiata in giro e torna da me quando sei pronto.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Echa un vistazo y vuelve cuando tengas todo listo.
Portuguese: Dê uma olhada por aí e volte quando tiver uma decisão tomada.
Turkish: Etrafa bakın ve hazır olduğunda yanıma gel.
German: Sieh dich ein wenig um und sag Bescheid, wenn du soweit bist.

English: Just be sure it's before night time! We don't want to be setting up in the dark.
French: Mais assure-toi de revenir avant la nuit ! On ne va pas tout installer dans le noir.
Russian: Только постарайся до ночи! Мы не хотим обустраивать все в темноте.
Chinese (Simplified): 记得在天黑之前回来，免得摸黑干活儿！
Japanese: 念のため言っておくと、間もなく夜だ。夜に準備をするのは避けたい。
Korean: 밤이 되기 전에만 돌아오렴! 어둠 속에서 설치할 수는 없으니까.
Chinese (Traditional): 記得在天黑前完成喔！我們可不想在黑暗中設置東西。
Thai: แต่ต้องกลับมาก่อนค่ำนะ! เพราะไม่แนะนำให้เตรียมสถานที่ในตอนกลางคืน
Indonesian: Namun, pastikan kamu selesai sebelum malam hari! Kami tidak ingin menyiapkannya saat hari sudah gelap.
Italian: Assicurati solo che sia prima di notte! Non vogliamo sistemarci al buio.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Solo asegúrate de que sea antes del anochecer. No queremos armar todo en la oscuridad.
Portuguese: Mas venha antes de anoitecer! Não queremos fazer as coisas no escuro.
Turkish: Ama gece yarısından önce gel! Karanlıkta iş yapmayalım.
German: Achte nur darauf, dass es vor Einbruch der Nacht geschieht! Wir wollen uns ja nicht im Dunkeln einrichten.

English: Well done <PlayerName>.
French: Bravo <PlayerName>.
Russian: Молодец, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 做得好，<PlayerName>。
Thai: เยี่ยมมาก <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Bagus sekali <PlayerName>.
Italian: Ben fatto, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Bravo <PlayerName>.
German: Gut gemacht, <PlayerName>.

English: You have acquired 10 <itemName>.
French: Tu as acquis 10 <itemName>.
Russian: У тебя уже 10 <itemName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 你取得了 10 個<itemName>。
Thai: เธอหา <itemName> มาได้ 10 ชิ้น
Indonesian: Kamu memperoleh 10 <itemName>.
Italian: Hai ottenuto 10 <itemName>.
Turkish: 10 <itemName> bulmuşsun.
German: Du hast 10 <itemName> erworben.

English: <no>I did not think this was possible.
French: <no>Je ne pensais pas que c'était possible.
Russian: <no>Не верилось, что это возможно.
Japanese: <no>本当にできるとは思っていなかったよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>我真的沒想到這有可能耶。
Thai: <no>ฉันไม่นึกเลยว่าเธอจะทำได้
Indonesian: <no>Aku tidak percaya ini terjadi.
Italian: <no>Non pensavo fosse possibile.
Portuguese: <no>Eu não sabia que isso era possível.
Turkish: <no>Bunun mümkün olabileceğini bilmiyordum.
German: <no>Das hätte ich nicht für möglich gehalten.

English: <yes>I am impressed.þ
French: <yes>Je suis impressionné(e).
Russian: <yes>Меня впечатлило.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我真的覺得超厲害的！
Thai: <yes>ประทับใจจริงๆ
Indonesian: <yes>Aku terkesan.
Italian: <yes>Sono colpito.
Turkish: <yes>Etkilendim.
German: <yes>Ich bin beeindruckt.

English: Now, if you would allow me to study the 10 <itemName>.þ
French: Maintenant, si tu m'autorisais à étudier les 10 <itemName>.
Russian: Теперь, если ты позволишь мне изучить 10 <itemName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 请允许我研究这 10 份<itemName>。
Japanese: 今度は、<itemName>を10個研究したいんだ。
Chinese (Traditional): 那麼，請讓我研究這 10 個<itemName>吧。
Thai: เอาละ ฉันขอศึกษา <itemName> ทั้ง 10 ชิ้นนี่ก่อน
Indonesian: Baiklah, sekarang, biarkan aku mempelajari 10 <itemName>.
Italian: Ora, se mi permettessi di studiare i 10 <itemName>.
Portuguese: Agora, talvez você me permita estudar os 10 <itemName>.
Turkish: Şimdi izin verirsen bu 10 <itemName> üzerinde çalışacağım.
German: Wenn du mir jetzt erlauben würdest, die 10 <itemName> unter die Lupe zu nehmen?

English: <thinking>….þ
French: <thinking>….
Russian: <thinking>….
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>…….
Thai: <thinking>….
Indonesian: <thinking>….
Italian: <thinking>….
Turkish: <thinking>….
German: <thinking>…

English: <thinking>Hmmm…
French: <thinking>Hum…
Russian: <thinking>Хммм…
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>嗯……
Thai: <thinking>ฮืมมม…
Indonesian: <thinking>Hmmm…
Italian: <thinking>Hmmm…
Turkish: <thinking>Hmm…
German: <thinking>Hmmm ...

English: <shocked>Yes!þ
French: <shocked>Oui !
Russian: <shocked>Да!
Chinese (Traditional): <shocked>好的！
Thai: <shocked>ใช่เลย!
Indonesian: <shocked>Ya!
Italian: <shocked>Sì!
Turkish: <shocked>Evet!
German: <shocked>Ja!

English: <glee>I believe there is a way to process this into a usable material.þ
French: <glee>Je pense qu'il existe une façon de transformer ceci en matériau utilisable.
Russian: <glee>Верю, есть способ переработать это в полезный материал.
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>应该有办法把这个加工成可用材料。
Japanese: <glee>これを利用できる素材に加工する方法があるはずだ。
Korean: <glee>이걸 유용한 재료로 만들 방법이 있을 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>我覺得這個可以加工成有用的材料。
Thai: <glee>ฉันเชื่อว่ามีวิธีที่เราจะนำสิ่งนี้ไปแปรเป็นวัสดุที่ใช้การได้
Indonesian: <glee>Aku yakin ada cara untuk mengolahnya menjadi bahan yang dapat digunakan.
Italian: <glee>Credo che esista un modo per trasformarlo in un materiale utilizzabile.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Creo que se puede procesar para obtener un material útil.
Portuguese: <glee>Eu acho que há uma forma de transformar isso em um material usável.
Turkish: <glee>Sanırım bunu kullanışlı bir malzemeye dönüştürmenin bir yolu var.
German: <glee>Ich glaube, es gibt eine Möglichkeit, das zu einem brauchbaren Material zu verarbeiten.

English: Studying this <itemName> has given me an idea for a new invention.
French: Étudier ce <itemName> m'a donné une idée pour une nouvelle invention.
Russian: Изучение этого <itemName> дало мне идею нового изобретения.
Chinese (Simplified): 在研究<itemName>的时候，我突然有了新的发明创意。
Japanese: この<itemName>を研究していると、新発明が思いついたんだ。
Korean: <itemName> 연구를 하면서 새로운 발명품에 관한 아이디어가 떠올랐어.
Chinese (Traditional): 研究這個<itemName>讓我想到了新發明的點子。
Thai: การศึกษา <itemName> นี้ทำให้ฉันมีไอเดียสำหรับสิ่งประดิษฐ์ใหม่
Indonesian: Mempelajari <itemName> ini telah memberiku ide untuk penemuan baru.
Italian: Studiando questo <itemName>, mi è venuta un'idea per una nuova invenzione.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Al estudiar este <itemName>, se me ha ocurrido una idea para un invento nuevo.
Portuguese: Estudar este <itemName> me deu uma ideia para uma invenção nova.
Turkish: <itemName> üzerinde çalışırken yeni bir icat fikri geldi aklıma.
German: Die genaue Betrachtung von "<itemName>" hat mich auf eine Idee für eine neue Erfindung gebracht.

English: Please, <PlayerName>, come talk to me if you want me to craft you something new!
French: S'il te plaît, <PlayerName>, viens me parler si tu veux que je te fabrique quelque chose de nouveau !
Russian: Пожалуйста, <PlayerName>, обращайся ко мне, если нужно изготовить что-то новое!
Chinese (Simplified): <PlayerName>，如果你有新的东西要制作，还请来找我！
Japanese: <PlayerName>、新しく作ってほしいものがあれば、僕に言ってほしい！
Korean: <PlayerName>, 새로운 아이템을 만들어 줄 테니 필요하면 얘기해!
Chinese (Traditional): <PlayerName>，如果你想要我幫你做些新東西，隨時來找我聊聊吧！
Thai: <PlayerName> ถ้าเธออยากให้ฉันประดิษฐ์อะไรใหม่ๆ ให้ก็มาคุยกับฉันได้เสมอนะ!
Indonesian: Silakan, <PlayerName>. Temui aku jika kamu ingin kubuatkan sesuatu yang baru!
Italian: Ti prego, <PlayerName>, vieni a trovarmi se vuoi che crei qualcosa di nuovo per te!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Ven y háblame si quieres que fabrique algo nuevo, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: <PlayerName>, venha falar comigo se quiser que eu crie uma coisa nova para você!
Turkish: <PlayerName>, yeni bir şey üretmemi istersen gelip benimle konuşabilirsin!
German: Bitte, <PlayerName>, komm zu mir, wenn ich dir etwas Neues basteln soll!

English: <glee>Well done, <PlayerName>.
French: <glee>Bravo, <PlayerName>.
Russian: <glee>Молодец, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>做得好，<PlayerName>。
Thai: <glee>เยี่ยมมากเลย <PlayerName>
Indonesian: <glee>Bagus sekali, <PlayerName>.
Italian: <glee>Ben fatto, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: <glee>Bravo <PlayerName>.
German: <glee>Gut gemacht, <PlayerName>.

English: <yes>You have proven yourself invaluable once again!
French: <yes>Encore une fois, tu t'es montré bien utile !
Russian: <yes>Ты снова доказываешь свою бесценность!
Japanese: <yes>今回も貴重な実力を見せてくれた！
Korean: <yes>네가 여기에 꼭 필요한 사람이라는 걸 다시 한번 보여줬구나!
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>你再次證明了自己對這裡來說多重要！
Thai: <yes>เธอพิสูจน์ตัวเองอีกแล้วนะว่าเลิศล้ำจริงๆ!
Indonesian: <yes>Sekali lagi, kamu telah membuktikan dirimu tak tergantikan!
Italian: <yes>Ancora una volta hai dimostrato di essere prezioso!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Una vez más, has demostrado que eres una persona muy valiosa.
Portuguese: <yes>Você mostrou o seu valor mais uma vez!
Turkish: <yes>Yine çok değerli olduğunu kanıtladın!
German: <yes>Du hast dich wieder einmal als unschätzbar wertvoll erwiesen!

English: <shocked>You're really starting to carry a lot of stuff around!
French: <shocked>Tu commences vraiment à transporter beaucoup de choses !
Russian: <shocked>Ты теперь действительно много с собой носишь!
Japanese: <shocked>本当に多くのものを持ち歩くようになったね！
Chinese (Traditional): <shocked>你身上真的開始帶很多東西了耶！
Thai: <shocked>เธอเริ่มมีของมากมายที่ต้องขนไปขนมา!
Indonesian: <shocked>Kamu benar-benar mulai membawa banyak bahan!
Italian: <shocked>Stai davvero iniziando a portarti dietro un sacco di roba!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <shocked>Estás empezando a lograr muchas cosas por aquí.
Portuguese: <shocked>Você está mesmo começando a carregar muitas coisas por aí!
Turkish: <shocked>Yanında bir sürü şey taşımaya başlamışsın!
German: <shocked>So langsam schleppst du eine Menge Zeug mit dir herum!

English: <yes>I'll tell you what, I'll teach you how to craft a <itemName>.
French: <yes>Écoute, je vais t'apprendre à fabriquer un(e) <itemName>.
Russian: <yes>Вот что тебе скажу, я научу тебя, как изготовить <itemName>.
Japanese: <yes>そこで、<itemName>を作る方法を教えてあげるよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我跟你說，我來教你怎麼製作<itemName>吧。
Thai: <yes>รู้ไหม ฉันจะสอนวิธีประดิษฐ์ <itemName> ให้เธอแล้วกัน
Indonesian: <yes>Baiklah, aku akan mengajarimu cara membuat <itemName>.
Italian: <yes>Sai che ti dico? Ti insegnerò come creare un <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>¿Sabes qué? Te enseñaré a fabricar un <itemName>.
Portuguese: <yes>É o seguinte, vou ensinar você a fazer <itemName>.
Turkish: <yes>En iyisi sana <itemName> üretmeyi öğreteyim.
German: <yes>Ich sag dir was, ich zeige dir, wie man ein <itemName> herstellt.

English: <yes>You're going to need a recipe for Nails too.
French: <yes>Tu vas aussi avoir besoin d'une recette pour les Clous.
Russian: <yes>Тебе понадобится также рецепт гвоздей.
Japanese: <yes>釘のレシピも必要になるね。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>你也需要釘子的製作配方喔。
Thai: <yes>เธอจะต้องใช้สูตรสำหรับทำตะปูด้วย
Indonesian: <yes>Kamu juga akan membutuhkan resep untuk Kuku.
Italian: <yes>Ti serviranno anche le istruzioni per i chiodi.
Portuguese: <yes>Você vai precisar de uma instrução para parafusos também.
Turkish: <yes>Çivi reçetesine de ihtiyacın olacak.
German: <yes>Du brauchst auch noch ein Rezept für Nägel.

English: <proud>I'll tell you what, <IslandName> is well on it's way to being a great settlement again!
French: <proud>Laisse-moi te dire une chose, <IslandName> est en passe de redevenir une belle installation !
Russian: <proud>Вот что тебе скажу, <IslandName> снова превращается в достойное поселение!
Chinese (Simplified): <proud><IslandName>正在蓬勃发展，未来将再度成为美好的定居点！
Japanese: <proud><IslandName>は順調に、素晴らしい居場所としての姿を取り戻しつつあるよ！
Korean: <proud>그거 아니? <IslandName>이 다시 정말 멋진 곳으로 변하고 있어!
Chinese (Traditional): <proud>我跟你說，<IslandName>這裡很快就會變成超棒的聚落了！
Thai: <proud>รู้ไหม ตอนนี้เกาะ <IslandName> ทำท่าว่าจะกลับมาเป็นถิ่นที่อยู่อาศัยที่ดีอีกครั้ง!
Indonesian: <proud>Sebenarnya, <IslandName> sudah siap kembali menjadi pemukiman yang luar biasa.
Italian: <proud>Sai che ti dico? <IslandName> è sulla buona strada per tornare a essere un fantastico insediamento!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <proud>Te diré algo, <IslandName> se está convirtiendo en un gran asentamiento una vez más.
Portuguese: <proud>Olha só, <IslandName> está no caminho certo para se tornar um povoado fantástico outra vez!
Turkish: <proud><IslandName> yine muhteşem bir yerleşim yeri olacak!
German: <proud>Ich sage dir, <IslandName> ist auf dem besten Wege, wieder eine großartige Siedlung zu werden!

English: <yes>With a furnace and a table saw we can start thinking about building more permanent structures.
French: <yes>Avec un fourneau et une scie sur table, nous pouvons commencer à réfléchir à la construction de structures plus permanentes.
Russian: <yes>С печью и настольной пилой, мы можем начать думать о возведении более постоянных построек.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>有了熔炉和台锯，我们能修建更多的永久建筑。
Japanese: <yes>炉とテーブルソーがあれば、もっと常設建物を作ることも検討できるよ。
Korean: <yes>용광로와 테이블 톱을 사용하면 더 오래가는 건물도 지을 수 있을 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>有了熔爐和桌鋸，我們就可以開始考慮建造更永久的建築了。
Thai: <yes>เมื่อมีเตาหลอมกับโต๊ะเลื่อยวงเดือน เราก็เริ่มคิดเรื่องสร้างอาคารถาวรเพิ่มได้
Indonesian: <yes>Dengan tungku dan gergaji meja, kita bisa mulai mempertimbangkan pembangunan struktur yang lebih permanen.
Italian: <yes>Con una fornace e una sega circolare possiamo cominciare a pensare di costruire strutture più permanenti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Con un horno de fundición y una sierra de mesa, podremos planificar la construcción de estructuras más permanentes.
Portuguese: <yes>Com uma fornalha e uma serra de bancada, nós podemos começar a pensar em construir estruturas mais duradouras.
Turkish: <yes>Fırın ve tezgâh testeresiyle daha kalıcı yapılar inşa etmeye başlayabiliriz.
German: <yes>Mit einem Ofen und einer Tischkreissäge können wir anfangen, über den Bau dauerhafterer Strukturen nachzudenken.

English: I'll tell you what, we should try and get <NPCName> to set up a real shop here!
French: Laisse-moi te dire une chose, on devrait encourager <NPCName> à installer une vraie boutique ici !
Russian: Вот что тебе скажу, нам надо побудить <NPCName> обустроить здесь настоящую лавку!
Chinese (Simplified): 我们该想法子让<NPCName>在这里开办一家真正的商店！
Japanese: <NPCName>に本物の店舗を作ってもらうよう働きかけなきゃいけない！
Korean: <NPCName>씨가 여기에 진짜 가게를 차리도록 도와주는 게 어떠니!
Chinese (Traditional): 我跟你說，我們應該試著讓<NPCName>在這裡開家真正的商店！
Thai: รู้ไหม ฉันว่าเราควรพยายามชวนให้ <NPCName> มาตั้งร้านที่นี่แบบเป็นเรื่องเป็นราว!
Indonesian: Menurutku, kita harus berusaha meyakinkan <NPCName> untuk membuka toko sungguhan di sini!
Italian: Sai che ti dico? Dovremmo provare a convincere <NPCName> ad aprire un vero negozio qui!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te diré algo, deberías hacer que <NPCName> instale una tienda de verdad aquí.
Portuguese: É o seguinte, deveríamos tentar fazer com que <NPCName> tivesse uma loja de verdade aqui!
Turkish: <NPCName>'un burada gerçek bir dükkân açmasını sağlamalıyız!
German: Weißt du was? Wir sollten <NPCName> dazu überreden, hier ein richtiges Geschäft einzurichten!

English: <yes>Come back and talk to me when you are ready.
French: <yes>Reviens me parler une fois que tu seras prêt(e).
Russian: <yes>Когда подготовишься, приходи ко мне, поговорим.
Japanese: <yes>準備ができたら、話しかけてね。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>等你準備好了，再回來找我聊聊吧！
Thai: <yes>ไว้ค่อยกลับมาคุยกับฉันเมื่อเธอพร้อมแล้วนะ
Indonesian: <yes>Kembali dan temui aku jika kamu sudah siap.
Italian: <yes>Torna a trovarmi quando sei pronto.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Vuelve y háblame una vez que tengas todo listo.
Portuguese: <yes>Volte para falar comigo quando tiver tomado uma decisão.
Turkish: <yes>Hazır olduğunda gel ve benimle konuş.
German: <yes>Komm wieder und sprich mit mir, wenn du dazu bereit bist.

English: <thinking>Although, probably can't sell you a lot of tools until you have all your <Licences> in order.
French: <thinking>Même si je ne pourrais sans doute pas te vendre beaucoup d'outils tant que toutes tes <Licences> ne seront pas en ordre.
Russian: <thinking>Хотя, возможно, тебе нельзя будет продать многие инструменты, пока у тебя не будут все необходимые <Licences>.
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>不过，在你办完所有的<Licences>之前，出售的工具比较有限。
Japanese: <thinking>ただ、<Licences>をすべて準備するまではあまり多くの道具は売れないだろうね。
Korean: <thinking>하지만 <Licences>을 모두 갖추기 전까지는 도구를 많이 팔 수 없을 거다.
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>雖然如此，在你取得所有<Licences>之前，我可能沒辦法賣你太多工具喔。
Thai: <thinking>แต่เขาอาจจะขายอะไรให้เธอมากไม่ได้จนกว่าเธอจะมี <Licences> ทั้งหมดที่ต้องใช้
Indonesian: <thinking>Sayangnya, dia mungkin tidak bisa menjual banyak peralatan kepadamu sampai kamu memiliki semua <Licences>.
Italian: <thinking>Anche se forse non puoi acquistare molti attrezzi finché tutte le tue <Licences> non sono in ordine.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Sin embargo, no podrá venderte muchas herramientas hasta que tengas todas tus <Licences> en orden.
Portuguese: <thinking>Talvez eu não possa vender várias ferramentas para você até que tenha todas as suas <Licences> em mãos.
Turkish: <thinking>Ama alet satın alabilmek için önce <Licences>ını alman gerekiyor.
German: <thinking>Allerdings kann ich dir wahrscheinlich nicht viele Werkzeuge verkaufen, solange du nicht all deine <Licences> beisammen hast.

English: You know about <Licences>, right?
French: Tu sais ce que sont les <Licences>, pas vrai ?
Russian: Ты знаешь, что такое <Licences>, да?
Chinese (Traditional): 你知道<Licences>吧？
Thai: เธอรู้เกี่ยวกับ <Licences> ใช่ไหม
Indonesian: Kamu tahu tentang <Licences>, kan?
Italian: Conosci le <Licences>, vero?
Turkish: <Licences>ı biliyorsun, değil mi?
German: Du weißt Bescheid über <Licences>, oder?

English: Let's do it!
French: Allons-y !
Russian: Давай!
Chinese (Traditional): 我們開始吧！
Thai: ลุยกันเลย!
Indonesian: Ayo kita lakukan!
Italian: Facciamolo!
Turkish: Hadi yapalım!
German: Auf geht's!

English: How do we do that?
French: Comment est-ce qu'on fait ça ?
Russian: Как нам это сделать?
Chinese (Traditional): 我們要怎麼做呢？
Thai: ต้องทำยังไงเหรอ
Indonesian: Bagaimana kita melakukannya?
Italian: Come possiamo farlo?
Turkish: Nasıl yapacağız?
German: Wie gehen wir vor?

English: That's the spirit, <PlayerName>!
French: C'est bien de penser comme ça, <PlayerName> !
Russian: Вот это дух, <PlayerName>!
Chinese (Traditional): 這才對嘛，<PlayerName>！
Thai: มันต้องอย่างนี้สิ <PlayerName>!
Indonesian: Aku suka semangatmu, <PlayerName>!
Italian: È questo lo spirito, <PlayerName>!
Turkish: İşte aradığım ruh <PlayerName>!
German: Das ist die richtige Einstellung, <PlayerName>!

English: <yes>I reckon if we spend a bit of money at his tent, he'll see it's worth while...
French: <yes>Je pense que si on dépense un peu d'argent pour sa tente, il verra que cela en vaut la peine...
Russian: <yes>Полагаю, если мы потратим немного денег в его палатке, он поймет, что это того стоит...
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>我在想，如果可以去他的帐篷小小消费一下，他肯定也会认为值得…
Japanese: <yes>彼のテントで少々お金を使えば、試す価値はあるとわかってくれるだろう…
Korean: <yes>텐트에 가서 돈을 좀 쓰면 그만한 가치가 있겠다고 생각할 거야...
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我覺得如果我們在他的帳篷花點錢，他就會覺得值得了……
Thai: <yes>ฉันว่าถ้าเราซื้อของที่เต็นท์ของเขาพอสมควร เขาอาจจะรู้สึกว่าคุ้มที่จะลองดูสักตั้ง...
Indonesian: <yes>Kurasa jika kita membelanjakan sedikit uang di tendanya, dia akan merasa ini tidak akan sia-sia...
Italian: <yes>Penso che se spendiamo un po' di soldi nella sua tenda, capirà che ne vale la pena...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Creo que si gastamos algo de dinero en su tienda de campaña, verá que vale la pena…
Portuguese: <yes>Eu acho que se nós gastarmos um pouco de dinheiro na barraca dele, ele verá que vale a pena...
Turkish: <yes>Bence çadırında para harcarsak buranın yaşanır bir yer olduğunu düşünebilir...
German: <yes>Ich denke, wenn wir bei seinem Zelt ein bisschen Geld ausgeben, wird er sehen, dass es sich lohnt …

English: <yes>Oh, and we should show him how friendly people are around here!
French: <yes>Oh, et on devrait lui montrer à quel point les gens sont amicaux ici !
Russian: <yes>О, и стоит показать ему, какие дружелюбные здесь люди!
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>噢，我们应该带他看看这里的人们是多么友善！
Japanese: <yes>ああ、それとここの住民はフレンドリーってことも教えてあげないと！
Korean: <yes>아, 그리고 이곳 사람들이 얼마나 친절한지도 보여줘야지!
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>對了，我們應該讓他看看這裡的人有多熱情！
Thai: <yes>เออใช่ เราควรแสดงให้เขาเห็นด้วยว่าคนแถวนี้เป็นมิตรขนาดไหน!
Indonesian: <yes>Oh, dan kita harus tunjukkan padanya betapa ramahnya orang-orang di sekitar sini!
Italian: <yes>Oh, e dovremmo mostrargli quanto sono amichevoli le persone da queste parti!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Ah, y deberíamos mostrarle lo amistosos que son todos aquí.
Portuguese: <yes>Ah, e temos de mostrar a ele como o pessoal daqui é amigável!
Turkish: <yes>Tabi buradaki insanların ne kadar samimi olduğunu da ona göstermeliyiz!
German: <yes>Oh, und wir sollten ihm zeigen, wie freundlich die Menschen hier sind!

English: Why don't you ask <NPCName> if he has anything he needs done?
French: Pourquoi ne demandes-tu pas à <NPCName> s'il a besoin d'aide pour quelque chose ?
Russian: Почему ты не попросишь, может быть <NPCName> нуждается в какой-то работе?
Chinese (Simplified): 如果<NPCName>有什么事，为何不去问他呢？
Japanese: <NPCName>に何かやってほしいことがないか聞いてきてくれないか？
Korean: <NPCName>씨에게 필요한 게 있는지 물어보는 게 어떠니?
Chinese (Traditional): 你怎麼不問問<NPCName>有沒有什麼需要幫忙的？
Thai: เธอลองไปถาม <NPCName> ดูสิว่าเขาต้องการอะไรไหม
Indonesian: Cobalah untuk bertanya pada <NPCName>, apakah ada sesuatu yang perlu dia lakukan?
Italian: Perché non chiedi a <NPCName> se c'è qualcosa che deve fare?
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Por qué no le preguntamos a <NPCName> si necesita algo?
Portuguese: Por que você não pergunta ao <NPCName> se ele não precisa de ajuda com alguma coisa?
Turkish: <NPCName>'a yapılması gereken bir işi olup olmadığını sorsana.
German: Warum fragst du <NPCName> nicht, ob es etwas für ihn zu erledigen gibt?

English: <haha>If we can prove to him that <IslandName> is a great place to move, I'm sure he'll ask to live here for good!
French: <haha>Si on peut lui prouver que <IslandName> est un superbe endroit où vivre, je suis sûr qu'il demandera à rester ici !
Russian: <haha>Если мы сможем ему доказать, что <IslandName> — отличное место для переезда, он точно захочет остаться здесь навсегда!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>如果可以向他证明<IslandName>是移居的好选择，他肯定会申请长期在此居住！
Japanese: <haha><IslandName>が引っ越しにおあつらえ向きの場所だと思ってもらえれば、永住したいと言ってくれるに違いない！
Korean: <haha><IslandName>이 이사 오기에 좋은 곳이라는 걸 보여준다면 분명히 여기서 계속 살고 싶어 할 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>如果我們能向他證明<IslandName>這裡是個很棒的地方，我相信他一定會想要長住下來！
Thai: <haha>ถ้าเราพิสูจน์ให้เขาเห็นได้ว่าเกาะ <IslandName> เหมาะสำหรับย้ายมาอยู่ ฉันเชื่อว่าเขาจะต้องขอย้ายมาลงหลักปักฐานที่นี่แน่นอน!
Indonesian: <haha>Jika kita bisa membuktikan padanya bahwa <IslandName> adalah tempat yang tepat untuk pindah, aku yakin dia akan meminta untuk tinggal di sini selamanya!
Italian: <haha>Se possiamo dimostrargli che <IslandName> è un ottimo posto in cui trasferirsi, sono sicuro che chiederà di vivere qui per sempre!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>Si podemos demostrarle que <IslandName> es un gran lugar para vivir, creo que querrá mudarse definitivamente.
Portuguese: <haha>Se nós conseguirmos provar a ele que <IslandName> é um excelente lugar para viver, tenho certeza de que ele pedirá para morar aqui de vez!
Turkish: <haha><IslandName> Adası'nın yaşanacak bir yer olduğunu ona kanıtlarsak eminim burada yaşamaya karar verecektir!
German: <haha>Wenn wir ihm beweisen können, dass <IslandName> ein großartiger Ort zum Leben ist, wird er ganz sicher darum bitten, hierher ziehen zu dürfen!

English: You’ll have to spend some <PermitPoints> to get them, but if you keep doing milestones you’ll make enough in no time.
French: Tu devras dépenser quelques <PermitPoints> pour les obtenir, mais si tu continues à obtenir des jalons, tu y arriveras en peu de temps.
Russian: Тебе нужно будет потратить на них немного <PermitPoints>, но если ты будешь и дальше проходить вехи, их скоро будет достаточно.
Chinese (Simplified): 必须花费<PermitPoints>才能获得，不过继续努力完成里程碑，应该很快就可以攒够。
Japanese: 取得するには<PermitPoints>を使わなきゃいけない。でも、マイルストーンを着実に達成していればすぐに十分集まるだろう。
Korean: 그러려면 <PermitPoints>를 좀 써야겠지만, 추억 조각을 계속 모은다면 금방 다시 쌓일 거란다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你需要花點錢來取得<PermitPoints>，但只要你持續完成里程碑，很快就能賺到足夠的錢。
Thai: เธอจะต้องเอา <PermitPoints> มายื่นประกอบการขอด้วย แต่ถ้าเธอบรรลุเส้นชัยไปเรื่อยๆ อีกไม่นาน เธอก็จะมีแต้มมากพอ
Indonesian: Kamu harus mengeluarkan beberapa <PermitPoints> untuk mendapatkannya, tapi jika kamu terus melakukan milestone, kamu bisa mendapatkannya dalam waktu singkat.
Italian: Dovrai spendere un po' di <PermitPoints> per ottenerle, ma se continui a raggiungere obiettivi, ne guadagnerai abbastanza in poco tempo.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Deberás gastar algunos <PermitPoints> para conseguirlas, pero si sigues cumpliendo logros, tendrás suficientes en poco tiempo.
Portuguese: Você terá de gastar alguns <PermitPoints> para obtê-las, mas, se continuar conquistando prêmios, você ganhará o suficiente muito em breve.
Turkish: Bunları almak için biraz <PermitPoints> harcaman gerekecek ama başarı kazandıkça yenilerini biriktirebilirsin.
German: Du musst einige <PermitPoints> ausgeben, um sie zu kriegen, aber wenn du weiterhin Meilensteine erreichst, wirst du in kürzester Zeit genügend beisammen haben.

English: As you get better at doing certain tasks, new <Licence> levels will open up too.
French: À mesure que tu t'améliores pour faire certaines tâches, de nouveaux niveaux de <Licence> deviendront disponibles.
Russian: По мере того как ты будешь лучше справляться с определенными задачами, будут открываться и новые уровни <Licence>.
Chinese (Simplified): 随着特定任务的熟练程度提升，新的<Licence>等级也将开放。
Japanese: あるタスクをうまくこなせるようになると、新しい<Licence>レベルも開放されるよ。
Korean: 작업을 더 잘하게 되면 새로운 <Licence> 레벨도 열릴 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): 隨著你越來越熟練，也會解鎖新的<Licence>等級喔！
Thai: เมื่อเธอทำบางอย่างได้ชำนาญขึ้น เธอก็จะมีสิทธิ์ขอรับ <Licence> ระดับใหม่ๆ ด้วย
Indonesian: Saat kamu makin baik dalam melakukan tugas tertentu, level <Licence> yang baru juga akan terbuka.
Italian: Man mano che migliori nello svolgere determinate attività, saranno disponibili nuovi livelli di <Licence>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): A medida que mejores en determinados aspectos, también se desbloquearán nuevos niveles de <Licence>.
Portuguese: Com seu desempenho melhorando ao realizar algumas tarefas, novos níveis de <Licence> ficarão disponíveis.
Turkish: Belirli görevlerde geliştikçe yeni <Licence> seviyeleri de açılacak.
German: Je mehr du dich im Erledigen bestimmter Aufgaben verbesserst, desto mehr neue <Licence>-Level werden freigeschaltet.

English: Now, let’s see if there is a <Licence> you can apply for right now...
French: Voyons maintenant s'il y a une <Licence> que tu peux demander tout de suite...
Russian: А теперь посмотрим, есть ли <Licence>, на которую можно подать заявку...
Chinese (Simplified): 来看看你目前可以申请的<Licence>…
Japanese: じゃあ、今すぐ申請できる<Licence>がないか確認しようか…
Korean: 이제 당장 신청할 수 있는 <Licence>이 있는지 확인해 볼까...
Chinese (Traditional): 現在，來看看有沒有什麼你可以申請的<Licence>吧……
Thai: เอาละ มาดูกันว่าตอนนี้มี <Licence> อะไรบ้างที่เธอสามารถขอรับได้เลย...
Indonesian: Sekarang, ayo kita lihat apakah ada <Licence> yang bisa kamu minta...
Italian: Ora vediamo se c'è una <Licence> che puoi richiedere adesso...
Spanish (Latin Americas): Veamos si puedes solicitar alguna <Licence> ahora mismo…
Portuguese: Agora, vamos ver se há alguma <Licence> para a qual você já possa se candidatar...
Turkish: Bakalım şu anda başvurabileceğin bir <Licence> var mı...
German: Mal sehen, ob es eine <Licence> gibt, die du jetzt beantragen könntest …

English: I’ll let you decide where the best place for this <itemName> is.
French: Je vais te laisser décider du meilleur emplacement pour ce(tte) <itemName>.
Russian: Тебе решать, где лучшего всего разместить <itemName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 你可以自行决定这件<itemName>放置在什么地方适合。
Japanese: この<itemName>をどこに置くかは、お任せするよ。
Korean: 이 <itemName>에 딱 맞는 곳이 어딘지는 네가 결정하렴.
Chinese (Traditional): 這個<itemName>要放哪裡，交給你決定。
Thai: ฉันจะให้เธอเลือกแล้วกันว่าจะตั้ง <itemName> ที่ไหนดี
Indonesian: Kamu yang menentukan di mana tempat terbaik untuk <itemName> ini.
Italian: Lascerò che sia tu a decidere qual è il posto migliore per questa <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te dejaré decidir cuál es el mejor lugar para la <itemName>.
Portuguese: Vou deixar você decidir qual é o melhor local para este <itemName>.
Turkish: <itemName> için en iyi yerin neresi olacağına sen karar ver.
German: Ich überlasse es dir, zu entscheiden, wo die beste Stelle für diesen <itemName> ist.

English: <haha>Just be sure it's closeby!
French: <haha>Assure-toi seulement que ce soit à proximité !
Russian: <haha>Только убедись, что это поблизости!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>記得放在附近就好！
Thai: <haha>ขอแค่อย่าไปอยู่ที่ไหนไกลก็พอ!
Indonesian: <haha>Pastikan lokasinya dekat!
Italian: <haha>Assicurati solo che sia nelle vicinanze!
Portuguese: <haha>Certifique-se apenas de ser aqui por perto!
Turkish: <haha>Ama yakında olsun ha!
German: <haha>Achte nur darauf, dass es in der Nähe ist!

English: <glee>We want visitors to feel like part of the <IslandName> community while they are here!
French: <glee>Nous voulons que les visiteurs sentent qu'ils font partie de la communauté de <IslandName> quand ils sont ici !
Russian: <glee>Мы хотим, чтобы посетители ощутили себя частью сообщества острова <IslandName>, пока они здесь!
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>希望访客在这里感受到自己是属于<IslandName>社区的一份子！
Japanese: <glee>お客さんの滞在中には、<IslandName>の一員と思って過ごしてほしいんだ！
Korean: <glee>사람들이 이곳에 머무는 동안 <IslandName> 주민이 된 것 같은 기분을 느꼈으면 좋겠구나!
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>我們希望遊客在<IslandName>這裡能感受到自己是這個社區的一份子！
Thai: <glee>เราอยากให้แขกที่มาเยือนรู้สึกเป็นส่วนหนึ่งของชุมชนเกาะ <IslandName>!
Indonesian: <glee>Kami ingin pengunjung merasa menjadi bagian dari masyarakat <IslandName> saat berada di sini!
Italian: <glee>Vogliamo che i visitatori si sentano parte della comunità di <IslandName> mentre sono qui!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Queremos que los visitantes se sientan parte de la comunidad de <IslandName> mientras estén aquí.
Portuguese: <glee>Nós queremos que os visitantes se sintam parte da comunidade de <IslandName> enquanto estiverem por aqui!
Turkish: <glee>Ziyaretçiler buraya geldiklerinde <IslandName> topluluğunun bir parçası gibi hissetmelerini istiyoruz!
German: <glee>Wir möchten, dass sich unsere Besucher auf <IslandName> als Teil der Gemeinschaft fühlen, während sie hier sind!

English: Who knows, maybe we can convince him to set up a permanent shop here!
French: Qui sait, peut-être qu'on arrivera à le convaincre d'installer sa boutique ici de manière permanente !
Russian: Кто знает, может быть, мы убедим их обустроить здесь постоянную лавку!
Chinese (Simplified): 谁知道呢，或许我们能够说服他在此开办永久商店！
Japanese: なんとも言えないけど、ここに常設ショップを設置するよう説得できるかも知れないよ！
Korean: 어쩌면 여기 제대로 된 가게를 차리도록 설득할 수 있을지도 몰라!
Chinese (Traditional): 誰知道呢，也許我們可以說服他在這裡開一家永久的商店！
Thai: ไม่แน่ เราอาจจูงใจให้เขาเลือกมาตั้งร้านค้าถาวรที่นี่ก็ได้!
Indonesian: Siapa tahu, mungkin kita bisa meyakinkannya untuk mendirikan toko permanen di sini!
Italian: Chissà, forse riusciremo a convincerlo ad aprire qui un negozio permanente!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Quién sabe, quizás podamos convencerlo de que instale una tienda permanente aquí.
Portuguese: Bem, quem sabe conseguimos convencê-lo a abrir uma loja permanente aqui!
Turkish: Kim bilir, belki onu burada kalıcı bir dükkân açmaya ikna edebiliriz!
German: Wer weiß, vielleicht können wir ihn davon überzeugen, hier dauerhaft ein Geschäft einzurichten!

English: <yes>Be sure to talk to me once you have placed the <itemName>.
French: <yes>N'oublie pas de revenir me parler une fois que tu auras placé le/la <itemName>.
Russian: <yes>Не забудь обратиться ко мне, когда разместишь <itemName>.
Japanese: <yes><itemName>を設置したら、また話しかけてくれよ。
Korean: <yes><itemName> 배치를 하고 나면 꼭 내게 알려주렴.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>等你放好<itemName>後，記得來找我聊聊喔！
Thai: <yes>พอตั้ง <itemName> เสร็จแล้วก็อย่าลืมมาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: <yes>Pastikan untuk berbicara denganku setelah meletakkan <itemName>.
Italian: <yes>Assicurati di parlare con me una volta che hai posizionato il <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Háblame una vez que hayas colocado la <itemName>.
Portuguese: <yes>Volte e fale comigo depois de você ter colocado a <itemName>.
Turkish: <yes><itemName> yerleştirildikten sonra gelip benimle konuş.
German: <yes>Sprich mich unbedingt an, wenn du die <itemName> platziert hast.

English: <thinking>Hmmmm....
French: <thinking>Hum....
Russian: <thinking>Хммм...
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>嗯…….
Thai: <thinking>ฮืมมมมม....
Indonesian: <thinking>Hmmmm....
Italian: <thinking>Hmmmm....
Turkish: <thinking>Hmm...
German: <thinking>Hmmmm …

English: <yes>I reckon if we spend a bit of money at his shop, he'll see it's worth while...
French: <yes>Je pense que si on dépense un peu d'argent dans sa boutique, il verra que cela en vaut la peine...
Russian: <yes>Полагаю, если мы потратим немного денег в его лавке, он поймет, что это того стоит...
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>我在想，如果可以去他店里小小消费一下，他肯定也会认为值得…
Japanese: <yes>彼のショップで少々お金を使えば、試す価値はあるとわかってくれるだろう…
Korean: <yes>가게에 가서 돈을 좀 쓰면 그만한 가치가 있겠다고 생각할 거야...
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我覺得如果我們在他的商店花點錢，他就會覺得值得了……
Thai: <yes>ฉันว่าถ้าเราซื้อของที่เต็นท์ของเขาพอสมควร เขาอาจจะรู้สึกว่าคุ้มที่จะลองดูสักตั้ง...
Indonesian: <yes>Kurasa jika kita membelanjakan sedikit uang di tokonya, dia akan merasa ini tidak akan sia-sia...
Italian: <yes>Penso che se spendiamo un po' di soldi nel suo negozio, capirà che ne vale la pena...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Creo que, si gastamos algo de dinero en su tienda, verá que vale la pena…
Portuguese: <yes>Eu acho que se nós gastarmos um pouco de dinheiro na loja dele, ele verá que vale a pena...
Turkish: <yes>Bence dükkânında para harcarsak buranın yaşanır bir yer olduğunu düşünebilir...
German: <yes>Ich denke, wenn wir in seinem Geschäft ein bisschen Geld ausgeben, wird er sehen, dass es sich lohnt …

English: <yes>Oh, and we should show him how friendly people are around here!
French: <yes>Oh, et on devrait lui montrer à quel point les gens sont amicaux ici !
Russian: <yes>О, и стоит показать ему, какие дружелюбные здесь люди!
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>噢，我们应该带他看看这里的人们是多么友善！
Japanese: <yes>ああ、それとここの住民はフレンドリーってことも教えてあげないと！
Korean: <yes>아, 그리고 이곳 사람들이 얼마나 친절한지도 보여줘야지!
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>對了，我們應該讓他看看這裡的人有多熱情！
Thai: <yes>เออใช่ เราควรแสดงให้เขาเห็นด้วยว่าคนแถวนี้เป็นมิตรขนาดไหน!
Indonesian: <yes>Oh, dan kita harus tunjukkan padanya betapa ramahnya orang-orang di sekitar sini!
Italian: <yes>Oh, e dovremmo mostrargli quanto sono amichevoli le persone da queste parti!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Ah, y deberíamos mostrarle lo amistosos que son todos aquí.
Portuguese: <yes>Ah, e temos de mostrar a ele como o pessoal daqui é amigável!
Turkish: <yes>Tabi buradaki insanların ne kadar samimi olduğunu da ona göstermeliyiz!
German: <yes>Oh, und wir sollten ihm zeigen, wie freundlich die Menschen hier sind!

English: Why don't you ask <NPCName> if he has anything he needs done?
French: Pourquoi ne demandes-tu pas à <NPCName> s'il a besoin d'aide pour quelque chose ?
Russian: Почему ты не попросишь, может быть <NPCName> нуждается в какой-то работе?
Chinese (Simplified): 如果<NPCName>有什么事，为何不去问他呢？
Japanese: <NPCName>に何かやってほしいことがないか聞いてきてくれないか？
Korean: <NPCName>씨에게 필요한 게 있는지 물어보는 게 어떠니?
Chinese (Traditional): 你怎麼不問問<NPCName>有沒有什麼需要幫忙的？
Thai: เธอลองไปถาม <NPCName> ดูสิว่าเขาต้องการอะไรไหม
Indonesian: Cobalah untuk bertanya pada <NPCName>, apakah ada sesuatu yang perlu dia lakukan?
Italian: Perché non chiedi a <NPCName> se c'è qualcosa che deve fare?
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Por qué no le preguntamos a <NPCName> si necesita algo?
Portuguese: Por que você não pergunta ao <NPCName> se ele não precisa de ajuda com alguma coisa?
Turkish: <NPCName>'a yapılması gereken bir işi olup olmadığını sorsana.
German: Warum fragst du <NPCName> nicht, ob es etwas für ihn zu erledigen gibt?

English: <haha>If we can prove to him that <IslandName> is a great place to move, I'm sure he'll ask to live here for good!
French: <haha>Si on peut lui prouver que <IslandName> est un superbe endroit où vivre, je suis sûr qu'il demandera à rester ici !
Russian: <haha>Если мы сможем ему доказать, что <IslandName> — отличное место для переезда, он точно захочет остаться здесь навсегда!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>如果可以向他证明<IslandName>是移居的好选择，他肯定会申请长期在此居住！
Japanese: <haha><IslandName>が引っ越しにおあつらえ向きの場所だと思ってもらえれば、永住したいと言ってくれるに違いない！
Korean: <haha><IslandName>이 이사 오기에 좋은 곳이라는 걸 보여준다면 분명히 여기서 계속 살고 싶어 할 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>如果我們能向他證明<IslandName>這裡是個很棒的地方，我相信他一定會想要長住下來！
Thai: <haha>ถ้าเราพิสูจน์ให้เขาเห็นได้ว่าเกาะ <IslandName> เหมาะสำหรับย้ายมาอยู่ ฉันเชื่อว่าเขาจะต้องขอย้ายมาลงหลักปักฐานที่นี่แน่นอน!
Indonesian: <haha>Jika kita bisa membuktikan padanya bahwa <IslandName> adalah tempat yang tepat untuk pindah, aku yakin dia akan meminta untuk tinggal di sini selamanya!
Italian: <haha>Se possiamo dimostrargli che <IslandName> è un ottimo posto in cui trasferirsi, sono sicuro che chiederà di vivere qui per sempre!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>Si podemos demostrarle que <IslandName> es un gran lugar para vivir, creo que querrá mudarse definitivamente.
Portuguese: <haha>Se nós conseguirmos provar a ele que <IslandName> é um excelente lugar para viver, tenho certeza de que ele pedirá para morar aqui de vez!
Turkish: <haha><IslandName> Adası'nın yaşanacak bir yer olduğunu ona kanıtlarsak eminim burada yaşamaya karar verecektir!
German: <haha>Wenn wir ihm beweisen können, dass <IslandName> ein großartiger Ort zum Leben ist, wird er ganz sicher darum bitten, hierher ziehen zu dürfen!

English: You’ll have to spend some <PermitPoints> to get them, but if you keep doing milestones you’ll make enough in no time.
French: Tu devras dépenser quelques <PermitPoints> pour les obtenir, mais si tu continues à obtenir des jalons, tu y arriveras en peu de temps.
Russian: Тебе нужно будет потратить на них немного <PermitPoints>, но если ты будешь и дальше проходить вехи, их скоро будет достаточно.
Chinese (Simplified): 必须花费<PermitPoints>才能获得，不过继续努力完成里程碑，应该很快就可以攒够。
Japanese: 取得するには<PermitPoints>を使わなきゃいけない。でも、マイルストーンを着実に達成していればすぐに十分集まるだろう。
Korean: 그러려면 <PermitPoints>를 좀 써야겠지만, 추억 조각을 계속 모은다면 금방 다시 쌓일 거란다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你需要花點錢來取得<PermitPoints>，但只要你持續完成里程碑，很快就能賺到足夠的錢。
Thai: เธอจะต้องเอา <PermitPoints> มายื่นประกอบการขอด้วย แต่ถ้าเธอบรรลุเส้นชัยไปเรื่อยๆ อีกไม่นาน เธอก็จะมีแต้มมากพอ
Indonesian: Kamu harus mengeluarkan beberapa <PermitPoints> untuk mendapatkannya, tapi jika kamu terus melakukan milestone, kamu bisa mendapatkannya dalam waktu singkat.
Italian: Dovrai spendere un po' di <PermitPoints> per ottenerle, ma se continui a raggiungere obiettivi, ne guadagnerai abbastanza in poco tempo.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Deberás gastar algunos <PermitPoints> para conseguirlas, pero si sigues cumpliendo logros, tendrás suficientes en poco tiempo.
Portuguese: Você terá de gastar alguns <PermitPoints> para obtê-las, mas, se continuar conquistando prêmios, você ganhará o suficiente muito em breve.
Turkish: Bunları almak için biraz <PermitPoints> harcaman gerekecek ama başarı kazandıkça yenilerini biriktirebilirsin.
German: Du musst einige <PermitPoints> ausgeben, um sie zu kriegen, aber wenn du weiterhin Meilensteine erreichst, wirst du in kürzester Zeit genügend beisammen haben.

English: As you get better at doing certain tasks, new <Licence> levels will open up too.
French: À mesure que tu t'améliores pour faire certaines tâches, de nouveaux niveaux de <Licence> deviendront disponibles.
Russian: По мере того как ты будешь лучше справляться с определенными задачами, будут открываться и новые уровни <Licence>.
Chinese (Simplified): 随着特定任务的熟练程度提升，新的<Licence>等级也将开放。
Japanese: あるタスクをうまくこなせるようになると、新しい<Licence>レベルも開放されるよ。
Korean: 작업을 더 잘하게 되면 새로운 <Licence> 레벨도 열릴 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): 隨著你越來越熟練，也會解鎖新的<Licence>等級喔！
Thai: เมื่อเธอทำบางอย่างได้ชำนาญขึ้น เธอก็จะมีสิทธิ์ขอรับ <Licence> ระดับใหม่ๆ ด้วย
Indonesian: Saat kamu makin baik dalam melakukan tugas tertentu, level <Licence> yang baru juga akan terbuka.
Italian: Man mano che migliori nello svolgere determinate attività, saranno disponibili nuovi livelli di <Licence>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): A medida que mejores en determinados aspectos, también se desbloquearán nuevos niveles de <Licence>.
Portuguese: Com seu desempenho melhorando ao realizar algumas tarefas, novos níveis de <Licence> ficarão disponíveis.
Turkish: Belirli görevlerde geliştikçe yeni <Licence> seviyeleri de açılacak.
German: Je mehr du dich im Erledigen bestimmter Aufgaben verbesserst, desto mehr neue <Licence>-Level werden freigeschaltet.

English: Now, let’s see if there is a <Licence> you can apply for right now...
French: Voyons maintenant s'il y a une <Licence> que tu peux demander tout de suite...
Russian: А теперь посмотрим, есть ли <Licence>, на которую можно подать заявку...
Chinese (Simplified): 来看看你目前可以申请的<Licence>…
Japanese: じゃあ、今すぐ申請できる<Licence>がないか確認しようか…
Korean: 이제 당장 신청할 수 있는 <Licence>이 있는지 확인해 볼까...
Chinese (Traditional): 現在，來看看有沒有什麼你可以申請的<Licence>吧……
Thai: เอาละ มาดูกันว่าตอนนี้มี <Licence> อะไรบ้างที่เธอสามารถขอรับได้เลย...
Indonesian: Sekarang, ayo kita lihat apakah ada <Licence> yang bisa kamu minta...
Italian: Ora vediamo se c'è una <Licence> che puoi richiedere adesso...
Spanish (Latin Americas): Veamos si puedes solicitar alguna <Licence> ahora mismo…
Portuguese: Agora, vamos ver se há alguma <Licence> para a qual você já possa se candidatar...
Turkish: Bakalım şu anda başvurabileceğin bir <Licence> var mı...
German: Mal sehen, ob es eine <Licence> gibt, die du jetzt beantragen könntest …

English: I’ll let you decide where the best place for this <itemName> is.
French: Je vais te laisser décider du meilleur emplacement pour ce(tte) <itemName>.
Russian: Тебе решать, где лучшего всего разместить <itemName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 你可以自行决定这件<itemName>放置在什么地方适合。
Japanese: この<itemName>をどこに置くかは、お任せするよ。
Korean: 이 <itemName>에 딱 맞는 곳이 어딘지는 네가 결정하렴.
Chinese (Traditional): 這個<itemName>要放哪裡，交給你決定。
Thai: ฉันจะให้เธอเลือกแล้วกันว่าจะตั้ง <itemName> ที่ไหนดี
Indonesian: Kamu yang menentukan di mana tempat terbaik untuk <itemName> ini.
Italian: Lascerò che sia tu a decidere qual è il posto migliore per questa <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te dejaré decidir cuál es el mejor lugar para la <itemName>.
Portuguese: Vou deixar você decidir qual é o melhor local para este <itemName>.
Turkish: <itemName> için en iyi yerin neresi olacağına sen karar ver.
German: Ich überlasse es dir, zu entscheiden, wo die beste Stelle für diesen <itemName> ist.

English: <haha>Just be sure it's closeby!
French: <haha>Assure-toi seulement que ce soit à proximité !
Russian: <haha>Только убедись, что это поблизости!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>記得放在附近就好！
Thai: <haha>ขอแค่อย่าไปอยู่ที่ไหนไกลก็พอ!
Indonesian: <haha>Pastikan lokasinya dekat!
Italian: <haha>Assicurati solo che sia nelle vicinanze!
Portuguese: <haha>Certifique-se apenas de ser aqui por perto!
Turkish: <haha>Ama yakında olsun ha!
German: <haha>Achte nur darauf, dass es in der Nähe ist!

English: <glee>We want visitors to feel like part of the <IslandName> community while they are here!
French: <glee>Nous voulons que les visiteurs sentent qu'ils font partie de la communauté de <IslandName> quand ils sont ici !
Russian: <glee>Мы хотим, чтобы посетители ощутили себя частью сообщества острова <IslandName>, пока они здесь!
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>希望访客在这里感受到自己是属于<IslandName>社区的一份子！
Japanese: <glee>お客さんの滞在中には、<IslandName>の一員と思って過ごしてほしいんだ！
Korean: <glee>사람들이 이곳에 머무는 동안 <IslandName> 주민이 된 것 같은 기분을 느꼈으면 좋겠구나!
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>我們希望遊客在<IslandName>這裡能感受到自己是這個社區的一份子！
Thai: <glee>เราอยากให้แขกที่มาเยือนรู้สึกเป็นส่วนหนึ่งของชุมชนเกาะ <IslandName>!
Indonesian: <glee>Kami ingin pengunjung merasa menjadi bagian dari masyarakat <IslandName> saat berada di sini!
Italian: <glee>Vogliamo che i visitatori si sentano parte della comunità di <IslandName> mentre sono qui!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Queremos que los visitantes se sientan parte de la comunidad de <IslandName> mientras estén aquí.
Portuguese: <glee>Nós queremos que os visitantes se sintam parte da comunidade de <IslandName> enquanto estiverem por aqui!
Turkish: <glee>Ziyaretçiler buraya geldiklerinde <IslandName> topluluğunun bir parçası gibi hissetmelerini istiyoruz!
German: <glee>Wir möchten, dass sich unsere Besucher auf <IslandName> als Teil der Gemeinschaft fühlen, während sie hier sind!

English: Who knows, maybe we can convince him to set up a permanent shop here!
French: Qui sait, peut-être qu'on arrivera à le convaincre d'installer sa boutique ici de manière permanente !
Russian: Кто знает, может быть, мы убедим их обустроить здесь постоянную лавку!
Chinese (Simplified): 谁知道呢，或许我们能够说服他在此开办永久商店！
Japanese: なんとも言えないけど、ここに常設ショップを設置するよう説得できるかも知れないよ！
Korean: 어쩌면 여기 제대로 된 가게를 차리도록 설득할 수 있을지도 몰라!
Chinese (Traditional): 誰知道呢，也許我們可以說服他在這裡開一家永久的商店！
Thai: ไม่แน่ เราอาจจูงใจให้เขาเลือกมาตั้งร้านค้าถาวรที่นี่ก็ได้!
Indonesian: Siapa tahu, mungkin kita bisa meyakinkannya untuk mendirikan toko permanen di sini!
Italian: Chissà, forse riusciremo a convincerlo ad aprire qui un negozio permanente!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Quién sabe, quizás podamos convencerlo de que instale una tienda permanente aquí.
Portuguese: Bem, quem sabe conseguimos convencê-lo a abrir uma loja permanente aqui!
Turkish: Kim bilir, belki onu burada kalıcı bir dükkân açmaya ikna edebiliriz!
German: Wer weiß, vielleicht können wir ihn davon überzeugen, hier dauerhaft ein Geschäft einzurichten!

English: <yes>Be sure to talk to me once you have placed the <itemName>.
French: <yes>N'oublie pas de revenir me parler une fois que tu auras placé le/la <itemName>.
Russian: <yes>Не забудь обратиться ко мне, когда разместишь <itemName>.
Japanese: <yes><itemName>を設置したら、また話しかけてくれよ。
Korean: <yes><itemName> 배치를 하고 나면 꼭 내게 알려주렴.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>等你放好<itemName>後，記得來找我聊聊喔！
Thai: <yes>พอตั้ง <itemName> เสร็จแล้วก็อย่าลืมมาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: <yes>Pastikan untuk berbicara denganku setelah meletakkan <itemName>.
Italian: <yes>Assicurati di parlare con me una volta che hai posizionato il <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Háblame una vez que hayas colocado la <itemName>.
Portuguese: <yes>Volte e fale comigo depois de você ter colocado a <itemName>.
Turkish: <yes><itemName> yerleştirildikten sonra gelip benimle konuş.
German: <yes>Sprich mich unbedingt an, wenn du die <itemName> platziert hast.

English: G’day there.
French: Hé, salut.
Russian: Привет!
Chinese (Traditional): 你好啊。
Thai: สวัสดี ว่าไง
Indonesian: Hai.
Italian: Ciao.
Turkish: Selam.
German: Hallo.

English: The name’s <myName>.
French: Je m'appelle <myName>.
Russian: Зовут <myName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 我叫<myName>。
Thai: ฉันชื่อ <myName>
Indonesian: Namaku <myName>.
Italian: Mi chiamo <myName>.
Turkish: Adım <myName>.
German: Der Name ist <myName>.

English: I’m <NPCName>’s little brother!
French: Je suis le petit frère de <NPCName> !
Russian: Я младший брат <NPCName>!
Chinese (Traditional): 我是<NPCName>的弟弟！
Thai: ฉันเป็นน้องชายของ <NPCName>
Indonesian: Aku adik dari <NPCName>!
Italian: Sono il fratello minore di <NPCName>!
Portuguese: Eu sou o irmão mais novo de <NPCName>!
Turkish: <NPCName>'un küçük kardeşiyim!
German: Ich bin <NPCName>s kleiner Bruder!

English: <NPCName> said I should come visit <IslandName>.
French: <NPCName> a dit que je devrais venir visiter <IslandName>.
Russian: <NPCName> сказал, что мне надо посетить <IslandName>.
Japanese: <NPCName>から、<IslandName>に行かなきゃと言われたんだ。
Chinese (Traditional): <NPCName>他說我應該來<IslandName>看看。
Thai: <NPCName> บอกให้ฉันมาเยี่ยมเกาะ <IslandName>
Indonesian: <NPCName> bilang aku harus mengunjungi <IslandName>.
Italian: <NPCName> ha detto che dovrei venire a visitare <IslandName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <NPCName> me dijo que tenía que visitar <IslandName>.
Turkish: <NPCName> <IslandName> Adası'nı ziyaret etmemi istedi.
German: <NPCName> sagte, ich sollte <IslandName> mal einen Besuch abstatten.

English: <no>I wasn’t really up for a vacation.
French: <no>Je n'avais pas vraiment envie de partir en vacances.
Russian: <no>Мне было как-то не до отпуска.
Japanese: <no>バカンスに出かけるって気分でじゃなかった。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>我其實沒那麼想去度假。
Thai: <no>จริงๆ แล้วฉันไม่ได้อยากไปเที่ยวที่ไหนเท่าไหร่
Indonesian: <no>Aku sebenarnya tidak ingin berlibur.
Italian: <no>Non avevo molta voglia di una vacanza.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>La verdad es que no buscaba unas vacaciones.
Portuguese: <no>Eu não estava muito afim de férias.
Turkish: <no>Pek tatil havamda değildim.
German: <no>Eigentlich wollte ich gar nicht Urlaub machen.

English: <haha>As soon as he mentioned the amount of fish you could find here, I was booking a ticket!
French: <haha>Dès qu'il m'a parlé de la quantité de poissons qu'on trouve ici, j'ai réservé un billet !
Russian: <haha>Как только он упомянул, сколько рыбы здесь можно найти, я сразу за билетом!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>但一听到他说这里有超多的鱼类，我马上就定好了票！
Japanese: <haha>どれだけたくさんの魚がいるかを聞いたらすぐ、チケットを予約したよ！
Korean: <haha>근데 형이 여기 물고기가 엄청 많대서, 바로 비행기표를 예약했어!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>他一提到這裡有多少魚可以釣，我馬上就訂票了！
Thai: <haha>แต่พอเขาเล่าให้ฟังว่าที่นี่มีปลามากมายขนาดไหน ฉันก็รีบจองตั๋วมาเลย!
Indonesian: <haha>Namun, begitu dia menyebutkan jumlah ikan yang bisa didapatkan di sini, aku langsung memesan tiket!
Italian: <haha>Appena mi ha detto quanti pesci si potevano trovare qui, ho subito prenotato un biglietto!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>Cuando mencionó la cantidad de peces que había aquí, ¡no dudé en sacar el billete!
Portuguese: <haha>Mas, assim que ele falou da quantidade de peixes que eu poderia encontrar aqui, eu fui logo reservar a passagem!
Turkish: <haha>Burada bulabileceğim balık miktarından bahsedince hemen biletimi ayırttım!
German: <haha>Aber als er erwähnte, wie viele Fische man hier finden kann, habe ich sofort ein Ticket gebucht!

English: A place like this would be perfect for a <FishingComp>.
French: Un endroit comme celui-ci serait idéal pour un <FishingComp>.
Russian: Идеальное место, чтобы устроить <FishingComp>.
Chinese (Simplified): 像这样的地方很适合举办<FishingComp>。
Japanese: ここは<FishingComp>に完璧な場所だよ。
Chinese (Traditional): 這裡真是辦<FishingComp>的好地方。
Thai: สถานที่แบบนี้เหมาะที่จะจัด <FishingComp> มากๆ
Indonesian: Tempat seperti ini akan sangat cocok untuk <FishingComp>.
Italian: Un posto come questo sarebbe perfetto per una <FishingComp>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Este tipo de lugar sería perfecto para una <FishingComp>.
Portuguese: Um lugar assim seria perfeito para uma <FishingComp>.
Turkish: Böyle bir yer <FishingComp> için mükemmel olur.
German: Ein Ort wie dieser wäre perfekt für einen <FishingComp>.

English: So I’m hosting one today!
French: Donc, j'en organise un aujourd'hui !
Russian: Так что сегодня будет у меня!
Chinese (Simplified): 我今天正要举办一场比赛！
Chinese (Traditional): 所以我今天要來辦一場！
Thai: วันนี้ฉันก็เลยจัดงานนี้เสียเลย!
Indonesian: Jadi aku mengadakannya hari ini!
Italian: Ecco perché oggi ne organizzo una!
Turkish: Bugün bir yarışma düzenliyorum!
German: Darum veranstalte ich heute einen!

English: Ah, <PlayerName>.þ
French: Ah, <PlayerName>.
Russian: А, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 啊，<PlayerName>。
Thai: อ้าว <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Ah, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Ah, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Ah <PlayerName>.
German: Ah, <PlayerName>.

English: Am I correct in assuming that you have discovered the incredibly rare <itemName>.
French: Est-ce que je me trompe en pensant que tu as découvert le très rare <itemName>.
Russian: Я верно предполагаю, что тебе удалось обнаружить невероятно редкую <itemName>?
Chinese (Simplified): 我没猜错的话，你发现了异常罕见的<itemName>。
Japanese: ひょっとして、とても珍しい<itemName>を見つけたのかな？
Chinese (Traditional): 你是不是發現了那個超級稀有的<itemName>？
Thai: ถ้าฉันเข้าใจไม่ผิด เธอพบ <itemName> ที่หายากยิ่งแล้วใช่ไหม
Indonesian: Kurasa perkiraanku bahwa kamu sudah menemukan <itemName> yang sangat langka itu benar.
Italian: Ho ragione di credere che tu abbia scoperto l'incredibilmente raro <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Tengo razón al suponer que has descubierto el increíblemente raro <itemName>?
Portuguese: É correto da minha parte supor que você descobriu um <itemName> incrivelmente raro?
Turkish: İnanılmaz nadir bulunan bir <itemName> keşfetmişsin, yanılıyor muyum yoksa?
German: Gehe ich recht in der Annahme, dass du das unglaublich seltene <itemName> entdeckt hast?

English: <thinking>I have seen this ore referenced often in the data I have been extracting from the shiny discs.
French: <thinking>J'ai vu beaucoup de références à ce minerai dans les données que j'ai extraites des disques brillants.
Russian: <thinking>Я часто встречал упоминание этой руды в данных, которые я извлекал из блестящих дисков.
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>我从那些闪亮的光盘里提取出了数据，里面经常提到这种矿石。
Japanese: <thinking>光るディスクから集めたデータで、この鉱石のことはよく言及されていた。
Korean: <thinking>빛나는 원반에서 추출한 데이터를 살펴보니 이 광석 이야기를 자주 하더라.
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>我在從那些閃亮的光碟中擷取資料時，常常看到有人提到這種礦石。
Thai: <thinking>ฉันเห็นว่าแร่นี้ถูกกล่าวถึงบ่อยๆ ในข้อมูลที่ฉันดึงออกมาได้จากแผ่นดิสก์วิบวับ
Indonesian: <thinking>Aku sudah sering melihat bijih ini disebutkan dalam data yang aku ekstrak dari disk yang mengilap.
Italian: <thinking>Questo minerale è spesso menzionato nei dati che ho estratto dai dischi luccicanti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>He visto que a menudo mencionan este mineral en los datos que he extraído de los discos brillantes.
Portuguese: <thinking>Eu tenho visto esse minério ser citado frequentemente nos dados que tenho coletado dos CDs.
Turkish: <thinking>Parlak disklerden çıkardığım verilerde sık sık bu cevherden bahsedildiğini görmüştüm.
German: <thinking>In den Daten, die ich von den glänzenden Scheiben extrahiert habe, wurde oft auf dieses Erz hingewiesen.

English: <thinking>However, I must admit, I had assumed that it was a myth...
French: <thinking>Toutefois, je dois l'admettre, je pensais que c'était un mythe...
Russian: <thinking>Однако должен признаться, я предполагал, что это миф...
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>不过，说实话，我原本以为是虚构的…
Japanese: <thinking>しかし、実のところそんなのは作り話とばかり思っていた…
Korean: <thinking>난 사실 그냥 옛날 얘기일 거라고 생각했거든...
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>不過，我得承認，我原本以為這只是個傳說而已……
Thai: <thinking>แต่ถึงอย่างนั้นฉันต้องยอมรับว่า ฉันนึกไปเองว่าแร่นี้เป็นตำนานที่ไม่มีอยู่จริง...
Indonesian: <thinking>Namun, harus kuakui, aku kira itu mitos...
Italian: <thinking>Tuttavia, devo ammettere che avevo dato per scontato che si trattasse di un mito...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Sin embargo, debo admitir que supuse que era un mito…
Portuguese: <thinking>Mas, tenho que admitir, eu achava que ele era um mito...
Turkish: <thinking>Ama bunun bir efsane olabileceğini düşünmüştüm...
German: <thinking>Ich muss allerdings zugeben, dass ich es für einen Mythos gehalten habe …

English: If you could bring me 10 <itemName>, I believe I may have a way to process it into a very useful material.
French: Si tu pouvais m'apporter 10 <itemName>, je pense que je pourrais les transformer en matériau très utile.
Russian: Если ты принесешь мне 10 <itemName>, думаю, я смогу переработать ее в более полезный материал.
Chinese (Simplified): 如果你能带 10 份<itemName>给我，我或许有办法把它加工成非常有用的材料。
Japanese: <itemName>を10個持ってきてくれたら、とても便利な素材に加工する方法が見つかるはずだ。
Korean: <itemName> 10개만 가져다 줄래? 나한테 그걸 유용한 재료로 만들 방법이 있어.
Chinese (Traditional): 如果你能帶給我 10 個<itemName>，我應該有辦法把它加工成很有用的材料喔。
Thai: ถ้าเธอหา <itemName> 10 อันมาให้ฉัน ฉันเชื่อว่าจะสามารถเอาไปแปรเป็นวัสดุที่มากประโยชน์ได้
Indonesian: Jika kamu bisa membawakanku 10 <itemName>, aku yakin aku mungkin punya cara untuk mengolahnya menjadi bahan yang sangat berguna.
Italian: Se potessi portarmi 10 <itemName>, credo di aver trovato il modo di trasformarlo in un materiale molto utile.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si pudieras traerme 10 <itemName>, creo que tengo la manera de procesarlo y convertirlo en un material muy útil.
Portuguese: Se você puder me trazer 10 <itemName>, acredito que posso ter uma forma de processá-los e torná-los um material muito útil.
Turkish: Bana 10 <itemName> getirirsen bunları işleyerek çok kullanışlı bir malzeme üretebilirim.
German: Wenn du mir 10 <itemName> bringen könntest, weiß ich vielleicht einen Weg, es zu einem sehr nützlichen Material zu verarbeiten.

English: Please come back and speak to me once you have collected the <itemName>.
French: Reviens me parler une fois que tu auras collecté le <itemName>.
Russian: Когда соберешь <itemName>, обращайся ко мне.
Japanese: <itemName>が集まったら、戻ってきてくれ。
Korean: <itemName> 다 모으면 돌아와서 말을 걸어 줘.
Chinese (Traditional): 等你收集到<itemName>後，再回來找我聊聊吧！
Thai: ถ้าเก็บรวบรวม <itemName> ได้เมื่อไหร่ก็ให้กลับมาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: Temui aku setelah kamu mengumpulkan <itemName>.
Italian: Torna a parlare con me una volta che hai raccolto il <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Vuelve y háblame una vez que hayas recogido el <itemName>.
Portuguese: Volte e fale comigo depois de você ter coletado o <itemName>.
Turkish: Lütfen <itemName> topladığında gelip benimle konuş.
German: Bitte komm wieder und sprich mit mir, wenn du "<itemName>" gesammelt hast.

English: I’ve already applied for the <itemName>.
French: J'ai déjà fait une demande pour le <itemName>.
Russian: Я уже подал заявку на <itemName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 我已經申請<itemName>了。
Thai: ฉันยื่นขอรับ <itemName> แล้ว
Indonesian: Aku sudah mengajukan permohonan <itemName>.
Italian: Ho già richiesto l'<itemName>.
Turkish: <itemName> için başvuruda bulundum bile.
German: Ich habe "<itemName>" bereits beantragt.

English: <yes>So, come and speak to me if you think we are ready to build it.
French: <yes>Donc, viens me parler si tu penses que nous sommes prêts à le bâtir.
Russian: <yes>Так что обращайся ко мне, если думаешь, что мы готовы это построить.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>你什么时候觉得可以动工，就来找我吧。
Japanese: <yes>作る準備が整い次第、戻ってきてくれ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>所以，如果你覺得我們準備好要建造了，就來找我聊聊吧。
Thai: <yes>ดังนั้นให้กลับมาคุยกับฉันถ้าเธอคิดว่าพร้อมที่จะสร้างแล้ว
Indonesian: <yes>Jadi, datang dan bicaralah padaku jika kamu merasa siap untuk membuatnya.
Italian: <yes>Se pensi che siamo pronti a costruirlo, vieni a parlarne con me.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Así que ven y háblame si crees que podemos construirlo.
Portuguese: <yes>Portanto, venha falar comigo se achar que estamos prontos para construí-lo.
Turkish: <yes>Yapmaya hazır olduğumuzda gelip benimle konuş.
German: <yes>Also komm her und sprich mich an, wenn du meinst, dass wir zum Bauen bereit sind.

English: I’ve got another job for you! You up for it?þ
French: J'ai une autre tâche pour toi ! Ça t'intéresse ?
Korean: 당신을 위한 다른 직업이 있어요! 당신은 그것을 할 준비가 되셨나요?þ
Portuguese: Tenho outro trabalho para você! Tem interesse?

English: You up for it?
French: Ça t'intéresse ?
Russian: У тебя все готово?
Chinese (Traditional): 你準備好了嗎？
Thai: สนใจไหม
Indonesian: Apa kamu siap?
Italian: Ci stai?
Turkish: İster misin?
German: Bist du bereit?

English: That’s a tool I think will be very handy, indeed!
French: Je pense que cet outil sera très utile, en effet !
Russian: Думаю, этот инструмент мне точно пригодится!
Chinese (Simplified): 我觉得那件工具特别好用，真的！
Japanese: 確実に便利な道具だと思うよ！
Chinese (Traditional): 這個工具我覺得超實用的！
Thai: นั่นน่ะเป็นเครื่องมือที่จะมีประโยชน์มากเลยนะ!
Indonesian: Itu alat yang kurasa akan sangat berguna!
Italian: È un attrezzo che sarà davvero molto utile!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Es una herramienta que será muy útil.
Portuguese: Realmente, essa é uma ferramenta que acho que será muito útil!
Turkish: Aslında bu alet bayağı işe yarayacak!
German: Das ist ein Werkzeug, das in der Tat sehr nützlich sein wird!

English: I think we should try and make enough money to buy a <itemName> from <NPCName>.
French: Je pense qu'on devrait essayer de gagner assez d'argent pour acheter un(e) <itemName> à <NPCName>.
Russian: Думаю, надо попробовать и заработать столько, чтобы купить <itemName> у <NPCName>.
Japanese: <NPCName>から<itemName>を買うためにお金を貯めるべきだろう。
Korean: 돈을 충분히 모아서 <NPCName>씨한테서 <itemName> 구매를 하는 게 좋겠다.
Chinese (Traditional): 我覺得我們應該努力賺夠錢，去從<NPCName>那裡買<itemName>。
Thai: ฉันคิดว่าเราควรพยายามหาเงินมาให้พอที่จะซื้อ <itemName> จาก <NPCName>
Indonesian: Kurasa kita harus berusaha mengumpulkan cukup uang untuk membeli <itemName> dari <NPCName>.
Italian: Penso che dovremmo provare a fare abbastanza soldi per comprare un <itemName> da <NPCName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Creo que deberíamos juntar algo de dinero para comprarle una <itemName> a <NPCName>.
Portuguese: Eu acho que deveríamos tentar ganhar dinheiro suficiente para comprar <itemName> de <NPCName>.
Turkish: Bence para biriktirip <NPCName>'dan <itemName> satın almalıyız.
German: Ich denke, wir sollten versuchen, genug Geld zu verdienen, um "<itemName>" von <NPCName> zu kaufen.

English: Here is my half of the Dinks. The rest is up to you!
French: Voici ma part des Dinks. À toi de trouver le reste !
Russian: Вот моя половина Динков. Остальные ты!
Chinese (Simplified): 这些汀克币归我，剩下的给你！
Japanese: ディンクは半分もらっておく。あとはお任せするよ！
Korean: 자, 여기 필요한 딩크 중 절반이야. 나머지는 네 몫이란다!
Chinese (Traditional): 這是我這邊的丁克幣，剩下的就交給你啦！
Thai: นี่ดิงครึ่งนึงส่วนของฉัน เธอไปหาอีกครึ่งนึงเอาเองนะ!
Indonesian: Ini setengah dari Dink milikku. Sisanya terserah padamu!
Italian: Ecco la mia metà dei Dink. Il resto spetta a te!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Aquí están mis dinks. La otra mitad te corresponde a ti.
Portuguese: Aqui está minha metade dos Dinks. O restante é com você!
Turkish: Kendi payıma düşen Dink'leri sana veriyorum. Gerisi sende!
German: Hier ist meine Hälfte der Dinks. Der Rest liegt bei dir!

English: Maybe you could go catch some of the bugs around here?
French: Peut-être que tu pourrais aller attraper des insectes par ici ?
Russian: Может быть, тебе половить козявок в этих местах?
Chinese (Simplified): 也许你可以去捕捉这里的昆虫？
Japanese: ここらの虫をちょっと捕まえてきてくれるかな？
Korean: 이 주변에서 곤충을 좀 잡는 건 어떠니?
Chinese (Traditional): 或許你可以去這附近抓幾隻昆蟲？
Thai: ลองไปจับแมลงแถวๆ นี้ดูไหม
Indonesian: Mungkin kamu bisa menangkap beberapa serangga di sekitar sini?
Italian: Forse potresti andare a catturare qualche insetto da queste parti?
Spanish (Latin Americas): Quizás podrías capturar algunos de los insectos de por aquí.
Portuguese: Talvez você pudesse apanhar alguns dos insetos que temos por aqui?
Turkish: Çevredeki böcekleri yakalayabilirsin belki.
German: Vielleicht könntest du ein paar Krabbeltiere fangen gehen?

English: Or maybe you could cook some of that fruit you found?
French: Ou peut-être que tu pourrais cuisiner certains des fruits que tu as trouvés ?
Russian: Или, возможно, ты приготовишь какие-то из найденных фруктов?
Chinese (Simplified): 又或者烹饪一些找到的果实？
Japanese: それか、見かけたフルーツを調理してもらえる？
Chinese (Traditional): 或許你可以用你找到的那些水果來煮點什麼？
Thai: หรือไม่ก็เอาผลไม้ที่เก็บได้มาปรุงอาหารดู
Indonesian: Atau mungkin kamu bisa memasak beberapa buah yang kamu temukan?
Italian: Oppure potresti cucinare un po' della frutta che hai trovato?
Spanish (Latin Americas): O podrías cocinar algunas de las frutas que hallaste.
Portuguese: Ou talvez pudesse cozinhar algumas daquelas frutas que você encontrou?
Turkish: Belki de bulduğun meyveleri pişirirsin, ne dersin?
German: Oder du könntest etwas von dem Obst zubereiten, das du gefunden hast?

English: <glee>For every milestone you surpass, you’ll be rewarded with <PermitPoints>.
French: <glee>Pour chaque jalon que tu passes, tu recevras des <PermitPoints> en récompense.
Russian: <glee>За каждую пройденную веху тебе полагаются в награду <PermitPoints>.
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>每达成一座里程碑，你将获得<PermitPoints>奖励。
Japanese: <glee>マイルストーンを達成するごとに、<PermitPoints>がもらえるよ。
Korean: <glee>추억 조각을 모을 때마다 <PermitPoints> 보상을 받을 수 있단다.
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>每當你達成一個里程碑，就會獲得<PermitPoints>獎勵喔！
Thai: <glee>ทุกครั้งที่บรรลุเส้นชัย เธอจะได้รับ <PermitPoints> เป็นรางวัล
Indonesian: <glee>Untuk setiap milestone yang kamu raih, kamu akan diberi imbalan <PermitPoints>.
Italian: <glee>Per ogni obiettivo che superi, sarai ricompensato con <PermitPoints>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Por cada logro que cumplas, obtendrás <PermitPoints> como recompensa.
Portuguese: <glee>Por cada prêmio que você conquista, você receberá <PermitPoints> como recompensa.
Turkish: <glee>Kazandığın her başarı için <PermitPoints> alacaksın.
German: <glee>Für jeden Meilenstein, den du erreichst, wirst du mit <PermitPoints> belohnt.

English: <yes>I'll tell you what, you're going to want a lot of <PermitPoints> eventually.
French: <yes>Laisse-moi te dire une chose, tu finiras par vouloir beaucoup de <PermitPoints>.
Russian: <yes>Вот что тебе скажу, в конечном итоге тебе нужно будет много <PermitPoints>.
Japanese: <yes>今後、<PermitPoints>が大量に必要になってくるよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我跟你說，你之後一定會需要很多<PermitPoints>。
Thai: <yes>รู้ไหม เดี๋ยวเธอก็มีเหตุให้ต้องใช้ <PermitPoints> จำนวนมาก
Indonesian: <yes>Aku yakin, kamu nanti pasti ingin punya banyak <PermitPoints>.
Italian: <yes>Sai che ti dico? Alla fine vorrai un sacco di <PermitPoints>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Te diré algo, a la larga necesitarás muchos <PermitPoints>.
Portuguese: <yes>Vou dizer uma coisa, vai chegar o momento em que você vai querer muitos <PermitPoints>.
Turkish: <yes>Zamanla bir sürü <PermitPoints>na ihtiyacın olacak.
German: <yes>Ich sage dir, du wirst irgendwann eine Menge <PermitPoints> haben wollen.

English: <no>But we can talk more about that tomorrow.
French: <no>Mais nous pourrons en reparler demain.
Russian: <no>Но мы подробнее обсудим это завтра.
Japanese: <no>それについては明日詳しく話そう。
Korean: <no>하지만 그 문제는 내일 더 자세히 얘기하자꾸나.
Chinese (Traditional): <no>不過這些我們明天再聊吧。
Thai: <no>แต่ไว้เราค่อยคุยรายละเอียดกันพรุ่งนี้
Indonesian: <no>Namun, kita bisa membahasnya lagi besok.
Italian: <no>Ma ne parleremo meglio domani.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Pero podemos seguir hablando de eso mañana.
Portuguese: <no>Mas podemos falar mais sobre isso amanhã.
Turkish: <no>Ama bunu yarın konuşuruz.
German: <no>Aber darüber können wir uns morgen weiter unterhalten.

English: <yes>For now, check out the journal.
French: <yes>Pour l'instant, lis le journal.
Russian: <yes>А пока посмотри дневник.
Japanese: <yes>今はジャーナルをチェックしておいてね。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>現在，先看看日記吧。
Thai: <yes>ตอนนี้เธอลองไปเปิดดูสมุดบันทึกเถอะ
Indonesian: <yes>Untuk saat ini, periksa jurnalnya.
Italian: <yes>Per ora, dai un'occhiata al diario.
Portuguese: <yes>Por enquanto, dê uma olhada no diário.
Turkish: <yes>Şimdilik günlüğüne göz at.
German: <yes>Sieh dir jetzt erst einmal das Tagebuch an.

English: <shocked>I think you’ll find that you’ve actually completed some of the milestones inside.
French: <shocked>Je pense que tu découvriras que tu as déjà passé certains des jalons répertoriés à l'intérieur.
Russian: <shocked>Думаю, ты там обнаружишь, что некоторые вехи уже пройдены.
Chinese (Simplified): <shocked>我想你已经达成了一些上面的里程碑。
Japanese: <shocked>もう、おそらくマイルストーンをいくつか達成済みだよ。
Korean: <shocked>벌써 저널에 있는 추억 조각 몇 개는 완료했을 거란다.
Chinese (Traditional): <shocked>我覺得你會發現其實你已經完成一些裡面的里程碑了。
Thai: <shocked>ฉันคิดว่าเธอน่าจะบรรลุเส้นชัยบางข้อไปแล้วเรียบร้อย
Indonesian: <shocked>Kamu akan tahu jika sudah menyelesaikan beberapa milestone di dalamnya.
Italian: <shocked>Penso che scoprirai di aver raggiunto alcuni degli obiettivi indicati.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <shocked>Creo que allí verás que ya has alcanzado algunos de los logros.
Portuguese: <shocked>Acho que você verá que já conquistou alguns dos prêmios mencionados lá.
Turkish: <shocked>Günlüğün içindeki başarılardan bazılarını kazandığını göreceksin.
German: <shocked>Vielleicht stellst du fest, dass du einige der darin enthaltenen Meilensteine tatsächlich schon erreicht hast.

English: So be sure to claim them. <glee>
French: Alors n'oublie pas de les réclamer. <glee>
Russian: Так что не забудь получить их. <glee>
Japanese: 受け取るのを忘れないでね。<glee>
Chinese (Traditional): 記得去領取獎勵喔。<glee>
Thai: ดังนั้นอย่าลืมรับรางวัลนะ <glee>
Indonesian: Jadi, pastikan untuk mengeklaimnya. <glee>
Italian: Assicurati di riscuoterli. <glee>
Turkish: Onları almayı unutma. <glee>
German: Du solltest sie also unbedingt einfordern. <glee>

English: <yes>Now, are you hungry? I am.
French: <yes>Alors, est-ce que tu as faim ? Moi, oui.
Russian: <yes>Тебе еще не хочется есть? Мне да.
Japanese: <yes>今おなかはすいてる？私はすいてる。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>現在，你餓了嗎？我餓了。
Thai: <yes>เอาละ เธอหิวไหม ฉันหิวจังเลย
Indonesian: <yes>Apa kamu lapar? Aku lapar.
Italian: <yes>Hai fame? Io sì.
Portuguese: <yes>Agora, você está com fome? Eu estou.
Turkish: <yes>Aç mısın? Ben açım.
German: <yes>Und, hast du Hunger? Ich schon.

English: <haha>I think it's just about lunch time.
French: <haha>Je pense qu'il est presque l'heure du déjeuner.
Russian: <haha>Думаю, уже пора обедать.
Japanese: <haha>ちょうどお昼の時間みたいだよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>我覺得差不多是午餐時間了。
Thai: <haha>นี่น่าจะถึงเวลากินมื้อเที่ยงแล้ว
Indonesian: <haha>Sepertinya sudah waktunya makan siang.
Italian: <haha>Penso che sia quasi ora di pranzo.
Portuguese: <haha>Acho que já é quase a hora do almoço.
Turkish: <haha>Öğle yemeği vakti gelmiş olmalı.
German: <haha>Ich glaube, es ist gerade Mittagszeit.

English: <glee>I’ve seen fruit growing around this island and that sounds tasty!
French: <glee>J'ai vu des fruits pousser sur cette île et ils ont l'air délicieux !
Russian: <glee>На этом острове повсюду растут фрукты, и это звучит вкусно!
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>岛屿到处生长着果实，看上去很美味！
Japanese: <glee>島じゅうに果物が育っているし、美味しそうだよ！
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>我在這座島上看到長了不少水果，感覺一定很好吃！
Thai: <glee>ฉันเห็นไม้ผลออกลูกอยู่ทั่วเกาะเลย ท่าทางน่ากินมาก!
Indonesian: <glee>Aku pernah melihat buah yang tumbuh di sekitar pulau ini dan kelihatannya enak!
Italian: <glee>Ho visto crescere della frutta su quest'isola e sembra deliziosa!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>He visto que en la isla crecen frutas, ¡y parecen deliciosas!
Portuguese: <glee>Eu vi frutas crescendo pela ilha e elas parecem deliciosas!
Turkish: <glee>Adada meyve yetiştiğini gördüm, eminim çok lezzetlidir!
German: <glee>Ich habe gesehen, dass auf dieser Insel Früchte wachsen, das klingt doch lecker!

English: <yes>You go and find us some fruit and when you get back I will show you how to craft a <itemName>.
French: <yes>Vas nous trouver des fruits et à ton retour, je te montrerai comment fabriquer un(e) <itemName>.
Russian: <yes>Пойди достань фруктов, а когда вернешься, я покажу, как изготовить <itemName>.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>你先去找些果实，回来之后我会教你如何制作<itemName>。
Japanese: <yes>フルーツを探してきてくれたら、<itemName>の作り方を教えてあげるよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>你去幫我們找些水果，等你回來後，我會教你怎麼製作<itemName>。
Thai: <yes>เดี๋ยวเธอออกไปเก็บผลไม้มากินกันนะ แล้วพอเธอกลับมา ฉันจะสอนวิธีประดิษฐ์ <itemName>
Indonesian: <yes>Pergi dan carilah beberapa buah. Begitu kamu kembali, akan kutunjukkan cara membuat <itemName>.
Italian: <yes>Vai a prenderci un po' di frutta e quando torni ti mostrerò come creare un <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Ve y consíguenos algunas frutas, y a tu regreso te mostraré como fabricar una <itemName>.
Portuguese: <yes>Vá lá e encontre umas frutas para nós. Quando você voltar, vou mostrar como fazer uma <itemName>.
Turkish: <yes>Şimdi gidip biraz meyve bul. Döndüğünde <itemName> nasıl yapılır sana göstereceğim.
German: <yes>Du gehst los und besorgst uns ein paar Früchte, und wenn du zurückkommst, zeige ich dir, wie man "<itemName>" bastelt.

English: I'm ready!
French: Je suis prêt(e) !
Russian: Могу начинать!
Chinese (Traditional): 我準備好了！
Thai: ฉันพร้อมลุย!
Indonesian: Aku siap!
Italian: Sono pronto!
Turkish: Hazırım!
German: Ich bin bereit!

English: Not yet.
French: Pas encore.
Russian: Еще нет.
Chinese (Traditional): 還沒。
Thai: ยังไม่ใช่ตอนนี้
Indonesian: Belum.
Italian: Non ancora.
Turkish: Henüz değil.
German: Noch nicht.

English: Not yet.
French: Pas encore.
Russian: Еще нет.
Chinese (Traditional): 還沒。
Thai: ยังไม่ใช่ตอนนี้
Indonesian: Belum.
Italian: Non ancora.
Turkish: Henüz değil.
German: Noch nicht.

English: If we are going to build anything around here we’re going to need materials.þ
French: Si nous voulons construire quelque chose ici, nous allons avoir besoin de matériaux.
