Russian: Если мы собираемся здесь что-то построить, нам нужны будут материалы.
Chinese (Simplified): 在这里修建任何建筑都需要材料。
Japanese: この周りに建物を建てるなら、素材が必要になるよ。
Korean: 이 근처에서 뭔가를 만들려면 재료가 필요해.
Chinese (Traditional): 如果我們要在這裡建造任何東西，我們就需要材料。
Thai: ถ้าอยากจะสร้างอะไรแถวนี้ เราก็ต้องหาวัสดุมาให้ครบก่อน
Indonesian: Jika kita ingin membangun sesuatu di sekitar sini, kita butuh bahan.
Italian: Se vogliamo costruire qualcosa da queste parti, avremo bisogno di materiali.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si queremos construir algo por aquí, vamos a necesitar materiales.
Portuguese: Se nós vamos construir alguma coisa por aqui, vamos precisar de alguns materiais.
Turkish: Buralarda bir şeyler inşa edeceksek malzemeye ihtiyacımız olacak.
German: Wenn wir hier etwas bauen wollen, brauchen wir Materialien.

English: I reckon we need to wood and Tin. þ
French: Je pense que nous aurons besoin de bois et d'étain.
Russian: Полагаю, понадобятся древесина и олово.
Japanese: 木材とスズは確実に必要だね。
Chinese (Traditional): 我覺得我們需要木材和錫礦。
Thai: ฉันว่าเราต้องใช้ไม้กับดีบุก
Indonesian: Kurasa kita perlu kayu dan Timah.
Italian: Credo che ci servano legno e stagno.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Creo que precisaremos madera y estaño.
Portuguese: Acho que vamos precisar de madeira e estanho.
Turkish: Odun ve Kalay gerekecek sanırım.
German: Ich denke, wir brauchen Holz und Zinn.

English: Now, wood? That’s easy. You chop down a tree and then you’ve got some wood.þ <yes>
French: Alors, le bois ? C'est facile. Tu abats un arbre et tu as du bois. <yes>
Russian: Итак, древесина? Легко. Срубаешь дерево и вот тебе древесина.þ <yes>
Chinese (Simplified): 获取木材很简单，砍倒树就能得到木材。þ<yes>
Japanese: 木材なら簡単だよ。木を切れば木材が手に入る！þ<yes>
Korean: 목재는 구하기 쉽지. 나무를 베면 나오니까.þ <yes>
Chinese (Traditional): 木材？這很簡單啊。你只要砍倒一棵樹，就能得到木材了。þ<yes>
Thai: เอาละ ไม้น่ะหาไม่ยาก แค่ตัดต้นไม้สักต้นเราก็ได้ไม้มาแล้ว <yes>
Indonesian: Kayu? Itu mudah. Tinggal tebang pohon dan kamu akan mendapatkan kayu.þ <yes>
Italian: Ora, il legno? È facile. Abbatti un albero e hai del legno.þ <yes>
Spanish (Latin Americas): La madera es fácil. Derribas un árbol y conseguirás un poco. <yes>
Portuguese: Bem, madeira? Isso é fácil. Você corta uma árvore e já consegue madeira. <yes>
Turkish: Odun mu? Kolay. Bir ağacı kestiğinde odun elde edersin.þ <yes>
German: Also, Holz? Das ist ganz einfach. Du fällst einen Baum und dann hast du Holz.þ <yes>

English: But Tin? That’s a bit trickier. I’ve seen it around the island poking out of rocks here and there. It’s a dark ore. You’ll know it if you see it.<yes>
French: Mais l'étain ? C'est un peu plus compliqué. J'en ai vu ici et là dans des pierres sur l'île. C'est un minerai sombre. Tu le reconnaîtras en le voyant.<yes>
Russian: А вот олово... Это посложнее. Оно тут по всему острову торчит из скал. Темная такая руда. Узнаешь, если увидишь.<yes>
Chinese (Simplified): 而锡比较难弄。我在岛上见过锡，这是一种黑色矿石，时不时从岩石里露出来，你看见就知道了。<yes>
Japanese: スズはちょっと面倒だね。島のあちこちにある岩からちょろっと出ているのを見たよ。暗い色をした鉱石だ。見れば分かると思うよ。<yes>
Korean: 하지만 주석은 좀 더 까다로워. 섬 곳곳에 있는 돌에 튀어나와 있는 걸 봤단다. 어두운 색의 광석이야. 보면 알 게다.<yes>
Chinese (Traditional): 錫礦？這就有點麻煩了。我在島上這裡那裡的岩石中看到過。它是一種深色的礦石，你看到就會認出來。<yes>
Thai: แต่ดีบุกนี่สิที่หายากหน่อย ฉันเห็นแร่นี้แทรกอยู่ตามหินทั่วไปหมด เป็นแร่สีเข้มๆ ถ้าได้เห็นสักอันเธอก็จะรู้เอง<yes>
Indonesian: Namun, Timah? Itu lebih sulit. Aku pernah melihatnya di sekitar pulau, menyembul dari bebatuan di sana-sini. Bijih berwarna gelap. Kamu akan langsung tahu begitu melihatnya.<yes>
Italian: Ma lo stagno? Quello è un po' più complicato. Ho visto spuntare dalle rocce qua e là per l'isola. È un minerale scuro. Lo riconoscerai se lo vedi.<yes>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pero el estaño es más complicado. He visto que sobresale de algunas rocas. Es un mineral oscuro, así que lo reconocerás cuando lo veas.<yes>
Portuguese: Mas, estanho? Isso já é mais complicado. Eu vi esse metal saindo de umas rochas aqui pela ilha. É um minério escuro. Você conseguirá reconhecer caso o encontre.<yes>
Turkish: Ama Kalay! O biraz daha zor. Adada bazı kayaların üstünden çıktıklarını gördüm. Siyah bir cevher. Gördüğünde anlayacaksın.<yes>
German: Aber Zinn? Das ist ein bisschen schwieriger. Ich habe es auf der Insel gesehen, wie es hier und da aus den Felsen ragt. Es ist ein dunkles Erz. Du wirst es erkennen, wenn du es siehst.<yes>

English: Now, we’re going to need to smelt it down into bars before we can use the Tin Ore for building things. <thinking>
French: Alors, nous devrons le fusionner en barres avant de pouvoir utiliser le minerai d'étain pour bâtir des choses. <thinking>
Russian: Теперь нам нужно будет выплавить его в слитки, прежде чем мы сможем использовать оловянную руду для постройки чего-либо. <thinking>
Chinese (Simplified): 锡矿必须先炼制成锡条，才能用于建造。<thinking>
Japanese: スズ鉱石を建設に使うには、精錬して延べ棒にしなきゃいけない。<thinking>
Korean: 주석 광석을 건축에 사용하려면 녹여서 주괴로 만들어야 한단다. <thinking>
Chinese (Traditional): 現在，我們得先把錫礦石熔煉成錠，才能用來建造東西。<thinking>
Thai: เอาละ เราจะต้องหลอมมันให้เป็นแท่งก่อนถึงจะเอาแร่ดีบุกไปใช้สร้างอะไรได้ <thinking>
Indonesian: Kita harus meleburnya menjadi batangan sebelum kita bisa menggunakan Bijih Timah untuk membuat sesuatu. <thinking>
Italian: Dovremo fonderlo in lingotti prima di poter utilizzare il minerale di stagno per costruire oggetti. <thinking>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Tendremos que fundir el mineral de estaño y convertirlo en barras antes de poder usarlo para construir. <thinking>
Portuguese: Agora, nós vamos precisar derretê-lo em barras antes de poder usar o minério de estanho para construir coisas. <thinking>
Turkish: Şimdi bir şeyler inşa etmek için Kalay Cevherini kullanmadan önce bu cevheri eritip külçelere dönüştürmemiz gerekiyor. <thinking>
German: Wir werden es zu Barren einschmelzen müssen, bevor wir das Zinnerz zum Bauen verwenden können. <thinking>

English: Go give the island a bit of a looky-loo for <questRequiredItems>.
French: Jette un coup d'œil un peu partout sur l'île pour trouver des <questRequiredItems>.
Russian: Пойди и осмотри остров на предмет <questRequiredItems>.
Chinese (Simplified): 在岛上四处逛逛，看能不能找到<questRequiredItems>。
Japanese: ちょっと島を回って<questRequiredItems>を見つけておいで。
Chinese (Traditional): 去島上逛逛，找看看有沒有<questRequiredItems>。
Thai: ให้เธอออกไปสอดส่องหา <questRequiredItems> บนเกาะนี้นะ
Indonesian: Pergilah untuk mencari <questRequiredItems> di sekitaran pulau ini.
Italian: Fai un giro dell'isola per trovare un po' di <questRequiredItems>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Recorre un poco la isla en busca de <questRequiredItems>.
Portuguese: Dê uma volta pela ilha e procure por <questRequiredItems>.
Turkish: Gidip adada <questRequiredItems> arayabilirsin.
German: Sieh dich auf der Insel mal ein wenig nach <questRequiredItems> um.

English: Bring them back here and I'll show you how we can turn Tin Ore into bars. <glee>
French: Rapporte-les ici et je te montrerai comment transformer du minerai d'étain en barres. <glee>
Russian: Неси их сюда и я покажу, как превратить оловянную руду в слитки. <glee>
Chinese (Simplified): 找到之后带回来，我给你演示怎么把锡矿炼制成锡条。<glee>
Japanese: 持ってきてくれたら、スズ鉱石を延べ棒にする方法を教えてあげるから。<glee>
Korean: 여기로 가져오면 주석 광석을 주괴로 만드는 방법을 알려주마. <glee>
Chinese (Traditional): 你把錫礦帶回來，我教你怎麼煉成錠。<glee>
Thai: แล้วเอากลับมาที่นี่ เดี๋ยวฉันจะสอนวิธีเปลี่ยนแร่ดีบุกให้เป็นแท่ง <glee>
Indonesian: Bawa pulang beberapa, dan akan kutunjukkan bagaimana kita bisa mengubah Bijih Timah menjadi batangan. <glee>
Italian: Portali qui e ti mostrerò come possiamo trasformare il minerale di stagno in lingotti. <glee>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Tráelos para que te muestre cómo podemos convertir el mineral de estaño en barras. <glee>
Portuguese: Traga o que encontrar para cá e eu vou mostrar a você como transformar o minério de estanho em barras. <glee>
Turkish: Bulduktan sonra buraya getir, ben de sana Kalay Cevherini külçelere nasıl dönüştürebileceğimizi göstereceğim. <glee>
German: Bring es hierher zurück, und ich zeige dir, wie wir Zinnerz in Barren verwandeln können. <glee>

English: <proud>Once you’ve gathered everything we need, come and see me!
French: <proud>Une fois que tu auras rassemblé tout ce dont nous avons besoin, reviens me voir !
Russian: <proud>Когда соберешь все необходимое, приходи ко мне!
Chinese (Simplified): <proud>收集完需要的材料，就来见我！
Japanese: <proud>必要なものがすべて揃ったら、また戻っておいで！
Chinese (Traditional): <proud>收集好我們需要的東西後，就來找我吧！
Thai: <proud>ถ้าเธอรวบรวมทุกอย่างที่ต้องใช้ครบแล้วก็มาหาฉันนะ!
Indonesian: <proud>Setelah kamu mengumpulkan semua yang kita butuhkan, datang dan temui aku!
Italian: <proud>Una volta che avrai raccolto tutto quello di cui abbiamo bisogno, vieni a trovarmi!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <proud>Una vez que hayas conseguido todo lo necesario, ven a verme.
Portuguese: <proud>Assim que você juntar tudo o que precisamos, venha me encontrar!
Turkish: <proud>İhtiyacımız olan her şeyi topladıktan sonra yanıma gel!
German: <proud>Wenn du alles zusammen hast, was wir brauchen, komm zu mir!

English: Righto then.
French: D'ac, alors.
Russian: Тогда заметано.
Chinese (Traditional): 好喔，那就這樣吧。
Thai: อือ เอาละ
Indonesian: Baiklah kalau begitu.
Italian: D'accordo, allora.
Turkish: Tamamdır.
German: Also dann.

English: Come see me soon, okay?
French: Viens me voir bientôt, ok ?
Russian: Приходи побыстрее, хорошо?
Japanese: すぐに帰ってくるんだよ？
Chinese (Traditional): 趕快來找我，好嗎？
Thai: เดี๋ยวกลับมาหาฉันนะ โอเคไหม
Indonesian: Segera temui aku, oke?
Italian: Vieni a trovarmi presto, ok?
Portuguese: Venha me ver em breve, ok?
Turkish: Seni bekliyorum, tamam mı?
German: Komm bald vorbei, okay?

English: If you are tired, pop that on the ground and have a lay down.
French: Lorsque tu es fatigué, mets cela sur le sol et allonge-toi.
Russian: Если устанешь, положи это на землю и приляг.
Chinese (Simplified): 要是觉得累了，就把它铺在地上，躺上去休息。
Japanese: 疲れたら、それを地面に置いて横になったらいいよ。
Korean: 피곤할 때는 그걸 바닥에 놓고 누워봐.
Chinese (Traditional): 如果你累了，就把那個放在地上，躺下休息一下吧。
Thai: ถ้าเธอง่วง ก็ปูสิ่งนี้ลงบนพื้นแล้วลงไปนอนได้เลย
Indonesian: Jika kamu lelah, taruh itu di tanah dan berbaringlah.
Italian: Se vuoi riposarti, mettilo a terra e sdraiati.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si te agotas, ponla en el piso y descansa un poco.
Portuguese: Se o cansaço bater, coloque aquilo no chão e se deite um pouco.
Turkish: Yorgunsan yere at ve üzerine uzan.
German: Wenn du müde bist, wirf das auf den Boden und hau dich aufs Ohr.

English: <haha>I'll tell you what, a good nights rest will do us both good!
French: <haha>Laisse-moi te dire une chose, une bonne nuit de repos nous fera du bien à tous les deux !
Russian: <haha>Вот что тебе скажу, хороший ночной отдых пойдет на пользу и тебе и мне!
Japanese: <haha>夜はよく寝るのがお互いのためさ！
Korean: <haha>네가 잠을 푹 자면 너도 좋고, 나도 좋단다!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>我跟你說，好好睡一覺對我們兩個都會有幫助的！
Thai: <haha>รู้ไหม การนอนให้เต็มอิ่มน่ะดีสำหรับเราทั้งคู่นะ!
Indonesian: <haha>Biar kuberi tahu, istirahat yang cukup akan membuat kita berdua sehat!
Italian: <haha>Sai che ti dico? Una buona notte di riposo farà bene a entrambi!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>Te diré algo, una buena noche de descanso nos vendrá bien.
Portuguese: <haha>Vou dizer uma coisa... uma boa noite de descanso fará muito bem a nós dois!
Turkish: <haha>İyi bir gece uykusu ikimize de iyi gelecek!
German: <haha>Ich sage dir, eine gesunde Nachtruhe wird uns beiden gut tun!

English: Thanks for your help today, <PlayerName>.
French: Merci pour ton aide aujourd'hui, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Спасибо тебе за сегодняшнюю помощь, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 今天真的謝謝你的幫忙，<PlayerName>！
Thai: ขอบคุณที่ช่วยฉันในวันนี้นะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Terima kasih atas bantuanmu hari ini, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Grazie per il tuo aiuto di oggi, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Bugünkü yardımların için teşekkürler <PlayerName>.
German: Danke für deine Hilfe heute, <PlayerName>.

English: I can't believe we're on <IslandName>!
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire qu'on soit sur <IslandName> !
Russian: Не верится, что мы на острове <IslandName>!
Chinese (Simplified): 难以置信，我们竟然是在<IslandName>！
Chinese (Traditional): 我真不敢相信我們已經在<IslandName>了！
Thai: ไม่อยากจะเชื่อเลยว่าตอนนี้เราอยู่บนเกาะ <IslandName>!
Indonesian: Aku tidak percaya kita sudah sampai di <IslandName>!
Italian: Non posso credere che siamo su <IslandName>!
Portuguese: Eu nem acredito que estamos em <IslandName>!
Turkish: <IslandName> Adası'nda olduğumuza inanamıyorum!
German: Ich kann nicht glauben, dass wir auf <IslandName> sind!

English: <glee>I couldn't have done any of this without you!
French: <glee>Je n'aurais pas pu y arriver sans toi !
Russian: <glee>В одиночку я бы ничего этого без тебя не смогла!
Japanese: <glee>アンタの助けがなければ何もできなかったよ！
Korean: <glee>네가 없었다면 이 모든 일을 해내지 못했을 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>沒有你，我根本做不到這些事！
Thai: <glee>ทั้งหมดนี้คงเป็นไปไม่ได้เลยถ้าไม่ได้เธอช่วย!
Indonesian: <glee>Aku tidak bisa melakukan semua ini tanpamu!
Italian: <glee>Non avrei potuto fare niente di tutto questo senza di te!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>No podría haber hecho nada de esto sin ti.
Portuguese: <glee>Eu não conseguiria ter feito nada disso sem você!
Turkish: <glee>Sen olmasan bunların hiçbirini yapamazdım!
German: <glee>Ohne dich hätte ich das alles nicht geschafft!

English: <yes>Righto.
French: <yes>D'ac.
Russian: <yes>Заметано.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>好喔。
Thai: <yes>อือ
Indonesian: <yes>Baiklah.
Italian: <yes>Va bene.
Turkish: <yes>Tamamdır.
German: <yes>Alles klar.

English: You've been helping out a lot, so take your time, <PlayerName>.
French: Tu as beaucoup aidé, alors prends ton temps, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Ты много помогаешь, так что не торопись, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 你已经帮了很大的忙，所以别着急，慢慢来，<PlayerName>。
Japanese: <PlayerName>はいっぱいやってくれたんだから、ゆっくりしてね。
Korean: 넌 벌써 많은 도움이 되었어. 그러니 쉬엄쉬엄 하렴, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): <PlayerName>，你最近幫了很多忙，放輕鬆，慢慢來吧。
Thai: เธอกำลังช่วยทำหลายสิ่งหลายอย่างมาก ดังนั้นไม่ต้องรีบร้อนนะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Kamu sudah banyak membantu, jadi gunakan waktumu sebaik-baiknya, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Il tuo aiuto è stato prezioso: prenditi il tempo che ti serve, <PlayerName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Me has ayudado un montón, así que tómate tu tiempo, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Você tem ajudado muito. Portanto, faça as coisas no seu ritmo, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Yardımcı olmak için çok çalıştın, o yüzden acele etme <PlayerName>.
German: Du warst eine große Hilfe, also nimm dir Zeit, <PlayerName>.

English: <glee>Just come back and see me when you're ready.
French: <glee>Reviens me voir quand tu seras prêt.
Russian: <glee>Просто приходи ко мне, когда все будет готово.
Japanese: <glee>準備ができたら戻っておいで。
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>等你準備好了再回來找我吧。
Thai: <glee>แค่ว่าถ้าเธอพร้อมเมื่อไหร่ก็มาหาฉัน
Indonesian: <glee>Kembalilah dan temui aku saat kamu sudah siap.
Italian: <glee>Torna a trovarmi quando sei pronto.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Vuelve a verme cuando tengas todo listo.
Portuguese: <glee>Volte e venha me ver apenas quando você tiver se organizado.
Turkish: <glee>Hazır olduğunda yanıma gelmen yeterli.
German: <glee>Komm einfach zu mir zurück, wenn du soweit bist.

English: <haha>It’s kind of overwhelming!
French: <haha>C'est un peu impressionnant !

English: Hey <PlayerName>. Want a pet dog?
French: Hé <PlayerName>. Tu veux un chien de compagnie ?
Russian: Привет, <PlayerName>. Хочешь завести собаку?
Chinese (Traditional): 嘿，<PlayerName>。想養隻狗嗎？
Thai: นี่ <PlayerName> อยากเลี้ยงน้องหมาไหม
Indonesian: Hai <PlayerName>. Mau anjing peliharaan?
Italian: Ehi <PlayerName>, vuoi un cane?
Portuguese: Ei, <PlayerName>. Quer ter um cachorro como animal de estimação?
Turkish: Hey <PlayerName>. Evcil köpek ister miydin?
German: Hallo <PlayerName>. Möchtest du einen Hund als Haustier?

English: <yes>If you do place this <itemName> somewhere and come and speak to me.
French: <yes>Si c'est le cas, mets ce <itemName> quelque part et viens me parler.
Russian: <yes>Если ты разместишь <itemName> где-либо, обратись ко мне.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>如果想养，把<itemName>放置在某处，然后来找我。
Japanese: <yes><itemName>を設置したら、戻ってきてくれ。
Korean: <yes>이 <itemName> 놓을 곳을 찾았다면 설치하고 나서 알려줘.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>如果你把這個<itemName>放在某個地方，然後來找我聊聊。
Thai: <yes>ถ้าเธอเอา <itemName> อันนี้ไปตั้งไว้ตรงไหนสักที่เสร็จแล้วก็ให้กลับมาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: <yes>Jika ya, letakkan <itemName> ini di suatu tempat dan datang dan bicaralah padaku.
Italian: <yes>Se posizioni questo <itemName> da qualche parte, vieni a parlarmi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Si es así, coloca esta <itemName> en algún lado y ven a hablar conmigo.
Portuguese: <yes>Se quiser, coloque este <itemName> em algum lugar e venha falar comigo.
Turkish: <yes>İstersen bu <itemName> için bir yer bul ve gelip benimle konuş.
German: <yes>Wenn ja, platziere diese <itemName> irgendwo und sprich mich an.

English: So, this is where you decided to build, huh?
French: Donc, c'est là que tu as décidé de bâtir, hein ?
Russian: Значит, вот здесь будем строить, да?
Japanese: ここに建てると決めたんだね？
Chinese (Traditional): 所以，你決定在這裡蓋房子啊？
Thai: ตกลงเธอตัดสินใจตั้งเต็นท์ตรงนี้เนอะ
Indonesian: Jadi, di sinilah kamu memutuskan untuk membangunnya, ya?
Italian: Quindi è qui che hai deciso di costruire, eh?
Portuguese: Então, foi aqui que você decidiu construir, né?
Turkish: Demek buraya koymaya karar verdin.
German: Also hier möchtest du bauen, ja?

English: <glee>It’s absolutely perfect! Our new home here on <IslandName>!
French: <glee>C'est absolument parfait ! Notre nouvelle maison sur <IslandName> !
Russian: <glee>Идеально! Наш новый дом на острове <IslandName>!
Chinese (Simplified): <glee>我们在<IslandName>的新家！实在是太完美了！
Chinese (Traditional): <glee>這裡真是太棒了！我們的新家就在<IslandName>這裡！
Thai: <glee>ยอดเยี่ยมมาก! นี่แหละ บ้านใหม่ของเราบนเกาะ <IslandName>!
Indonesian: <glee>Benar-benar sempurna! Rumah baru kita di <IslandName> sini!
Italian: <glee>È assolutamente perfetto! La nostra nuova casa qui su <IslandName>!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee>Nuestro nuevo hogar aquí en <IslandName> es absolutamente perfecto.
Portuguese: <glee>É simplesmente perfeito! Nossa nova casa aqui em <IslandName>!
Turkish: <glee>Kesinlikle mükemmel! Burası <IslandName> Adası'ndaki yeni evimiz!
German: <glee>Das ist absolut perfekt! Unser neues Zuhause hier auf <IslandName>!

English: Thank you so much for setting up the Base Tent.<yes>
French: Merci beaucoup d'avoir installé la tente principale.<yes>
Russian: Большое тебе спасибо за установку простой палатки.<yes>
Japanese: 拠点テントを作ってくれてありがとう。<yes>
Chinese (Traditional): 謝謝你幫忙搭建基礎帳篷。<yes>
Thai: ขอบคุณมากเลยที่ตั้งเต็นท์ฐาน<yes>
Indonesian: Terima kasih banyak telah mendirikan Tenda Dasar.<yes>
Italian: Grazie mille per aver montato la tenda base.<yes>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Muchas gracias por instalar la tienda de campaña base.<yes>
Portuguese: Agradeço muito por você ter instalado a Barraca de Apoio.<yes>
Turkish: Ana Çadırı kurduğun için teşekkür ederim.<yes>
German: Vielen Dank, dass du das Basiszelt eingerichtet hast.<yes>

English: Oh, and guess what? I actually have a <itemName> for you too! <haha>
French: Oh, et devines ? J'ai un(e) <itemName> pour toi aussi ! <haha>
Russian: О, и угадай что? У меня на самом деле и для тебя есть <itemName>! <haha>
Chinese (Simplified): 噢，你猜怎么着？我也为你准备了<itemName>！<haha>
Japanese: そしてなんとなんと？アンタにも<itemName>を用意しているよ！<haha>
Chinese (Traditional): 喔，對了，你猜猜怎麼了？我其實也有個<itemName>要送給你！<haha>
Thai: อ๋อ แล้วรู้อะไรใหม่ ฉันมี <itemName> มอบให้เป็นของเธอเองด้วยนะ! <haha>
Indonesian: Oh, dan coba tebak? Aku sebenarnya juga punya <itemName> untukmu! <haha>
Italian: E indovina un po'? Ho un <itemName> anche per te! <haha>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Ah, ¿y adivina qué? También tengo una <itemName> para ti. <haha>
Portuguese: Ah, e adivinha? Eu tenho um <itemName> para você também! <haha>
Turkish: Bil bakalım başka ne var? Senin için de bir <itemName> getirdim! <haha>
German: Oh, und weißt du was? Ich habe tatsächlich auch eine <itemName> für dich! <haha>

English: <shy>I know it's not much but it will be a place you can call home!
French: <shy>Je sais que ce n'est pas grand-chose, mais c'est un endroit que tu pourras considérer comme ton chez-toi !
Russian: <shy>Знаю, что немного, но это будет место, которое ты сможешь назвать домом!
Chinese (Simplified): <shy>虽然不是特别贵重的东西，但至少可以当作家！
Japanese: <shy>大したものじゃないが、家と呼ぶにふさわしいものになるよ！
Korean: <shy>그렇게 좋은 건 아니지만, 집처럼 편안히 쉴 수 있을 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): <shy>我知道這地方不大，但至少你可以把它當成自己的家！
Thai: <shy>ถึงจะไม่ใช่อะไรมากมาย แต่ก็เรียกได้ว่าเป็นที่พักกายใจ!
Indonesian: <shy>Aku tahu ini tidak seberapa, tapi ini akan menjadi tempat yang bisa disebut rumah!
Italian: <shy>So che non è molto, ma è comunque una casa!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <shy>Sé que no es mucho, pero podrás decir que es tu hogar.
Portuguese: <shy>Eu sei que não é muito, mas será um local que você poderá chamar de lar!
Turkish: <shy>Çok büyük bir şey değil ama burası senin evin olacak.
German: <shy>Ich weiß, es ist nichts Luxuriöses, aber es wird ein Ort sein, den du dein Zuhause nennen kannst!

English: Now, there is plenty of room to spread out here on <IslandName>.
French: Il y a beaucoup d'espace disponible ici sur <IslandName>.
Russian: Теперь здесь на острове <IslandName> достаточно места, чтобы развернуться.
Japanese: <IslandName>にはスペースがたっぷりとできた。
Chinese (Traditional): 現在這裡有很多空間可以讓你在<IslandName>上盡情發揮。
Thai: เอาละ เกาะ <IslandName> มีที่ทางให้เลือกมากมาย
Indonesian: Nah, ada banyak ruang untuk menyebar di <IslandName>.
Italian: C'è un sacco di spazio per espandersi qui su <IslandName>.
Portuguese: Agora, há muito espaço por descobrir aqui em <IslandName>.
Turkish: <IslandName> Adası'nda bol bol boş alan var.
German: Hier auf <IslandName> gibt es viel Platz, um sich auszubreiten.

English: So please take your time to place your <itemName>.
French: Alors, s'il te plaît, prends ton temps pour placer ta <itemName>.
Russian: Так что, пожалуйста, не торопись и размести <itemName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 你可以找时间慢慢放置<itemName>。
Japanese: じっくり時間をかけて<itemName>を設置してくれ。
Korean: 그러니 잠시 시간을 내어 <itemName> 설치를 하렴.
Chinese (Traditional): 請慢慢來，隨時放置你的<itemName>。
Thai: ดังนั้นค่อยๆ หาที่ตั้ง <itemName> ไป ไม่ต้องรีบร้อน
Indonesian: Jadi, silakan luangkan waktu untuk menempatkan <itemName> milikmu.
Italian: Prenditi il tuo tempo per posizionare il <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Así que tómate tu tiempo para colocar tu <itemName>.
Portuguese: Portanto, vá com calma e escolha bem onde colocar sua <itemName>.
Turkish: <itemName> kurmak için vaktin de var.
German: Nimm dir daher bitte Zeit, deine <itemName> zu platzieren.

English: <yes>You’ll probably be visiting the Base Tent a fair bit.
French: <yes>Tu viendras probablement souvent dans la tente principale.
Russian: <yes>Вероятно, ты частенько будешь посещать простую палатку.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>基础帐篷是需要经常出入的地方。
Japanese: <yes>今後、拠点テントには何度も来ることになるよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>你應該會常常去基礎帳篷逛逛。
Thai: <yes>เธออาจมีเหตุให้ต้องแวะมาเต็นท์ฐานบ่อยๆ
Indonesian: <yes>Kamu mungkin akan sering mengunjungi Tenda Dasar.
Italian: <yes>Probabilmente visiterai la tenda base per parecchio tempo.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Es probable que visites la tienda de campaña base a menudo.
Portuguese: <yes>É bem provável que você visite a Barraca de Apoio com certa frequência.
Turkish: <yes>Muhtemelen Ana Çadırı sık sık ziyaret edeceksin.
German: <yes>Wahrscheinlich wirst du öfters das Basiszelt besuchen.

English: <thinking>So keep that in mind while you are looking for a spot to claim as your own.
French: <thinking>Alors, garde cela à l'esprit lors de ta recherche d'un endroit qui deviendra le tien.
Russian: <thinking>Так что помни об этом, пока ищешь место, которое сможешь назвать своим.
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>在寻找属于自己那片小天地时，请牢记这一点。
Japanese: <thinking>自分の場所を決める際には、それを念頭に置いておくことだね。
Korean: <thinking>뭔가 설치할 곳을 찾을 때는 그걸 꼭 기억하렴.
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>所以在找尋屬於自己的地點時，記得要考慮這一點喔。
Thai: <thinking>ดังนั้นระหว่างที่มองหาจุดตั้งรกรากก็อย่าลืมคิดถึงเรื่องนี้นะ
Indonesian: <thinking>Jadi ingatlah hal itu saat kamu mencari tempat untuk diklaim sebagai milikmu.
Italian: <thinking>Tienilo presente mentre cerchi un posto di cui assumere la proprietà.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Así que tenlo en cuenta cuando busques un lugar para reclamar como tuyo.
Portuguese: <thinking>Tenha isso em mente enquanto procura um cantinho para chamar de seu.
Turkish: <thinking>Kendi çadırına yer ararken bunu da aklında bulundur.
German: <thinking>Behalte das im Hinterkopf, wenn du einen Platz aussuchst, den du für dich beanspruchen möchtest.

English: I’ll be inside the Base Tent getting things ready.
French: Je serai dans la tente principale à tout préparer.
Russian: Я буду в простой палатке, подготовлю там все.
Chinese (Simplified): 我会在基础帐篷里着手准备工作。
Japanese: 拠点テントの中で準備しておくよ。
Korean: 나는 베이스텐트 안에서 여러 가지를 준비하고 있으마.
Chinese (Traditional): 我會在基礎帳篷裡準備東西。
Thai: เดี๋ยวฉันจะอยู่ในเต็นท์ฐานเพื่อเตรียมทุกอย่างให้พร้อม
Indonesian: Aku akan berada di dalam Tenda Dasar untuk menyiapkan segala sesuatunya.
Italian: Sarò dentro la tenda base a preparare tutto.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Estaré dentro de la tienda de campaña base preparando todo.
Portuguese: Estarei na Barraca de Apoio organizando as coisas.
Turkish: Çeşitli hazırlıklar yapmak için Ana Çadırda olacağım.
German: Ich bin dann im Basiszelt und bereite alles vor.

English: Come and speak to me once you’ve placed your <itemName>.
French: Reviens me parler une fois que tu auras placé ta <itemName>.
Russian: Обращайся ко мне, когда разместишь <itemName>.
Japanese: <itemName>を設置したら、戻ってきてくれ。
Chinese (Traditional): 等你放好<itemName>後，來找我聊聊吧！
Thai: ถ้าตั้ง <itemName> ของเธอเสร็จแล้วก็เข้ามาคุยกับฉันนะ
Indonesian: Datang dan temui aku setelah kamu menempatkan <itemName>.
Italian: Vieni a parlarmi dopo che hai posizionato il <itemName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Ven y habla conmigo una vez que hayas colocado tu <itemName>.
Portuguese: Venha falar comigo depois de instalar sua <itemName>.
Turkish: <itemName>ını yerleştirdikten sonra gelip benimle konuş.
German: Komm her und sprich mit mir, wenn du deine <itemName> platziert hast!

English: Feel free to use the <itemName> in the Base Tent whenever you want.
French: N'hésite pas à utiliser <itemName> dans la tente principale quand tu le veux.
Russian: Можешь использовать <itemName> в палатке, когда захочется.
Chinese (Simplified): 基础帐篷的<itemName>随时都能使用。
Japanese: 必要なときは、拠点テントの<itemName>を使ってね。
Chinese (Traditional): 隨時都可以在基礎帳篷中使用<itemName>。
Thai: ใช้ <itemName> ในเต็นท์ฐานได้เลยตามชอบนะ
Indonesian: Jangan ragu untuk menggunakan <itemName> di Tenda Dasar kapan pun kamu mau.
Italian: Puoi usare il <itemName> nella tenda base quando vuoi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Usa la <itemName> de la tienda de campaña base cuando lo desees.
Portuguese: Fique à vontade para usar <itemName> na Barraca de Apoio sempre que quiser.
Turkish: İstediğin zaman Ana Çadırdaki <itemName>nı kullanabilirsin.
German: Nutze einfach den <itemName> im Basiszelt, wann immer du möchtest.

English: I'll tell you what, I'm sure you'll learn how to craft lots of useful things here on <IslandName>!
French: Laisse-moi te dire une chose, je suis sûr(e) que tu vas apprendre à fabriquer beaucoup de choses utiles ici sur <IslandName> !
Russian: Вот что тебе скажу, я уверена, ты научишься создавать много полезных вещей здесь на острове <IslandName>!
Chinese (Simplified): 在<IslandName>可以学会制作许多有用的物品！
Japanese: <IslandName>では、便利な道具の作り方をたくさん覚えることになるだろうね！
Korean: 분명 <IslandName> 섬에서 여러가지 유용한 물건을 만드는 법을 배우게 될 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): 我跟你說，你一定會在<IslandName>這裡學到很多實用的製作技巧！
Thai: รู้ไหม ฉันเชื่อว่าเดี๋ยวอีกหน่อยเธอก็รู้วิธีประดิษฐ์ของใช้ต่างๆ มากมายที่มีประโยชน์บนเกาะ <IslandName> นี้!
Indonesian: Aku yakin kamu akan belajar cara membuat banyak hal yang berguna di <IslandName> ini!
Italian: Sai che ti dico? Sono sicura che imparerai a creare un sacco di cose utili qui a <IslandName>!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te diré algo, no tengo dudas de que aprenderás a fabricar muchos objetos útiles aquí en <IslandName>.
Portuguese: Vou dizer uma coisa, tenho certeza de que você aprenderá a criar muitas coisas úteis aqui em <IslandName>!
Turkish: Eminim <IslandName> Adası'nda bir sürü kullanışlı şey yapmayı öğreneceksin!
German: Ich bin mir sicher, dass du hier auf <IslandName> lernen wirst, viele nützliche Dinge herzustellen!

English: <thinking>You'll want to eat a lot of food to keep your energy up!
French: <thinking>Tu dois manger beaucoup de nourriture pour garder un niveau d'énergie élevé !
Korean: <생각>에너지를 유지하려면 음식을 많이 먹고 싶을 거예요!
Portuguese: <thinking>Você vai querer comer muito para manter bons níveis de energia!

English: <no>If you want to sleep under the stars, I'm not going to stop you.
French: <no>Si tu veux dormir à la belle étoile, je ne vais pas t'en empêcher.
Portuguese: <no>Se você quiser dormir sob as estrelas, eu não vou impedir.

English: <thinking>Museums are very important for society.
French: <thinking>Les musées sont très importants pour la société.
Portuguese: <thinking>Os museus são muito importantes para a sociedade.

English: Imagine if we just kept all the old stuff where we found it?
French: Imagine si on laissait les vieilles choses là où on les trouve ?
Korean: 우리가 발견한 모든 오래된 물건을 그대로 보관해 둔다면 어떨까요?
Portuguese: Imagine se nós deixássemos todas as coisas antigas onde as encontramos?

English: <worried>It would be all over the place!
French: <worried>Il y en aurait partout !

English: <shocked>Chaos!
French: <shocked>Le chaos !

English: <yes>I’ve really been enjoying documenting all the new species on this island.
French: <yes>J'ai vraiment pris du plaisir à documenter toutes les nouvelles espèces sur cette île.
Korean: <yes>저는 이 섬의 모든 새로운 종을 기록하는 것을 정말 즐겼습니다.
Portuguese: <yes>Eu tenho gostado muito de documentar todas as novas espécies desta ilha.

English: <glee>To tell you the truth though, filing the documentation is nearly as enjoyable!
French: <glee>Mais pour te dire la vérité, remplir les documents me fait presque autant plaisir !
Korean: <glee>하지만 사실을 말하자면 문서를 제출하는 것도 거의 즐겁습니다!
Portuguese: <glee>Mas, para dizer a verdade, o preenchimento da documentação também é muito agradável!

English: <worried>Fish and bugs are very interesting, but I really don't like touching either...
French: <worried>Les poissons et les insectes sont très intéressants, mais je n'aime pas vraiment toucher ni l'un ni l'autre...
Korean: <걱정>물고기나 벌레는 정말 재미있는데 만지는 것도 별로 안 좋아하는데...
Portuguese: <worried>Peixes e insetos são muito interessantes, mas não gosto de tocá-los...

English: <yes>That’s fine though.
French: <yes>Mais c'est bien.

English: <proud>After all, things in a museum are for looking at, not touching.
French: <proud>Après tout, les choses dans un musée sont faites pour qu'on les regarde, pas pour qu'on les touche.
Korean: <proud>결국 박물관에 있는 물건은 보기 위한 것이지 만지기 위한 것이 아닙니다.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <proud>Después de todo, los museos son para mirar, no para tocar.
Portuguese: <proud>Afinal, as coisas em um museu devem ser olhadas, não tocadas.

English: <thinking>I’ve been wondering if there could be a way to catalogue air?
French: <thinking>Je me demande s'il existe une façon de cataloguer l'air ?
Portuguese: <thinking>Tenho me perguntado se existiria uma forma de catalogar o ar.

English: Would you be interested in seeing an air exhibit, <PlayerName>?
French: Aimerais-tu voir une exposition sur l'air, <PlayerName> ?
Portuguese: Você teria interesse em ver uma exposição sobre o ar, <PlayerName>?

English: Oh yeah!
French: Oh oui !

English: Not Really
French: Pas vraiment

English: <glee> See, I had a feeling you were a fellow air-head!
French: <glee> Tu vois, il me semblait bien que tu étais aussi un passionné d'air !
Korean: <glee> 보세요, 당신이 정말 대단한 사람이라는 느낌이 들었어요!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <glee> ¡Sabía que no me ibas a desairar!
Portuguese: <glee> Bem, eu tinha a impressão de que você também era uma pessoa que anda com a cabeça no ar!

English: I’ll ask around town and see if I can find some more people who are interested! <glee>þ
French: Je vais demander en ville pour voir si d'autres personnes seraient intéressées ! <glee>
Korean: 동네에 물어보고 관심 있는 사람을 더 찾을 수 있는지 알아보겠습니다! <글리>þ
Portuguese: Vou ver se encontro mais pessoas da cidade interessadas no tema! <glee>

English: <sigh>þAh, that’s a shame. I’ve already collected a bunch of specimens in some jars...
French: <sigh>Ah, quel dommage. J'ai déjà recueilli quelques spécimens dans des bocaux...
Korean: <한숨>þ아, 아쉽네요. 나는 이미 몇몇 항아리에 많은 표본을 수집했습니다...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <sigh>Ah, qué pena. Ya he recolectado algunas muestras en jarros…
Portuguese: <sigh>Ah, que pena. Eu já coletei um monte de espécimes em alguns potes...

English: <thinking>Paperwork can be very time consuming.
French: <thinking>La paperasserie peut prendre beaucoup de temps.
Korean: <thinking>서류 작업은 시간이 많이 걸릴 수 있습니다.

English: <haha>But they say time flies when you are having fun!
French: <haha>Mais on dit que le temps passe vite quand on s'amuse !
Portuguese: <haha>Mas dizem que o tempo voa quando estamos nos divertindo!

English: <yes>If you ever take a great photo and you want to show it off, please come and display it in the museum.
French: <yes>Si un jour tu prends une belle photo que tu aimerais montrer à tout le monde, viens l'exposer au musée.
Korean: <yes>멋진 사진을 찍어 자랑하고 싶다면 박물관에 오셔서 전시해 보세요.
Portuguese: <yes>Se você tirar uma boa foto um dia e quiser mostrá-la, venha exibi-la no museu.

English: <yes>Don't worry, I will fill out the required forms for you!
French: <yes>Ne t'inquiète pas, je remplirai tous les formulaires pour toi !
Portuguese: <yes>Não se preocupe, eu preencho os formulários necessários para você!

English: <glee>It would be my absolute pleasure!
French: <glee>Ce serait vraiment un plaisir pour moi !

English: <proud>It’s so great to have a one stop shop to look at all the interesting stuff around here.
French: <proud>C'est vraiment super d'avoir une boutique unique pour regarder tout ce qu'il y a d'intéressant par ici.
Korean: <proud>여기 주변의 흥미로운 것들을 모두 볼 수 있는 원스톱 상점이 있다는 것은 정말 멋진 일입니다.
Portuguese: <proud>É tão bom ter um local específico onde podemos ver todas as coisas interessantes daqui.

English: What?
French: Quoi ?

English: <shocked>John’s Goods?
French: <shocked>La Boutique de John ?

English: <no>No, no, no.
French: <no>Non, non, non.

English: <angry>I meant the museum!
French: <angry>Je parlais du musée !

English: <glee>There are so many new species to study here on <IslandName>!
French: <glee>Il y a tellement de nouvelles espèces à étudier ici sur <IslandName> !
Portuguese: <glee>Há tantas novas espécies para estudar em <IslandName>!

English: <worried> Oh no!
French: <worried> Oh non !

English: <no>I don’t mean I’m going to cut them open!
French: <no>Je ne veux pas dire que je vais les découper et les ouvrir !
Portuguese: <no>Não, eu não vou abrir os animais!

English: <proud>Here at the <IslandName> museum we only study by observing!
French: <proud>Ici au musée de <IslandName> on étudie seulement en observant !
Portuguese: <proud>Aqui, no museu de <IslandName>, nós estudamos apenas observando!

English: <thinking>Imagine if we could take everything on <IslandName> and put it in a museum!
French: <thinking>Imagine si on pouvait prendre tout ce qu'il y a sur <IslandName> et le mettre dans un musée !
Korean: <thinking><IslandName>의 모든 것을 박물관에 전시할 수 있다고 상상해 보세요!
Portuguese: <thinking>Imagine se nós pudéssemos pegar tudo de <IslandName> e colocar em um museu!

English: <proud>That way, when people wanted to see a certain thing, they could just make their way to that wing!
French: <proud>Ainsi, si les gens veulent voir certaines choses, ils peuvent simplement se rendre dans la bonne allée !
Korean: <proud>그렇게 하면 사람들이 어떤 것을 보고 싶을 때 그 쪽 날개로 갈 수 있었어요!
Portuguese: <proud>Assim, quando as pessoas quisessem ver uma determinada coisa, bastaria que se dirigissem à ala apropriada!

English: Studying things is just my job.
French: Étudier les choses, ce n'est que mon travail.
Portuguese: Estudar coisas é só o meu trabalho.

English: <yes>I have plenty of other hobbies.
French: <yes>J'ai plein d'autres loisirs.

English: <glee>For example, in my spare time I like to talk about all the things I’ve been studying.
French: <glee>Par exemple, pendant mon temps libre j'aime bien parler de toutes les choses que j'ai étudiées.
Korean: <glee>예를 들어, 나는 여가 시간에 내가 공부한 모든 것에 대해 이야기하는 것을 좋아합니다.
Portuguese: <glee>Por exemplo, no meu tempo livre, eu gosto de falar sobre todas as coisas que venho estudando.

English: <thinking>I think one day we’ll see a Museum of Museums.
French: <thinking>Je pense qu'un jour on verra un Musée des musées.
Korean: <생각>언젠가는 박물관 중의 박물관을 보게 될 것 같아요.
Portuguese: <thinking>Eu acho que um dia teremos um Museu de museus.

English: <yes>Truly the pinnacle of society.
French: <yes>Le vrai point d'orgue de la société.

English: All that knowledge, all those exhibits, all that paperwork!
French: Toutes ces connaissances, toutes ces expositions, toute cette paperasserie !
Korean: 그 모든 지식, 그 모든 전시물, 그 모든 서류 작업!
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¡Todo ese conocimiento, todas esas muestras, todo ese papeleo!
Portuguese: Todo aquele conhecimento, todas aquelas exposições, toda aquela papelada!

English: <glee>So beautiful.
French: <glee>Magnifique.

English: <thinking>I'd love to experience some more travelling one day.
French: <thinking>J'aimerais voyager davantage un jour.

English: <no>As long as I don't have to actually go anywhere else, of course.
French: <no>Tant que je n'ai pas besoin d'aller ailleurs, bien sûr.
Korean: <no>물론 실제로 다른 곳으로 갈 필요가 없다면 말이죠.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Siempre y cuando no tenga que ir realmente a ningún lugar, claro.
Portuguese: <no>Desde que eu não tenha de ir realmente a lugar nenhum, claro.

English: <pumped>We could get exhibits from all over the world, and bring them right to <IslandName>!
French: <pumped>On pourrait amener des expositions du monde entier ici sur <IslandName> !
Korean: <pumped>전 세계에서 전시품을 가져와 <IslandName>으로 가져갈 수 있어요!
Portuguese: <pumped>Nós poderíamos ter exposições de todo o mundo aqui em <IslandName>!

English: <no>I don’t go outside too much.
French: <no>Je ne sors pas beaucoup.

English: <worried>There’s not enough order out there so it can get a bit overwhelming.
French: <worried>Il n'y a pas assez d'ordre dehors, alors cela peut devenir un peu écrasant.
Portuguese: <worried>Não há ordem suficiente lá fora. E, assim, a situação pode ficar intensa demais.

English: <worried>All the plants and people and animals are just going around doing whatever they want, all over the place!
French: <worried>Les plantes et les gens et les animaux se promènent et font ce qu'ils veulent, n'importe où !
Korean: <걱정> 온갖 식물과 사람과 동물들이 여기저기서 자기 하고 싶은 대로 하고 돌아다니고 있어요!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <worried>Las plantas, los animales y las personas andan por ahí haciendo lo que quieren, ¡por todos lados!
Portuguese: <worried>Todas as plantas, pessoas e animais estão apenas por aí fazendo o que querem, em todo lugar!

English: <shocked>Chaos!
French: <shocked>Le chaos !

English: <thinking>There’s so many different ways to organise things and group them together.
French: <thinking>Il existe tellement de façons différentes d'organiser les choses et de les regrouper.
Portuguese: <thinking>Há tantas formas diferentes de organizar e agrupar as coisas.

English: <yes>Playing around with them can be exciting.
French: <yes>S'amuser avec peut être passionnant.
Korean: <yes>그들과 함께 노는 것은 흥미로울 수 있습니다.

English: <pumped>Sometimes I’ll go around and rearrange everything alphabetically, then by height, and sometimes even by smell!
French: <pumped>Parfois, je réorganise tout par ordre alphabétique, puis par hauteur, et parfois même par odeur !
Korean: <pumped>가끔은 모든 것을 알파벳순으로, 그 다음에는 높이순으로, 때로는 냄새순으로 재배치합니다!
Portuguese: <pumped>Às vezes, eu dou uma mexida nas coisas e reorganizo tudo por ordem alfabética, depois por altura e, em algumas ocasiões, até por cheiro!

English: <yes>That last one is really easy to do, because everything smells like disinfectant, like it should.þ
French: <yes>Cette dernière est facile à faire, car tout sent le désinfectant, à juste titre.
Korean: <yes>마지막 작업은 정말 쉽습니다. 왜냐하면 모든 것에서 소독제 냄새가 나기 때문입니다.þ
Portuguese: <yes>A parte do cheiro é muito fácil de fazer, porque tudo cheira a desinfetante, como deveria.

English: <shy>Sometimes I like to climb into an empty case and pretend I’M the exhibit.
French: <shy>Parfois, j'aime entrer dans une caisse vide et prétendre que JE suis l'exposition.
Korean: <shy>때로는 빈 케이스에 올라가서 내가 전시물인 척하는 걸 좋아해요.
Portuguese: <shy>Às vezes eu gosto de subir em uma caixa vazia e fingir que estou em exposição.

English: <haha>I’m a perfect candidate too, because I never try and escape.
French: <haha>Et je suis le parfait candidat, car je n'essaye jamais de m'échapper.
Korean: <하하>저도 딱 맞는 후보예요. 절대 도망치려고 하지 않으니까요.
Portuguese: <haha>Também é verdade que sou a pessoa perfeita para isso, porque eu nunca tento fugir.

English: <shy>Sometimes I stand really really still and pretend I’m a statue...
French: <shy>Parfois, je reste debout et vraiment immobile, et je prétends que je suis une statue...
Korean: <shy>가끔은 정말 정말 가만히 서서 동상인 척...
Portuguese: <shy>Às vezes, eu fico imóvel e finjo que sou uma estátua...

English: <haha>It makes me feel marble-ous!þ
French: <haha>Cela me fait me sentir marbre-veilleux !

English: Just a little museum humour for you, <PlayerName>.
French: Une petite touche d'humour de musée pour toi, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Um pouquinho de humor museológico para você, <PlayerName>.

English: <thinking>It must be nice to be getting watched all day.
French: <thinking>Cela doit être bien d'être regardé toute la journée.
Portuguese: <thinking>Deve ser bom ter as pessoas olhando para você durante todo o dia.

English: <worried>I don’t think I could handle the attention though.
French: <worried>Mais je ne pense pas que je pourrais supporter l'attention.
Korean: <걱정> 그래도 관심을 감당할 수 없을 것 같아요.
Portuguese: <worried>No entanto, acho que eu não conseguiria lidar bem com toda a atenção.

English: <thinking>Though, maybe if people formed an orderly queue it wouldn’t freak me out so much?
French: <thinking>Cela dit, peut-être que si les gens formaient une file ordonnée, cela ne m'angoisserait pas autant ?
Korean: <생각>그렇지만 사람들이 질서정연하게 줄을 서면 별로 놀라지 않을 수도 있겠죠?
Portuguese: <thinking>Se as pessoas fizessem uma fila bem organizada, talvez o choque não fosse tão grande.

English: <yes>I’m a huge fan of music.
French: <yes>Je suis un grand fan de musique.

English: <no>I don’t listen to it, of course, it’s far too noisy.
French: <no>Je n'en écoute pas, bien sûr, cela fait beaucoup trop de bruit.
Portuguese: <no>Não ouço, claro, porque é barulhenta demais.

English: But there’s so many different ways to catalogue and arrange it.
French: Mais il existe tellement de façons différentes de la cataloguer et de l'organiser.
Korean: 하지만 목록을 작성하고 정리하는 방법은 매우 다양합니다.
Portuguese: Mas há tantas formas diferentes de catalogar e organizar músicas.

English: <thinking>You can organise by artist, genre, length, beats per minute…
French: <thinking>On peut l'organiser par artiste, genre, durée, battements par minute…
Korean: <thinking>아티스트, 장르, 길이, 분당 비트별로 정리할 수 있습니다…
Portuguese: <thinking>Podem ser organizadas por artista, gênero, duração, batidas por minuto...

English: <glee>So many possibilities!
French: <glee>Il y a tellement de possibilités !

English: <glee>What a beautiful day it is!
French: <glee>Quelle belle journée !

English: <yes>Perfect weather to be indoors and studying!
French: <yes>C'est le temps parfait pour rester à l'intérieur et étudier !
Portuguese: <yes>Clima perfeito para ficar dentro de casa e estudar!

English: <glee>I just love the smell of fresh paper.
French: <glee>J'aime l'odeur du papier neuf.
Portuguese: <glee>Eu adoro o cheiro de papel novo.

English: <yes>All neatly arranged, lined up and ready for work.
French: <yes>Tout bien organisé, aligné et prêt pour le travail.
Korean: <yes>모두 가지런히 정리되어 일렬로 서서 일할 준비가 되어 있습니다.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Todo perfectamente arreglado, alineado y listo para trabajar.
Portuguese: <yes>Tudo organizado com eficiência, alinhado e pronto para o trabalho.

English: <pumped>Sometimes I feel bad writing on it, but we're doing really important work here.
French: <pumped>Parfois cela me fait de la peine d'écrire dessus, mais notre travail ici est important.
Korean: <pumped>때때로 글을 쓰는 것이 기분이 좋지 않지만, 우리는 여기서 정말 중요한 일을 하고 있습니다.
Portuguese: <pumped>Às vezes até me sinto mal por escrever no papel, mas nós estamos fazendo um trabalho muito importante aqui.

English: <yes>So its all worth it!
French: <yes>Donc, cela en vaut la peine !

English: What’s the point of anything happening if nobody is there to record it?
French: Quel est le but que quelque chose se passe si personne n'est là pour le consigner ?
Korean: 녹음할 사람이 없다면 무슨 일이 일어나든 무슨 소용이 있겠습니까?
Portuguese: Qual o sentido de as coisas acontecerem se não há alguém para fazer o registro?

English: <yes>Hey, <PlayerName>, if a tree falls in the woods, please be sure to let me know.
French: <yes>Hé, <PlayerName>, si un arbre tombe dans la forêt, n'oublie pas de me le dire.
Portuguese: <yes>Ei, <PlayerName>. Se uma árvore cair na floresta, não se esqueça de me avisar.

English: Hi there, <PlayerName>
French: Hé salut, <PlayerName>
Russian: Привет, <PlayerName>
Chinese (Traditional): 嗨，<PlayerName>，
Thai: ว่าไง <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Halo, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Ciao, <PlayerName>
Turkish: Selam <PlayerName>
German: Hallo, <PlayerName>.

English: Have you managed to get a <itemName>?
French: As-tu réussi à obtenir un(e) <itemName> ?
Russian: Тебе удалось достать <itemName>?
Chinese (Traditional): 你有拿到<itemName>嗎？
Thai: เธอหา <itemName> มาได้สำเร็จไหม
Indonesian: Apa kamu sudah mendapatkan <itemName>?
Italian: Sei riuscito a ottenere un <itemName>?
Turkish: <itemName> yapabildin mi?
German: Konntest du "<itemName>" besorgen?

English: <yes>We've got more work to do tomorrow!
French: <yes>Nous aurons plus de travail demain !
Russian: <yes>Завтра у нас будет еще много работы!
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>明天还有更多工作等待完成！
Japanese: <yes>明日はもっとやることがあるから！
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>明天還有更多工作要做呢！
Thai: <yes>พรุ่งนี้เรายังมีงานอย่างอื่นอีกมากมายที่ต้องทำ!
Indonesian: <yes>Kita masih punya banyak pekerjaan untuk dilakukan besok!
Italian: <yes>Domani abbiamo altro lavoro da fare!
Turkish: <yes>Yarın yapacak çok işimiz var!
German: <yes>Morgen haben wir noch einiges zu tun!

English: I want to apply for a licence.
French: Je veux demander une licence.
Russian: Хочу подать заявку на лицензию.
Japanese: ライセンスの申請をしたい。
Chinese (Traditional): 我想申請許可證
Thai: ฉันต้องการขอรับใบอนุญาต
Indonesian: Aku ingin mengajukan permohonan lisensi.
Italian: Voglio richiedere una licenza.
Turkish: Lisans başvurusu yapmak istiyorum.
German: Ich möchte eine Lizenz beantragen.

English: How do I craft a Furnace?
French: Comment puis-je fabriquer un fourneau ?
Russian: Как изготовить печь?
Japanese: 炉の作り方を知りたい。
Chinese (Traditional): 要怎麼製作熔爐呢？
Thai: ทำยังไงถึงจะประดิษฐ์เตาหลอมได้
Indonesian: Bagaimana cara membuat Tungku?
Italian: Come si realizza una fornace?
Turkish: Nasıl Fırın yapabilirim?
German: Wie stelle ich einen Ofen her?

English: How do I make a Tin Bar?
French: Comment puis-je fabriquer une barre d'étain ?
Russian: Как мне сделать слиток олова?
Japanese: スズの延べ棒の作り方を知りたい。
Chinese (Traditional): 要怎麼製作錫錠呢？
Thai: ทำยังไงถึงจะได้แท่งดีบุก
Indonesian: Bagaimana cara membuat Batangan Timah?
Italian: Come si crea un lingotto di stagno?
Portuguese: Como faço uma barra de estanho?
Turkish: Nasıl Kalay Külçesi yapabilirim?
German: Wie stelle ich eine Zinnstange her?

English: I'm on it.
French: Je m'en occupe.
Russian: Я в деле.
Chinese (Traditional): 我馬上去做。
Thai: ยังไม่เสร็จเลย
Indonesian: Sedang kukerjakan.
Italian: Ci penso io.
Turkish: Çalışmaya devam ediyorum.
German: Bin dabei.

English: I'm on it!
French: Je m'en occupe !
Russian: Я в деле!
Chinese (Traditional): 交給我吧！
Thai: ได้เลย!
Indonesian: Aku akan melakukannya!
Italian: Ci penso io!
Turkish: O iş bende!
German: Bin dabei!

English: Alright then...
French: Très bien...
Russian: Ну ладно...
Chinese (Traditional): 那好吧……
Indonesian: Baiklah kalau begitu...
Italian: D'accordo allora...
Turkish: Tamam o zaman...
German: Alles klar …

English: I’ve seen <itemName> here and there on the island. It's a dark ore poking out of rocks.
French: J'ai vu <itemName> ici et là sur l'île. C'est un minerai sombre qui sort des pierres.
Russian: Я видела <itemName> по всему острову. Это темная руда, торчащая из камней.
Chinese (Simplified): 我在岛上各处都见过<itemName>，是种黑色的矿石，会从岩石里露出来。
Japanese: <itemName>は島のあちこちにあった。岩からのぞいている黒い鉱石がそれだよ。
Korean: 섬 곳곳에 <itemName> 광석이 있더구나. 바위에 튀어나온 어두운 색의 광석이야.
Chinese (Traditional): 我在島上到處都有看到<itemName>。那是一種從岩石中冒出來的黑色礦石。
Thai: ฉันเห็น <itemName> อยู่ทั่วเกาะเลย เป็นแร่สีเข้มๆ ที่แทรกอยู่ตามหิน
Indonesian: Aku pernah melihat <itemName> di beberapa tempat di pulau ini. Bijih hitam yang menyembul dari bebatuan.
Italian: Ho visto <itemName> qua e là sull'isola. È un minerale scuro che spunta dalle rocce.
Spanish (Latin Americas): He visto <itemName> por ahí en la isla. Es un mineral oscuro que sobresale de las rocas.
Portuguese: Já vi <itemName> aqui e ali na ilha. É um minério escuro saindo das rochas.
Turkish: Adada <itemName> görmüştüm. Kayalardan çıkan koyu renkli bir cevher.
German: Ich habe <itemName> hier und da auf der Insel gesehen. Das ist ein dunkles Erz, das aus den Steinen herausragt.

English: Your going to need a <MiningLicence> to buy a pickaxe to collect ore.
French: Tu vas avoir besoin d'une <MiningLicence> pour acheter une pioche et recueillir du minerai.
Russian: Тебе понадобится <MiningLicence>, чтобы купить кирку для сбора руды.
Chinese (Simplified): 你必须持有<MiningLicence>才能购买鹤嘴锄挖矿。
Japanese: 鉱石を集めるためのツルハシを買うには、<MiningLicence>が必要だよ。
Chinese (Traditional): 你需要<MiningLicence>，才能買十字鎬來挖礦石。
Thai: เธอจะต้องมี <MiningLicence> ถึงจะซื้อจอบอีเตอร์สำหรับเก็บแร่ได้
Indonesian: Kamu akan membutuhkan <MiningLicence> untuk membeli beliung agar bisa mengumpulkan bijih.
Italian: Tieni presente che avrai bisogno di una <MiningLicence> per acquistare un piccone per raccogliere minerali e rocce.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Necesitas una <MiningLicence> para comprar un pico y recoger minerales.
Portuguese: Você precisará de uma <MiningLicence> para comprar uma picareta para coletar minério.
Turkish: Cevher toplamak için kazma alman gerekiyor, onun için de <MiningLicence>na ihtiyacın olacak.
German: Du brauchst eine <MiningLicence>, um eine Spitzhacke zu kaufen und Erz abzubauen.

English: If I remember correctly there are different fruits all over the island.
French: Si mes souvenirs sont corrects, il y a différents fruits partout sur l'île.
Russian: Если я правильно помню, на острове есть разные фрукты.
Chinese (Simplified): 没记错的话，岛上应该生长着各种各样的果实。
Japanese: 記憶が確かなら、島中にいろいろな果物がある。
Korean: 내 기억이 맞다면 섬 곳곳에 다양한 과일이 있어.
Chinese (Traditional): 如果我沒記錯的話，整個島上有各種不同的水果。
Thai: ถ้าฉันจำไม่ผิด เกาะนี้มีผลไม้หลากหลายพันธุ์อยู่ทั่วไปหมด
Indonesian: Jika aku tidak salah ingat, ada begitu banyak jenis buah di seluruh pulau ini.
Italian: Se non ricordo male, in tutta l'isola ci sono diversi frutti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si mal no recuerdo, hay diferentes tipos de árboles por toda la isla.
Portuguese: Se não me falha a memória, há frutas diferentes por toda a ilha.
Turkish: Doğru hatırlıyorsam adanın her yerinde farklı meyveler var.
German: Wenn ich mich recht entsinne, wachsen überall auf der Insel verschiedene Früchte.

English: Good luck mate, looking forward to it! <glee>
French: Bonne chance, mon pote, j'ai hâte de voir le résultat ! <glee>
Russian: Удачи, дружище, с нетерпением жду! <glee>
Chinese (Simplified): 祝你好运，伙伴。期待你完成任务！<glee>
Japanese: 気をつけて行ってらっしゃい。楽しみにしているよ！<glee>
Chinese (Traditional): 祝你好運，夥伴！期待你的表現喔！<glee>
Thai: เป็นกำลังใจให้นะ ฉันรอลุ้นเลย! <glee>
Indonesian: Semoga beruntung sobat, aku akan menantikannya! <glee>
Italian: Buona fortuna, amico. Non vedo l'ora! <glee>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Buena suerte, compa, espero que así sea. <glee>
Portuguese: Boa sorte, colega. Fico à espera das novidades! <glee>
Turkish: İyi şanslar, dört gözle bekliyorum! <glee>
German: Viel Glück, Kumpel, ich freue mich schon darauf! <glee>

English: <thinking>To the south it can get a bit chilly, but I recall my Dad warned me about the wildlife down there…
French: <thinking>Au sud, il peut faire un peu froid, mais je me souviens de l'avertissement de mon père à propos de la faune là-bas…
Russian: <thinking>Южнее может быть холодновато, но помню, что папа предупреждал меня о тамошней природе…
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>往南走，气候会变得寒冷，记得爸爸警告过我小心南部的野生生物…
Japanese: <thinking>南に行くと少々寒くなるけど、父がその地域の野生動物は危ないと言っていたのを覚えているよ…
Korean: <thinking>남쪽으로 가면 약간 추워지지. 아버지가 그곳의 야생동물을 조심하라고 하셨던 게 기억나는구나...
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>往南邊走會有點冷，不過我記得我爸提醒過我，那邊的野生動物很危險……
Thai: <thinking>ส่วนทางตอนใต้จะค่อนข้างเย็น แต่เหมือนพ่อของฉันจะเคยเตือนว่าให้ระวังสัตว์ป่าแถวนั้น…
Indonesian: <thinking>Di bagian selatan, cuaca bisa sedikit dingin, tapi aku ingat ayahku pernah memperingatkanku tentang satwa liar di sana...
Italian: <thinking>A sud può fare un po' freddo, ma ricordo che mio padre mi aveva messo in guardia dalla fauna selvatica che si trova laggiù...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Hacia el sur, puede ser un poco frío, pero recuerdo que papá me advirtió acerca de la vida silvestre de allí…
Portuguese: <thinking>Se for para o sul, pode ficar um pouco frio, e me lembro do meu pai me avisando da vida selvagem daquela região…
Turkish: <thinking>Güneye gittikçe hava biraz soğuyor, babamın oradaki vahşi yaşamla ilgili beni uyardığını hatırlıyorum...
German: <thinking>Im Süden kann es ein bisschen kühl werden, aber ich erinnere mich, dass mein Vater mich vor den wilden Tieren dort unten gewarnt hat …

English: To the east and west of the island are flat open plains. The ground is nice and flat, so it would be easy to build there.
French: À l'est et à l'ouest de l'île, il y a de grandes plaines plates. Le sol est bien plat, donc il serait facile d'y bâtir quelque chose.
Russian: На востоке и западе острова плоские открытые равнины. Земля хорошая и ровная, так что строить там будет легко.
Chinese (Simplified): 岛屿东、西是开阔的平原，地面坚实平坦，特别适合建造。
Japanese: 島の東西方面は開けた平野になっている。地面が平坦だし状態も良いので、設置も簡単だろう。
Korean: 섬의 동쪽과 서쪽에는 평야가 있어. 땅이 평평해서 건물을 짓기 쉬울 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): 島嶼的東邊和西邊有一片平坦的草原。地面非常平整，很適合在那裡建造東西。
Thai: ทางฝั่งตะวันออกกับตะวันตกของเกาะเป็นทุ่งที่ราบกว้าง ผิวดินแถวนี้ราบเรียบกำลังดีจึงง่ายที่จะสร้างอาคาร
Indonesian: Di sebelah timur dan barat pulau terdapat dataran terbuka yang datar. Tanahnya bagus dan datar, jadi akan mudah untuk membangun di sana.
Italian: A est e a ovest dell'isola ci sono vaste pianure. Il terreno è bello e pianeggiante: sarebbe facile costruire lì.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Al este y al oeste de la isla hay llanuras extensas. El terreno es plano, por lo que debe ser fácil construir allí.
Portuguese: A leste e a oeste da ilha há planícies abertas. O solo é bom e nivelado e, assim, deve ser fácil construir por lá.
Turkish: Adanın doğusu ve batısı açık düzlükler. Toprak uygun ve düz, o nedenle buraya yapılar inşa etmek kolay olur.
German: Im Osten und Westen der Insel gibt es flache, offene Ebenen. Der Boden ist schön flach, so dass es einfach wäre, dort zu bauen.

English: The coasts are a great place for fishing year-round. So if you like throwing a line, it might be worth setting up the <itemName> near the beach.
French: Les côtes sont un excellent endroit où pêcher toute l'année. Donc si tu aimes ça, cela pourrait être une bonne idée d'installer la <itemName> près de la plage.
Russian: Побережья — хорошее место для круглогодичной рыбалки. Так что, если любишь бросать леску, можут быть целесообразно установить <itemName> вблизи пляжа.
Chinese (Simplified): 海岸一年四季都是钓鱼的好去处。如果你喜欢抛竿钓鱼，不妨在海滩附近安置<itemName>。
Japanese: 海岸は一年中、釣りをするのにおあつらえ向きの場所だよ。釣り竿を使うのが好きなら、海岸のそばに<itemName>を設置するのも手だね。
Korean: 해안은 일 년 내내 낚시하기에 좋단다. 물고기를 낚고 싶다면 해변 근처에 <itemName> 설치를 하렴.
Chinese (Traditional): 海邊一年四季都是釣魚的好地方。如果你喜歡釣魚，不妨考慮在海灘附近設置<itemName>。
Thai: บริเวณชายฝั่งทั้งหมดเหมาะสำหรับตกปลาตลอดปี ดังนั้นถ้าเธอชอบเหวี่ยงเบ็ด ก็แนะนำให้ตั้ง <itemName> ใกล้ๆ ชายหาด
Indonesian: Pesisir adalah tempat yang tepat untuk memancing sepanjang tahun. Jika kamu suka memancing, mungkin ada baiknya kamu menyiapkan <itemName> di dekat pantai.
Italian: Le coste sono un ottimo posto per pescare tutto l'anno. Se ti piace gettare una lenza, potrebbe valere la pena di montare la <itemName> vicino alla spiaggia.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Las costas son un buen lugar para pescar todo el año. Así que, si te gusta lanzar el anzuelo, te convendrá instalar la <itemName> cerca de la playa.
Portuguese: A costa é um ótimo local para pescar durante todo o ano. Portanto, se você gosta de jogar a linha, pode valer a pena instalar a <itemName> perto da praia.
Turkish: Sahillerde yıl boyu balık tutabilirsin. Yani eğer olta atmayı seviyorsan <itemName>ı sahilin yanına kurmak iyi olabilir.
German: Die Küsten sind das ganze Jahr über ein guter Ort zum Angeln. Wenn du also gerne die Angel auswirfst, lohnt es sich, das <itemName> in Strandnähe aufzustellen.

English: <haha>The centre of the island is a desert. It’s hot and dry there, and it’s full of bugs!
French: <haha>Le centre de l'île est un désert. Le temps y est chaud et sec, et il y a plein d'insectes !
Russian: <haha>В центре острова находится пустыня. Там жарко и сухо, а также полно козявок!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>岛屿的中心地带是沙漠，气候干燥炎热，而且昆虫特别多！
Japanese: <haha>島の真ん中は砂漠になっている。暑くて乾燥しているし、虫でいっぱいだ！
Korean: <haha>섬 가운데에는 사막이 있어. 덥고, 건조하고, 곤충이 엄청 많지!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>島的中心是一片沙漠。那裡又熱又乾，而且到處都是蟲子！
Thai: <haha>ส่วนตรงกลางเกาะเป็นทะเลทรายที่ทั้งร้อนและแห้ง แถมมีแมลงเยอะมาก!
Indonesian: <haha>Bagian tengah pulau adalah gurun pasir. Di sana panas dan kering, dan penuh dengan serangga!
Italian: <haha>Il centro dell'isola è un deserto. Lì il clima è caldo e secco, ed è pieno di insetti!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>El centro de la isla es desértico. Es cálido y seco, y está lleno de insectos.
Portuguese: <haha>O centro da ilha é um deserto. É quente e seco por lá, e repleto de insetos!
Turkish: <haha>Adanın ortası çöl. Sıcak, kuru ve böceklerle dolu!
German: <haha>Das Zentrum der Insel ist eine Wüste. Dort ist es heiß und trocken und es wimmelt von Krabbeltieren!

English: <yes>But no matter where you decide we should build, being close to water is always a good idea.
French: <yes>Mais quel que soit l'endroit que tu choisis pour bâtir, être proche de l'eau est toujours une bonne idée.
Russian: <yes>Но независимо от того, где ты решишь строить, близость к воде — всегда хорошая идея.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>不管决定在哪儿开始建造，选址靠近水源非常重要。
Japanese: <yes>でも、どこに建てるにせよ、水のそばにするのが確実だよ。
Korean: <yes>하지만 어디에 건물을 짓든 물가와 가까운 곳이 좋단다.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>不管你決定在哪裡建造，靠近水源總是個好主意。
Thai: <yes>แต่ไม่ว่าเธอจะเลือกสร้างเมืองที่ไหนก็ตาม แนะนำว่าอยู่ใกล้น้ำไว้ก่อนย่อมดีเสมอ
Indonesian: <yes>Namun, di mana pun kamu memutuskan untuk membangunnya, tetaplah dekat dengan sumber air.
Italian: <yes>Ma, indipendentemente da dove decidi di costruire, restare vicini all'acqua è sempre una buona idea.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Pero sin importar dónde decidas que debemos construir, siempre es bueno estar cerca del agua.
Portuguese: <yes>Mas não importa onde você acha que devemos construir, estar perto da água é sempre uma boa ideia.
Turkish: <yes>Ama yerleşmek için nereye karar verirsen ver, suyun kenarında olmak her zaman iyidir.
German: <yes>Aber ganz gleich, wo du bauen möchtest, nah am Wasser ist immer eine gute Idee.

English: So if you want to set up inland anywhere, try and do it close to a river.
French: Donc si tu veux t'installer dans les terres, essaye de le faire près d'une rivière.
Russian: Так что если ты хочешь поселиться где-то в глубине острова, постарайся поближе к реке.
Chinese (Simplified): 如果你想安顿在内陆，尽量选择靠近河流的地方。
Japanese: 内陸部に建てるなら、川のそばがおすすめ。
Korean: 그러니 섬 안쪽에 건물을 짓고 싶다면 강가가 좋을 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): 所以如果你想在內陸地區設置牧場，試著靠近河流的地方吧。
Thai: ดังนั้นถ้าเธออยากลงหลักปักฐานลึกเข้าไปในฝั่ง ก็พยายามให้อยู่ใกล้แม่น้ำเข้าไว้
Indonesian: Jadi, jika kamu ingin membangun di pedalaman di mana saja, cobalah untuk membangun di dekat sungai.
Italian: Quindi, se vuoi stabilirti nell'entroterra, cerca di farlo vicino a un fiume.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Así que, si quieres instalarte tierra adentro, hazlo cerca de un río.
Portuguese: Então, se você quiser se instalar em algum local no interior, tente fazer isso perto de um rio.
Turkish: Yani iç kısımlarda yerleşim kurmak istiyorsan bir nehrin yanında kursan iyi olur.
German: Wenn du dich also irgendwo im Landesinneren niederlassen möchtest, solltest du dies in der Nähe eines Flusses tun.

English: <haha>I feel like that’s a lot to take in. Sorry about that, <PlayerName>!
French: <haha>Je crois que ça fait beaucoup d'informations. Je m'excuse pour cela, <PlayerName> !
Russian: <haha>Чувствую, это уже многовато. Извини, <PlayerName>!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>需要消化吸收的内容很多吧，不好意思咯，<PlayerName>！
Japanese: <haha>覚えなきゃいけないことがたくさんあるだろう。<PlayerName>は大変だ！
Korean: <haha>말이 너무 많았던 것 같구나. 용서해 다오,<PlayerName>!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>我覺得這樣說太多了，真不好意思，抱歉啦<PlayerName>！
Thai: <haha>เหมือนฉันจะโถมข้อมูลเยอะแยะใส่เธอเลย ขอโทษทีนะ <PlayerName>!
Indonesian: <haha>Aku terlalu cerewet. Maafkan, ya, <PlayerName>!
Italian: <haha>Mi sembra che siano troppe informazioni da assimilare. Mi dispiace, <PlayerName>!
Portuguese: <haha>Acho que pode ser muita informação para assimilar. Peço desculpa por isso, <PlayerName>!
Turkish: <haha>Çok fazla şey anlatıp kafanı karıştırdım galiba. Üzgünüm <PlayerName>!
German: <haha>Das war jetzt vielleicht ein bisschen viel auf einmal. Tut mir leid, <PlayerName>!

English: You can craft the <itemName> at the Crafting Table in the Base Tent.
French: Tu peux fabriquer <itemName> à la table de travail dans la tente principale.
Russian: <itemName> можно изготовить на верстаке в палатке.
Chinese (Simplified): 你可以在基础帐篷的制作台制作<itemName>。
Japanese: <itemName>は、拠点テントの作業台で作れるよ。
Korean: 베이스텐트에 있는 작업대에서 <itemName> 제작을 할 수 있단다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你可以在基礎帳篷裡的製作台上製作這個<itemName>。
Thai: เธอสามารถประดิษฐ์ <itemName> ได้ที่โต๊ะประดิษฐ์ในเต็นท์ฐาน
Indonesian: Kamu bisa membuat <itemName> dengan Meja Kreasi di Tenda Dasar.
Italian: Puoi realizzare la <itemName> al tavolo da lavoro nella tenda base.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Puedes fabricar el <itemName> en la mesa de elaboración de la tienda de campaña base.
Portuguese: Você pode fazer <itemName> na Mesa de Produção na Barraca de Apoio.
Turkish: Ana Çadırdaki Üretim Masasında <itemName> üretebilirsin.
German: Du kannst "<itemName>" am Basteltisch im Basiszelt herstellen.

English: You should have everything you need!
French: Tu devrais avoir tout ce dont tu as besoin !
Russian: У тебя должно быть все необходимое!
Japanese: 必要なものは揃っているはずだ！
Chinese (Traditional): 你應該什麼都準備好了！
Thai: เธอน่าจะมีทุกอย่างที่ต้องใช้ครบแล้วนะ!
Indonesian: Kamu harus memiliki semua yang kamu butuhkan!
Italian: Dovresti avere tutto quello che ti occorre!
Portuguese: Você deve ter tudo o que precisa!
Turkish: İhtiyacın olan her şeye sahipsin!
German: Du müsstest alles haben, was du brauchst!

English: <no>Now, you don't have to buy the <itemName> right away.
French: <no>Inutile d'acheter <itemName> immédiatement.
Russian: <no>Сейчас тебе не нужно сразу же покупать <itemName>.
Japanese: <no><itemName>を今すぐ買う必要はないよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>現在，你不需要馬上購買這個<itemName>。
Thai: <no>จะว่าไป เธอไม่จำเป็นต้องรีบซื้อ <itemName> เลยทันทีหรอกนะ
Indonesian: <no>Kamu tidak harus langsung membeli <itemName> langsung.
Italian: <no>Non devi acquistare il <itemName> subito.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>No, no tienes que comprar la <itemName> ahora mismo.
Portuguese: <no>Assim, você não precisa comprar <itemName> de imediato.
Turkish: <no>Hemen <itemName> satın alman gerekmiyor.
German: <no>Nun, du musst den Gegenstand "<itemName>" nicht sofort kaufen.

English: <haha>Feel free to buy any tools you think might make you money even quicker!
French: <haha>N'hésite pas à acheter les outils qui, selon toi, te permettront de gagner de l'argent plus rapidement !
Russian: <haha>Не стесняйся покупать любые инструменты, если считаешь, что они помогут тебе заработать еще быстрее!
Chinese (Simplified): <haha>只要你认为某件工具有助于赚钱，那就买下吧！
Japanese: <haha>短時間で金策するのに便利だと思うものを何でも買うのがいいだろう！
Korean: <haha>더 빨리 돈을 벌 수 있는 도구가 있다면 마음껏 사서 쓰렴!
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>隨便挑幾個你覺得能幫你賺錢更快的工具吧！
Thai: <haha>ถ้าอยากซื้อเครื่องมืออะไรที่คิดว่าจะช่วยให้เธอหาเงินได้เร็วขึ้น เธอก็ซื้ออันนั้นก่อนได้เลย!
Indonesian: <haha>Jangan ragu untuk membeli alat apa pun yang menurutmu bisa menghasilkan uang dengan lebih cepat!
Italian: <haha>Puoi acquistare qualsiasi attrezzo che pensi possa farti guadagnare ancora più velocemente!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>No dudes en comprar cualquier herramienta que te ayude a ganar dinero más rápido.
Portuguese: <haha>Fique à vontade para comprar qualquer ferramenta que você ache que pode ajudar a ganhar dinheiro com mais rapidez!
Turkish: <haha>Daha hızlı para kazanmanı sağlayacak aletleri satın alabilirsin!
German: <haha>Kaufe einfach Werkzeuge, von denen du glaubst, dass sie dir noch schneller zu Geld verhelfen könnten!

English: But you don’t have to listen to old <myName>!  You’re the one running around out there!þ
French: Mais tu n'es pas obligé d'écouter la vieille <myName> ! C'est toi qui cours partout !
Russian: Но тебе не обязательно слышать старину <myName>! Бегаешь там ты!
Chinese (Simplified): 当然，你没必要全听老<myName>的！毕竟在外面辛苦奔波的人是你！
Japanese: でも、年寄りの<myName>の言うことばかり聞く必要はないよ！アンタが色々と動いてくれているんだから！
Korean: 하지만 이 <myName> 할머니 말을 들을 필요는 없단다! 직접 발로 뛰는 건 너니까!
Chinese (Traditional): 但你不用聽老<myName>的話啦！你才是那個在外面跑來跑去的人啊！
Thai: แต่เธอไม่ต้องฟังคุณยาย <myName> คนนี้ก็ได้นะ! เพราะคนที่ต้องออกแรงทำงานก็คือเธอ!
Indonesian: Namun jangan dengarkan <myName> yang sudah tua ini! Kamulah yang melakukan banyak hal di pulau ini!
Italian: Ma non devi ascoltare la vecchia <myName>! Sei tu quello che corre in giro là fuori!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pero no tienes que hacerle caso a la vieja <myName>. Tú eres quien anda recorriendo por ahí.
Portuguese: Mas, você não precisa ficar escutando a velha <myName>! É você que tem a responsabilidade nas mãos por aqui!
Turkish: Ama yaşlı <myName>'i dinlemek zorunda değilsin! Etrafta koşuşturup duracak olan sensin!
German: Aber du musst nicht auf die alte <myName> hören! Du bist ja letztlich die Person, die da draußen herumrennt!

English: I’m sure that wherever you decide to place the <itemName>, it will be the right place.<yes>
French: Je suis sûre que quelque soit l'endroit où tu décides de placer la <itemName>, ce sera la bonne décision.<yes>
Russian: Не сомневаюсь, что место, где ты решишь разместить <itemName>, будет хорошим.<yes>
Chinese (Simplified): 不管你选择在哪儿放置<itemName>，肯定都不错。<yes>
Japanese: どこに<itemName>を設置しても、それが正解さ。<yes>
Korean: 너라면 <itemName> 짓기에 딱 맞는 곳을 찾을 거라고 믿는단다.<yes>
Chinese (Traditional): 我相信不管你把<itemName>放在哪裡，那裡就是最適合的地方。<yes>
Thai: ฉันเชื่อมั่นว่า ไม่ว่าเธอจะตั้ง <itemName> ที่ไหน ตรงนั้นแหละคือทำเลที่ใช่สำหรับเรา<yes>
Indonesian: Aku yakin, di mana pun kamu mau menempatkan <itemName>, itu pasti akan menjadi tempat yang tepat.<yes>
Italian: Sono sicura che ovunque tu decida di posizionare la <itemName>, sarà il posto giusto.<yes>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Estoy segura de que donde sea que decidas instalar la <itemName> será un buen lugar.<yes>
Portuguese: Tenho certeza de que seja qual for o local escolhido para instalar a <itemName>, será o local certo.<yes>
Turkish: Eminim <itemName>ı yerleştirmeye karar verdiğin yer en doğru yer olacak.<yes>
German: Wo immer du das <itemName> aufstellst, ist ganz bestimmt der richtige Ort dafür.<yes>

English: Now if you have any other questions, just ask!
French: Si tu as d'autres questions, n'hésite pas à me les poser !
Russian: Если же есть еще какие-то вопросы, спрашивай!
Chinese (Simplified): 如果还有其他的问题，快问吧！
Japanese: 他に知りたいことがあったら言ってくれ！
Korean: 더 궁금한 게 있다면 언제든 물어보렴!
Chinese (Traditional): 如果你還有其他問題，儘管問吧！
Thai: เอาละ ถ้าสงสัยอะไรอื่นอีกก็ถามมาได้เลย!
Indonesian: Nah, jika kamu punya pertanyaan lain, tanyakan saja!
Italian: Se hai altre domande, chiedi pure!
Portuguese: Agora, se tiver qualquer dúvida, basta perguntar!
Turkish: Başka sorun varsa sor lütfen!
German: Wenn du noch weitere Fragen hast, frag einfach!

English: Once you've got your furnace, place it somewhere outside.
French: Dès que tu as ton fourneau, place-le quelque part dehors.
Russian: Когда у тебя будет печь, размести ее где-нибудь на воздухе.
Chinese (Simplified): 熔炉制作完成后，把它放置在外面。
Japanese: 炉ができたら、外に置くんだよ。
Chinese (Traditional): 拿到熔爐後，把它放在戶外的某個地方吧。
Thai: พอได้เตาหลอมมาแล้ว ให้เธอเอาไปวางไว้ที่ไหนสักที่นอกเต็นท์
Indonesian: Setelah mendapatkan tungku, letakkanlah di luar.
Italian: Una volta che la fornace è pronta, posizionala all'esterno.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Una vez que esté listo el horno, colócalo en algún lugar afuera.
Portuguese: Depois de fazer sua fornalha, coloque-a em algum lugar lá fora.
Turkish: Fırını yaptığında dışarıda bir yere koy.
German: Sobald du den Ofen hast, stelle ihn irgendwo draußen auf.

English: Then, all you have to do then is hold the <itemName> in your hands and pop it in!
French: Ensuite, il te suffit de tenir <itemName> dans tes mains et de le mettre à l'intérieur !
Russian: Затем останется просто взять <itemName> в руки и положить внутрь!
Chinese (Simplified): 接下来，只需把<itemName>拿到手里，再放进去就好！
Japanese: あとは、<itemName>を手に持って入れるだけ！
Korean: 그런 다음 <itemName> 아이템을 손에 들고 안에 넣기만 하면 된단다!
Chinese (Traditional): 接著，你只要把手上的<itemName>拿好，然後放進去就行了！
Thai: จากนั้นที่เธอก็ต้องทำก็คือเอา <itemName> มาถือไว้ในมือ แล้วก็ใส่เข้าไปเลย!
Indonesian: Selanjutnya, kamu hanya perlu memegang <itemName> di tanganmu dan memasukkannya!
Italian: Poi, tutto quello che devi fare è tenere il <itemName> nelle tue mani e metterlo dentro!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Luego, solo debes sostener el <itemName> en las manos y meterlo dentro.
Portuguese: Em seguida, tudo o que tem de fazer é segurar <itemName> em suas mãos e colocar lá dentro!
Turkish: Sonra da elinde tuttuğun <itemName>ni fırının içine at!
German: Dann musst du nur noch das <itemName> in die Hand nehmen und hineinstecken!

English: <haha>Oh, and you'll have to wait a bit!
French: <haha>Oh, et tu devras attendre un peu !
Russian: <haha>Ах да, и подождать немного!
Japanese: <haha>ああ、少々待たなきゃいけないよ！
Chinese (Traditional): <haha>喔，你得稍微等一下喔！
Thai: <haha>อ๊ะ และเธอก็ต้องรอสักพัก!
Indonesian: <haha>Oh, kamu juga harus menunggu sebentar!
Italian: <haha>Ah, e dovrai aspettare un po'!
Spanish (Latin Americas): <haha>¡Ah, y tendrás que aguardar un poco!
Portuguese: <haha>Oh, e você terá de esperar um pouco!
Turkish: <haha>Biraz beklemen gerekecek!
German: <haha>Oh, und du musst ein bisschen warten!

English: If you just go about your day doing your activites, I'm sure you'll get rewarded eventually!
French: Si tu accomplis tes activités au cours de la journée, je suis sûre que tu finiras par être récompensé !
Russian: Если ты просто будешь заниматься своими делами каждый день, уверена, что в конечном итоге тебя ждет вознаграждение!
Chinese (Simplified): 如果你就想按自己的计划度过每一天，最后也一定会获得奖励！
Japanese: 日々やることをやっていれば、報われるよ！
Korean: 하루 종일 열심히 움직이다 보면 언젠가 보상을 받게 될 거야!
Chinese (Traditional): 只要你每天認真做自己的事情，我相信你最終一定會得到回報的！
Thai: ถ้าเธอทำกิจกรรมที่จำเป็นไปเรื่อยๆ ทุกวัน เดี๋ยวสุดท้ายเธอก็จะได้รางวัลไปเอง!
Indonesian: Jika kamu menjalani hari dengan terus mengerjakan aktivitasmu, aku yakin kamu akan mendapatkan imbalan pada akhirnya!
Italian: Non devi fare altro che trascorrere la giornata svolgendo le tue attività: di sicuro prima o poi verrai ricompensato!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si te enfocas en tus actividades diarias, estoy segura de que obtendrás recompensas.
Portuguese: Se você passar o dia fazendo suas atividades, tenho certeza de que você terá recompensas em algum momento.
Turkish: Günlük normal işlerini yaparken bile ödül alabilirsin!
German: Wenn du einfach deinen Aktivitäten nachgehst, wirst du sicher letztlich belohnt werden!

English: If you have any other questions, please come and ask me <yes>
French: Si tu as d'autres questions, viens me les poser <yes>
Russian: Если будут еще какие-то вопросы, обращайся <yes>
Chinese (Simplified): 如果还有其他的问题，请直接来问我。<yes>
Japanese: 他に知りたいことがあったら、質問においで。<yes>
Korean: 더 궁금한 게 있다면 언제든 와서 물어보렴. <yes>
Chinese (Traditional): 如果你還有其他問題，隨時來找我聊聊喔！<yes>
Thai: ถ้าสงสัยอะไรอื่นอีกก็มาถามฉันได้ตลอด <yes>
Indonesian: Jika kamu punya pertanyaan lain, silakan tanyakan padaku <yes>
Italian: Se hai altre domande, vieni a chiedere. <yes>
Spanish (Latin Americas): Si tienes más preguntas, ven a consultarme. <yes>
Portuguese: Se tiver qualquer outra dúvida, venha me perguntar. <yes>
Turkish: Başka sorun olursa bana gelip sorabilirsin <yes>
German: Wenn du noch weitere Fragen hast, komm einfach zu mir. <yes>

English: No worries, <PlayerName>.
French: Pas de problème, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Не волнуйся, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 別擔心啦，<PlayerName>。
Thai: ไม่เป็นไร <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Jangan khawatir, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Nessun problema, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Sorun yok <PlayerName>.
German: Kein Problem, <PlayerName>.

English: Just be sure to bring me the <itemName> once you have it!
French: N'oublie pas de m'apporter <itemName> dès que tu l'auras !
Russian: Просто не забудь принести мне <itemName>, как только получишь!
Japanese: <itemName>が手に入ったら、持ってきてね！
Korean: <itemName> 아이템을 얻게 되면 내게 꼭 가져다 다오!
Chinese (Traditional): 你拿到<itemName>後，記得帶來給我喔！
Thai: ถ้าได้ <itemName> มาเมื่อไหร่ก็อย่าลืมเอามาให้ฉันก็พอ!
Indonesian: Cukup pastikan untuk membawakanku <itemName> setelah kamu mendapatkannya!
Italian: Assicurati solo di portarmi il <itemName> una volta che ce l'hai!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Solo asegúrate de traerme el <itemName> una vez que lo tengas.
Portuguese: Não esqueça de me trazer <itemName> quando já estiver com você.
Turkish: Elde ettiğin anda bana <itemName> getirmen yeterli!
German: Bring mir einfach den Gegenstand "<itemName>", sobald du ihn hast!

English: <yes>Wherever is fine, really.
French: <yes>N'importe où, vraiment.
Russian: <yes>На самом деле можно где угодно.
Japanese: <yes>場所はどこでもいいよ。どこでも問題ない。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>隨便哪裡都可以啦。
Thai: <yes>จะเอาไปปูตรงไหนก็ได้นะ
Indonesian: <yes>Di mana saja bisa, kok.
Italian: <yes>Va bene ovunque, davvero.
Turkish: <yes>Neresi olursa olsun, fark etmez.
German: <yes>Egal wo.

English: <no>If you want to sleep under the stars, I'm not going to stop you.
French: <no>Si tu veux dormir à la belle étoile, je ne vais pas t'en empêcher.
Russian: <no>Если тебе захочется поспать под звездами, не буду тебя останавливать.
Chinese (Simplified): <no>就算你想睡在星空下面，我也不拦你。
Japanese: <no>星を見ながら寝るなら、それでもいいよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>如果你想在星空下睡覺，我不會阻止你。
Thai: <no>ถ้าเธออยากนอนดูดาว ฉันก็ไม่ห้าม
Indonesian: <no>Jika kamu ingin tidur beratapkan bintang-bintang, aku juga tidak akan melarangmu.
Italian: <no>Se vuoi dormire sotto le stelle, non ti fermerò.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Si quieres dormir bajo las estrellas, eres libre de hacerlo.
Portuguese: <no>Se você quiser dormir sob as estrelas, eu não vou impedir.
Turkish: <no>Yıldızların altında uyumak istiyorsan seni engellemeyeceğim.
German: <no>Wenn du unter den Sternen schlafen möchtest, werde ich dich nicht davon abhalten.

English: Thanks again for your help, <PlayerName>!
French: Merci encore pour ton aide, <PlayerName> !
Russian: Еще раз спасибо тебе за помощь, <PlayerName>!
Japanese: あらためて、いつもありがとう。<PlayerName>！
Chinese (Traditional): 再次感謝你的幫忙，<PlayerName>！
Thai: ขอบคุณอีกครั้งที่ช่วยฉันนะ <PlayerName>!
Indonesian: Sekali lagi terima kasih atas bantuanmu, <PlayerName>!
Italian: Grazie ancora per il tuo aiuto, <PlayerName>!
Portuguese: Agradeço mais uma vez pela ajuda, <PlayerName>!
Turkish: Yardımın için tekrar teşekkürler <PlayerName>!
German: Nochmals vielen Dank für deine Hilfe, <PlayerName>!

French: je comprends

no
