English: Here is the <itemAttachedName> you ordered.þþThank you very much.
From {0}
Here's the <itemAttachedName> I wanted to give to you.þþYour pockets were full, so I sent it to you instead.
Korean: 여기 제가 드리고 싶었던 <itemAttachedName>이 있습니다.þþ주머니가 꽉 차서 대신 보내드렸습니다.

English: You've been working hard and I'll tell you what, it hasn't gone unnoticed. þþBecause you've been increasing your skills there is a new level of <licenceName> available to you.þþCome and see me to apply for it!
Korean: 당신은 열심히 일해왔고, 그 사실이 눈에 띄지 않게 되었다는 사실을 말씀드리겠습니다. þþ기술이 향상되었기 때문에 새로운 수준의 <licenceName>을(를) 사용할 수 있습니다.þþ저를 만나서 신청해보세요!

English: Your farm animal has been rehomed safley.þþI've attached your <itemAttachedName> that it was carrying.
Korean: 귀하의 농장 동물이 안전하게 집으로 옮겨졌습니다.þþ휴대하고 있던 <itemAttachedName>을 첨부했습니다.

English: I've been cooking a little and I had some <itemAttachedName> left over.þþHope you like it!
Korean: 요리를 조금 했는데 <itemAttachedName>이 좀 남았습니다.þþ당신이 그것을 좋아하길 바랍니다!

English: Hey, here is some <itemAttachedName>. Don't worry about how long it's been sitting in your mail box. Eat it! þþIt will be fine!
Korean: 안녕하세요, 여기 <itemAttachedName>이 있습니다. 메일함에 얼마나 오랫동안 보관되어 있었는지 걱정하지 마세요. 먹어라! þþ괜찮을 거예요!

English: I saw this and thought of you.
I don't really need this <itemAttachedName>. (To be honest I found it anyway)
Korean: 이 <itemAttachedName>은 별로 필요하지 않습니다. (솔직히 어쨌든 찾았어요)

English: Are you eating enough veggies? Here take this <itemAttachedName>. Eat it. They are good for you!
Korean: 야채를 충분히 섭취하고 있나요? 여기 <itemAttachedName>을 가져가세요. 먹어라. 그들은 당신에게 좋습니다!

English: I chopped down a tree. I mean, I did it. Me!þAnyway, I made some <itemAttachedName>. I thought you would have a better use for them.
Korean: 나는 나무를 잘랐다. 내 말은, 내가 해냈다는 거죠. 나!þ어쨌든 <itemAttachedName>을 만들었습니다. 나는 당신이 그것들을 더 잘 사용할 것이라고 생각했습니다.

English: I found these floating in the river. þI know you are always looking for this sort of stuff. So I sent it to you!
Korean: 나는 이것들이 강에 떠 있는 것을 발견했습니다. þ나는 당신이 항상 이런 종류의 물건을 찾고 있다는 것을 알고 있습니다. 그래서 보냈어요!

English: I grew this <itemAttachedName> myself.þþLet me know what you think.
Korean: 이 <itemAttachedName>은 제가 직접 키웠습니다.þþ당신의 생각을 알려주세요.

English: Here's a bit of pocket money for you. I know it's not much but you do so much for the town. þþI wanted to thank you some way.
Korean: 여기 당신을 위한 약간의 용돈이 있습니다. 나는 그것이 많지 않다는 것을 알고 있지만 당신은 마을을 위해 너무 많은 일을 하고 있습니다. þþ어떻게든 감사드리고 싶었어요.

English: I think you might have dropped this at my place the other day.þþIf you didn't, please be honest and bring it back to me!
Korean: 내 생각엔 당신이 저번에 이걸 내 집에 떨어뜨린 것 같아요.þþ그렇지 않은 경우에는 솔직하게 말씀해 주시고 다시 가져오시기 바랍니다!

English: Happy money day!þþI'm pretty sure that it's money day... anyway, enjoy!
Korean: 행복한 돈의 날!þþ오늘은 돈의 날이라고 확신합니다... 어쨌든 즐기세요!

English: I smashed a rock and found some <itemAttachedName>. þþYou like this sort of stuff, right?
Korean: 바위를 부수고 <itemAttachedName>을 발견했습니다. þþ너 이런거 좋아하는구나, 그렇지?

English: It was nice talking to you the other day. Thanks for being a great friend!
Korean: 저번에 당신과 얘기해서 즐거웠어요. 좋은 친구가 되어주셔서 감사합니다!

English: I smashed a rock and found some <itemAttachedName>. þþYou like this sort of stuff, right?
Korean: 바위를 부수고 <itemAttachedName>을 발견했습니다. þþ너 이런거 좋아하는구나, 그렇지?

English: <itemAttachedName>, <itemAttachedName>, <itemAttachedName>.þþ You can never have enough <itemAttachedName>.
Here's a <itemAttachedName>. Put it in your house if you like. I don't mind.
Korean: 여기에 <itemAttachedName>이 있습니다. 원한다면 집에 놓아두세요. 나는 상관하지 않는다.

English: I found this <itemAttachedName> in the dirt the other day. þþI've seen these before. Do you know what they do?
Korean: 저번에 흙 속에서 <itemAttachedName>을 발견했어요. þþ나는 이것을 전에 본 적이 있습니다. 그들이 무엇을 하는지 아시나요?

English: I was hunting Jackaroo. I hope you don't mind it but I sent you some <itemAttachedName>.
Korean: 나는 Jackaroo를 사냥하고있었습니다. 괜찮으시기를 바라지만 제가 <itemAttachedName>을 보냈습니다.

English: Are you eating enough fruit? Just in case I sent you a <itemAttachedName>.
Korean: 과일을 충분히 먹고 있나요? 만일을 대비해 <itemAttachedName>을 보냈습니다.

English: I saw this <itemAttachedName> and thought it would really suit your house. I hope you like it.
Korean: 이 <itemAttachedName>을 보고 당신 집에 정말 잘 어울릴 것 같다고 생각했어요. 당신이 그것을 좋아하길 바랍니다.

English: So, I thought you might like <itemAttachedName>. If you don't like it, sell it. That's what I was going to do!
Korean: 그래서 <itemAttachedName>을 좋아하실 거라고 생각했어요. 마음에 들지 않으면 판매하세요. 그게 내가 하려고 했던 일이야!

English: I hope you like hand-me-downs! Here is a <itemAttachedName>. I haven't worn it for years.
Korean: 당신이 핸드다운을 좋아하길 바랍니다! 다음은 <itemAttachedName>입니다. 나는 그것을 몇 년 동안 입지 않았습니다.

English: Just letting you know that I appreciate everything you are doing for our town.
Korean: 당신이 우리 마을을 위해 하고 있는 모든 일에 제가 감사하다는 점을 알려드립니다.

English: Your house looks pretty nice. But don't you think it would look nicer with some <itemAttachedName>? þþI'll be sure to peep through your windows to make sure you put it up!
Korean: 당신 집은 꽤 좋아 보여요. 하지만 <itemAttachedName>을 사용하면 더 멋질 것 같지 않나요? þþ창문을 통해 들여다보며 확실히 설치했는지 확인하겠습니다!

English: We have returned your <itemAttachedName>.
Hey, <PlayerName>. þ
French: Hé, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Привет, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 嘿，<PlayerName>。
Thai: นี่ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Hai, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Ciao, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Merhaba <PlayerName>.
German: Hi, <PlayerName>.

English: <IslandName> is well on its way.þ
French: Les choses progressent sur <IslandName>.
Russian: <IslandName> на своем пути.
Chinese (Traditional): <IslandName>進展順利。
Thai: เกาะ <IslandName> กำลังไปได้สวยเลยนะ
Indonesian: <IslandName> berkembang dengan baik sekali.
Italian: <IslandName> è sulla buona strada.
Turkish: <IslandName> Adası'nda her şey çok iyi gidiyor.
German: <IslandName> ist auf dem besten Weg.

English: <yes>It’s looking good.þ
French: <yes>C'est beau.
Russian: <yes>Выглядит хорошо.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>看起來不錯喔！
Thai: <yes>ดูดีจริงๆ เลยตอนนี้
Indonesian: <yes>Tempat ini terlihat bagus.
Italian: <yes>Si presenta bene.
Turkish: <yes>Çok iyi görünüyor.
German: <yes>Sieht gut aus.

English: <IslandName> is starting to get a bit busy, isn’t it?þ
French: Il commence à y avoir un peu de monde sur <IslandName>, tu ne crois pas ?
Russian: <IslandName> постепенно заполняется, правда?
Japanese: <IslandName>がだんだん忙しくなっているな。
Chinese (Traditional): <IslandName>最近是不是開始有點忙碌了呢？
Thai: <IslandName> ชักจะครึกครื้นมากขึ้นแล้ว ว่าไหม
Indonesian: <IslandName> mulai sedikit sibuk, bukan?
Italian: <IslandName> sta iniziando a diventare un po' frenetica, non è vero?
Spanish (Latin Americas): <IslandName> está empezando a tener más movimiento, ¿no?
Portuguese: <IslandName> está começando a ficar movimentada demais, não acha?
Turkish: <IslandName> biraz hareketlenmeye başladı, değil mi?
German: Wird langsam voll auf <IslandName>, findest du nicht?

English: <no>No need to go rushin’ things though.þ
French: <no>Mais pas besoin de se précipiter pour autant.
Russian: <no>Но торопить события не стоит.
Japanese: <no>急いでやる必要はないけどな。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>不用急著趕進度啦。
Thai: <no>จะทำอะไรก็ไม่ต้องรีบร้อนไปล่ะ
Indonesian: <no>Namun, tidak perlu terburu-buru.
Italian: <no>Ma non c'è bisogno di affrettarsi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Pero no hay que apresurar las cosas.
Portuguese: <no>Mas não é preciso apressar as coisas.
Turkish: <no>Yine de işleri aceleye getirmeye gerek yok.
German: <no>Ist aber nicht nötig, irgendwas husch-husch zu erledigen.

English: <yes>Take yer time.þ
French: <yes>Prends ton temps.
Russian: <yes>Не спеши.
Japanese: <yes>じっくりと時間をかけるんだ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>慢慢來，不急。
Thai: <yes>ค่อยๆ เป็น ค่อยๆ ไป
Indonesian: <yes>Tetaplah santai.
Italian: <yes>Fai con calma.
Turkish: <yes>Zamanla halledilir.
German: <yes>Lass dir Zeit.

English: I can tell you’ve put a lot of work into <IslandName>. þ
French: Je vois que tu as accompli beaucoup de choses sur <IslandName>.
Russian: Я вижу, много твоего труда вложено в остров <IslandName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 看得出你为<IslandName>付出了许多心血。
Japanese: アンタのおかげで<IslandName>に仕事がたくさん増えた。
Korean: 네가 <IslandName> 섬에 많은 노력을 기울이는 게 느껴지는구나.
Chinese (Traditional): 我看得出來你真的花了很多心思在<IslandName>上面。
Thai: เห็นได้เลยว่าเธอทุ่มเททำอะไรมากมายให้เกาะ <IslandName>
Indonesian: Aku tahu kamu sudah bekerja keras untuk <IslandName>.
Italian: Posso dire che hai lavorato molto per <IslandName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Puedo ver que has hecho mucho por <IslandName>.
Portuguese: Posso ver que você trabalhou muito em <IslandName>.
Turkish: <IslandName> için çok çabaladığını görüyorum.
German: Du hast viel Arbeit in <IslandName> gesteckt, das sieht man.

English: Gettin’ things built all over the place. þ
French: Tu as construit des choses un peu partout.
Russian: Строим повсюду.
Japanese: あちこちでもの作りをしてるよ。
Chinese (Traditional): 到處蓋東西。
Thai: ออกไปสร้างโน่นสร้างนี่ทั่วไปหมด
Indonesian: Membangun banyak hal di berbagai tempat.
Italian: Hai costruito cose dappertutto.
Turkish: Her yere binalar inşa etmek falan.
German: Baust überall was.

English: Take yer time, <PlayerName>.þ
French: Prends ton temps, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Не торопись, <PlayerName>.
Japanese: <PlayerName>、じっくりと時間をかけるんだ。
Chinese (Traditional): <PlayerName>，慢慢來別急。
Thai: ไม่ต้องรีบร้อนนะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Lakukanlah dengan santai, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Fai con calma, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Acele etme <PlayerName>.
German: Lass dir Zeit, <PlayerName>.

English: <no>Never good to rush things.þ
French: <no>Ce n'est jamais bon de se précipiter.
Russian: <no>Никогда не стоит торопить события.
Japanese: <no>急いでも何も良いことはない。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>不要急急忙忙的，慢慢來比較好。
Thai: <no>รีบไปก็ไม่ดี
Indonesian: <no>Melakukan sesuatu dengan buru-buru tidaklah baik.
Italian: <no>Non è mai una buona idea fare le cose di fretta.
Portuguese: <no>Apressar as coisas nunca é uma boa pedida.
Turkish: <no>İşleri aceleye getirmek iyi değildir.
German: <no>Es ist nie gut, irgendwas husch-husch zu erledigen.

English: <yes>I reckon you’ve made <IslandName> the best place to be, <PlayerName>.
French: <yes>Je pense que, grâce à toi, <IslandName> est le meilleur endroit au monde, <PlayerName>.
Russian: <yes>Полагаю, с тобой <IslandName> станет лучшим местом для жизни, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes><PlayerName>，你已经把<IslandName>建设成了美丽的家园。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>我覺得你已經把<IslandName>變成最棒的地方了，<PlayerName>。
Thai: <yes>ฉันว่าเธอทำให้เกาะ <IslandName> เป็นที่ที่น่าอยู่ที่สุดเลย <PlayerName>
Indonesian: <yes>Bagiku, kamu telah membuat <IslandName> menjadi tempat terbaik, <PlayerName>.
Italian: <yes>Direi che hai reso <IslandName> il posto migliore dove vivere, <PlayerName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Parece que has hecho de <IslandName> el mejor sitio para vivir, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: <yes>Eu acho que você transformou <IslandName> no melhor lugar para se estar, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: <yes><IslandName> Adası'nı yaşanacak en iyi yer haline getirdin <PlayerName>.
German: <yes>So wie ich das sehe, hast du <IslandName> zum besten Ort gemacht, an dem man leben kann, <PlayerName>.

English: I ain’t felt at home since my wife passed.þ
French: Je ne me suis pas senti chez moi depuis le décès de ma femme.
Russian: Я не ощущал себя как дома с тех пор, как умерла моя жена.
Chinese (Simplified): 自从我太太去世后，我一直缺少家的感觉。
Japanese: 妻が亡くなって以来、気分が安らいだことはなかった。
Korean: 아내를 먼저 보낸 이후로 한시도 집처럼 편안했던 적이 없었어.
Chinese (Traditional): 自從我老婆過世後，我就再也沒感覺到家的溫暖了。
Thai: ตั้งแต่ภรรยาของฉันตายไป ก็ไม่มีที่ไหนอีกเลยที่ฉันรู้สึกอบอุ่นใจเหมือนอยู่บ้าน
Indonesian: Aku tidak pernah merasa ada di rumah sejak istriku meninggal.
Italian: Da quando mia moglie è morta, non mi sono più sentito a casa.
Spanish (Latin Americas): No me he sentido en casa desde que mi esposa partió.
Portuguese: Ainda não tinha me sentido em casa desde que minha esposa faleceu.
Turkish: Karım öldüğünden beri kendimi evimde gibi hissetmiyordum.
German: Ich habe mich nirgendwo mehr zu Hause gefühlt, seit meine Frau gestorben ist.

English: <yes>Now I do.þ
French: <yes>Maintenant, c'est le cas.
Russian: <yes>А теперь ощущаю.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>現在我感覺到了。
Thai: <yes>แต่ฉันรู้สึกอย่างนั้นกับที่นี่
Indonesian: <yes>Sekarang aku merasa berada di rumah.
Italian: <yes>Ora sì.
Turkish: <yes>Şimdi hissediyorum.
German: <yes>Jetzt tue ich es.

French: Retour
Russian: Вернуть

Return To Menu

Welcome back, <PlayerName>.
French: Bienvenue à nouveau, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Приветствую снова, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 歡迎回來，<PlayerName>。
Thai: ยินดีที่ได้เจอกันอีก <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Selamat datang kembali, <PlayerName>.
Italian: È bello rivederti, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Que bom ver você outra vez, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Tekrar hoş geldin <PlayerName>.
German: Willkommen zurück, <PlayerName>.

English: Are you here to talk business?
French: Es-tu ici pour parler affaires ?
Russian: Ты хочешь поговорить по делу?
Chinese (Traditional): 你是來談生意的嗎？
Thai: จะมาคุยธุรกิจใช่ไหม
Indonesian: Apakah kamu kemari untuk membicarakan bisnis?
Italian: Sei qui per parlare di affari?
Turkish: İş konuşmaya mı geldin?
German: Bist du hier, um übers Geschäft zu reden?

English: Want to buy anything?
French: Veux-tu acheter quelque chose ?
Russian: Хочешь что-нибудь купить?
Japanese: 何か欲しいものはあるかい？
Chinese (Traditional): 想買點什麼嗎？
Thai: มีของที่สนใจซื้อไหม
Indonesian: Ingin membeli sesuatu?
Italian: Vuoi acquistare qualcosa?
Turkish: Bir şey satın almak ister misin?
German: Möchtest du etwas kaufen?

English: Got any deals?
French: Tu as des offres intéressantes ?
Russian: Есть какие-то предложения?
Japanese: 何かお得情報があるのかい？
Chinese (Traditional): 有什麼優惠嗎？
Thai: มีของขายราคาพิเศษบ้างไหม
Indonesian: Punya penawaran?
Italian: Hai qualche buon affare?
Turkish: Alışveriş fırsatı var mı?
German: Hast du etwas anzubieten?

English: Nevermind.
French: Tant pis.
Russian: Неважно.
Chinese (Traditional): 沒關係。
Thai: ไม่เป็นไร
Indonesian: Tidak jadi.
Italian: Non importa.
Turkish: Boş ver.
German: Nicht so wichtig.

English: <yes>Alright then. Just remember I only buy in bulk.
French: <yes>Très bien. Mais souviens-toi que je n'achète qu'en gros.
Russian: <yes>Тогда ладно. Просто помни, я покупаю только оптом.
Japanese: <yes>ああ、わかった。念のためだが、まとめ買い限定だよ。
Korean: <yes>그래 좋네, 난 통 크게 도매만 한다는 거 기억하고.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>好啊，不過你要記得，我只收大量的貨哦。
Thai: <yes>ก็มีนะ แต่อย่าลืมว่าฉันซื้อแบบยกชุดเท่านั้น
Indonesian: <yes>Baiklah kalau begitu. Ingatlah aku hanya membeli dalam jumlah besar.
Italian: <yes>Va bene. Ma ricordati che compro solo in grandi quantità.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Muy bien. Recuerda que solo compro al por mayor.
Portuguese: <yes>Tudo bem. Mas não se esqueça que só compro em lote.
Turkish: <yes>Pekâlâ. Unutma, sadece toplu olarak satın alırım.
German: <yes>Also gut. Denk aber daran, dass ich nur in großen Mengen kaufe.

English: I won't take anything less than 50 of an item.
French: Je n'achète aucune quantité d'objets inférieure à 50 unités.
Russian: Я не возьму ничего в партии менее 50 единиц.
Chinese (Simplified): 单件物品少于 50 件不收。
Japanese: 50点以上のセットじゃないと買い取れないな。
Chinese (Traditional): 我不會接受少於 50 個的物品。
Thai: ฉันจะไม่ซื้ออะไรที่มีจำนวนต่ำกว่า 50 ชิ้น
Indonesian: Aku tidak akan mengambil jumlah item kurang dari 50.
Italian: Non accetterò mai meno di 50 unità di un articolo.
Spanish (Latin Americas): No acepto menos de 50 unidades de cada objeto.
Portuguese: Não fico com menos de 50 unidades de um item.
Turkish: Bir eşyanın en az 50 tanesini alırım.
German: Ich akzeptiere Waren erst ab 50 Stück pro Gegenstand.

English: But I will pay double, just for you, <PlayerName>.
French: Mais je payerai double, juste pour toi, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Но я заплачу двойную цену, только для тебя, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 不过我愿意付双倍价钱，只有你一个人能享受这待遇，<PlayerName>。
Japanese: ただし、<PlayerName>になら倍額払う。
Korean: 하지만 <PlayerName> 자네를 봐서 값은 두 배로 쳐 주지.
Chinese (Traditional): 我願意為你付雙倍的價錢喔，<PlayerName>。
Thai: แต่ฉันจะให้ราคาสองเท่าจากปกติ แค่สำหรับเธอคนเดียวนะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Namun, aku akan membayar dua kali lipat, hanya untukmu <PlayerName>.
Italian: Ma pagherò il doppio solo per te, <PlayerName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pero te pagaré el doble, solo porque eres tú, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Mas pagarei o dobro. Só porque é para você, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Ama sana iki kat ödeme yaparım. Sadece senin hatırın için <PlayerName>.
German: Aber weil du es bist, <PlayerName>, zahle ich das Doppelte.

English: Have a great day.
French: Bonne journée.
Russian: Хорошего дня.
Chinese (Traditional): 祝你今天愉快。
Thai: โชคดีนะ
Indonesian: Semoga harimu menyenangkan.
Italian: Buona giornata.
Turkish: İyi günler.
German: Ich wünsche dir einen schönen Tag.

English: I never wanted to come to this wretched place you know, <PlayerName>.þ
French: Je ne voulais pas revenir dans cet endroit misérable, tu sais,, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Знаешь, мне никогда не хотелось в это никудышнее место, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 我从没想过要来这鬼地方，<PlayerName>。
Japanese: <PlayerName>、こんな粗末な地に来ようなんて思ったことはなかった。
Korean: 난 이 초라한 곳에 오고 싶지 않았단다, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): <PlayerName>，你知道嗎，我根本就不想來這個鬼地方。
Thai: รู้อะไรไหม จริงๆ แล้วฉันไม่ได้อยากย้ายมาดินแดนกันดารนี่เลยนะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Terus terang, aku tidak pernah mau datang ke tempat celaka ini, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Non ho mai voluto venire in questo posto miserabile, sai, <PlayerName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Nunca quise venir a este lugar desdichado, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Sabe, eu nunca quis vir para este lugar miserável, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Bu sefil yere gelmeyi hiç istememiştim biliyor musun <PlayerName>?
German: Ich wollte nie an diesem elenden Ort landen, weißt du, <PlayerName>.

English: <no>My mother always said I had no ambition, no drive.þ
French: <no>Ma mère me disait toujours que je n'avais aucune ambition, aucune motivation.
Russian: <no>Мама всегда говорила, что у меня ни амбиций, ни стремления.
Chinese (Simplified): <no>可我母亲总说我没志向，没动力。
Japanese: <no>母からは、いつも野心も意欲もないと言われていた。
Korean: <no>어머니는 항상 내게 야망도 없고, 의욕도 없다고 하셨지.
Chinese (Traditional): <no>我媽總是說我沒什麼志向，也沒什麼幹勁。
Thai: <no>แม่ของฉันเคยพูดบ่อยๆ ว่าฉันไม่รู้จักขวนขวาย ไม่กระตือรือร้น
Indonesian: <no>Ibuku selalu bilang aku tak punya ambisi, tak punya semangat.
Italian: <no>Mia madre diceva sempre che non avevo ambizione, né grinta.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Mi madre siempre decía que yo no tenía ambición ni empuje.
Portuguese: <no>Minha mãe sempre me disse que eu não tinha ambição, não tinha garra.
Turkish: <no>Annem hep hiçbir hedefim, motivasyonum olmadığını söylerdi.
German: <no>Meine Mutter sagte immer, ich hätte keinen Ehrgeiz, keinen Antrieb.

English: Well, when she died I was expecting to have all her <Dinks> you see?þ
French: Eh bien, quand elle est morte, je pensais hériter de tous ses <Dinks> tu vois ?
Russian: Ну, после ее смерти я рассчитывал забрать все ее <Dinks>, понимаешь?
Chinese (Simplified): 她去世的时候，我本以为能继承全部<Dinks>！
Japanese: 母が亡くなったとき、その<Dinks>を全額もらえると思っていた。
Korean: 어머니가 돌아가셨을 때 나는 그분의 <Dinks>가 모두 내 차지일 거라고 생각했어.
Chinese (Traditional): 嗯，她過世的時候，我以為我會繼承她所有的<Dinks>，你懂嗎？
Thai: ทีนี้พอแม่ตาย ฉันนึกว่า <Dinks> ทั้งหมดของท่านจะตกทอดมาที่ฉัน
Indonesian: Nah, saat dia meninggal, sudah pasti aku menduga akan mewarisi semua <Dinks> miliknya, bukan?
Italian: Beh, quando è morta mi aspettavo di avere tutti i suoi <Dinks>, capisci?
Spanish (Latin Americas): Bien, cuando murió, yo esperaba quedarme con todos sus <Dinks>, ¿sabes?
Portuguese: Bem, quando ela morreu, eu estava esperando ficar com todos os <Dinks> dela, né?
Turkish: Annem öldüğünde tüm <Dinks>lerini almayı bekliyordum.
German: Nun, als sie starb, erwartete ich, all ihre <Dinks> zu bekommen, weißt du?

English: Unfortunately she demanded that I get out of <SouthCity>.
French: Malheureusement, elle a demandé à ce que je quitte <SouthCity>.
Russian: К сожалению, она потребовала, чтобы я убрался из <SouthCity>.
Chinese (Simplified): 倒霉的是，她要求我必须搬离<SouthCity>。
Japanese: 残念ながら、母は私が<SouthCity>から去るよう要求した。
Korean: 안타깝게도 어머니는 나보고 <SouthCity>에서 나가라는 유언을 남기셨단다.
Chinese (Traditional): 很遺憾，她直接叫我滾出<SouthCity>。
Thai: แต่โชคไม่ดีเลยที่ท่านสั่งเอาไว้ว่าฉันจะต้องย้ายออกจาก <SouthCity>
Indonesian: Sayangnya dia berwasiat agar aku keluar dari <SouthCity>.
Italian: Sfortunatamente mi ha chiesto di lasciare <SouthCity>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Por desgracia, exigió que me fuera de <SouthCity>.
Portuguese: Infelizmente, ela exigiu que eu deixasse o <SouthCity>.
Turkish: Ne yazık ki <SouthCity>'nden çıkmamı talep etti.
German: Leider hat sie verlangt, dass ich <SouthCity> verlasse.

English: <no>Can you believe she demanded that I go start a business if I wanted to inherit her money!þ
French: <no>Peux-tu le croire, elle a demandé à ce que je parte et crée une entreprise si je voulais hériter de son argent !
Russian: <no>Можешь поверить, что она потребовала от меня начать бизнес, если я хочу унаследовать ее деньги!
Chinese (Simplified): <no>你敢相信，如果我想继承她的遗产，就必须去创业！
Japanese: <no>母からは、財産を相続したければ、ビジネスを立ち上げるんだと言われたよ。信じられないだろう！
Korean: <no>어머니 돈을 물려받고 싶다면 사업을 시작하라는 거야. 말이 되는 소리니?!
Chinese (Traditional): <no>你能相信嗎？她竟然要求我去創業，才肯讓我繼承她的錢！
Thai: <no>เชื่อไหมว่าท่านสั่งว่าฉันจะต้องออกไปก่อตั้งธุรกิจของตัวเองถึงจะได้รับเงินมรดก!
Indonesian: <no>Sulit dipercaya dia menyuruhku untuk memulai bisnis jika aku ingin mewarisi uangnya!
Italian: <no>Riesci a credere che mi abbia chiesto di aprire un'attività se volevo ereditare i suoi soldi?
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>¿Puedes creer que me exigió que empezara un negocio para poder heredar su dinero?
Portuguese: <no>Você acredita que ela exigiu que eu começasse um negócio para poder herdar o dinheiro dela?
Turkish: <no>Onun parasını miras almak istiyorsam bir iş kurmam gerekiyormuş, inanabiliyor musun?
German: <no>Stell dir vor, sie verlangte, ich solle ein Unternehmen gründen, wenn ich ihr Geld erben wolle!

English: <no>Even in death, that woman is so selfish.þ
French: <no>Même dans la mort, cette femme est égoïste.
Russian: <no>Эта женщина даже после смерти не в меру эгоистична.
Chinese (Simplified): <no>那女人即便死了也还是如此自私。
Japanese: <no>あの女は、死んでもなお利己的だ。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>那個女人就算死了還是那麼自私。
Thai: <no>ขนาดตายไปแล้วยังเห็นแก่ตัวอะไรขนาดนี้
Indonesian: <no>Bahkan setelah mati pun, perempuan itu sangat egois.
Italian: <no>Anche nella morte, quella donna era così egoista.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Incluso ahora que ya no está sigue siendo tan egoísta.
Portuguese: <no>Mesmo depois de morta, aquela mulher é tão egoísta.
Turkish: <no>Öldüğünde bile inanılmaz bencil bir kadındı.
German: <no>Selbst im Tod ist diese Frau so selbstsüchtig.

English: My family were some of the first to make it to <SouthCity> back when the world was going south. þ
French: Ma famille a été l'une des premières à arriver à <SouthCity> quand le monde a commencé à migrer vers le sud.
Russian: Моя семья была одной из первых, кто добрался в <SouthCity>, когда мир двинулся на юг.
Chinese (Simplified): 世界南下时，我们家族是第一批到<SouthCity>的。
Japanese: 私の家族は、世界が下向きになったときに<SouthCity>へと移動した最初の人々に含まれる。
Korean: 모든 게 남쪽으로 가기 전, 가장 먼저 <SouthCity>에 도착했던 사람들 가운데 우리 가족이 있었단다.
Chinese (Traditional): 當世界開始變糟時，我們家是最早一批搬去<SouthCity>的人。
Thai: ตระกูลของฉันเป็นหนึ่งในครอบครัวแรกๆ ที่ตั้งรกรากใน <SouthCity> เมื่อสมัยที่โลกตกต่ำ
Indonesian: Keluargaku termasuk yang pertama berhasil datang ke <SouthCity> ketika dunia sedang mengalami krisis.
Italian: La mia famiglia è stata tra le prime ad arrivare a <SouthCity> quando il mondo ha iniziato ad andare a rotoli.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Mi familia fue de las primeras en llegar a <SouthCity> cuando todo se hundía.
Portuguese: Minha família foi uma das primeiras a chegar ao <SouthCity> quando tudo estava dando errado no mundo.
Turkish: Dünya güneye inerken ailem <SouthCity>'ne ilk gelenler arasındaydı.
German: Meine Familie gehörte zu den Ersten, die es nach <SouthCity> geschafft haben, als alles den Bach runterging.

English: We got in very early. I guess you could say we had first class tickets!þ
French: Nous sommes arrivés en premier. Je pense qu'on peut dire que nous avions des tickets de première classe !
Russian: Мы приехали очень рано. Думаю, можно сказать, у нас были билеты первого класса!
Chinese (Simplified): 我们去得非常早，可以说是坐的头等舱！
Japanese: 相当早く移住したよ。ファーストクラスチケットと言えよう！
Korean: 아주 일찍 도착했지. 일등석 표를 가지고 있었다고나 할까!
Chinese (Traditional): 我們超早就去了！可以說我們拿的是頭等艙票呢！
Thai: เรามาถึงก่อนคนอื่นนานมาก ถ้าว่ากันง่ายๆ คือเหมือนได้ตั๋วชั้นหนึ่้ง!
Indonesian: Kami masuk sangat awal. Bisa dibilang kami mendapatkan tiket kelas satu!
Italian: Siamo arrivati molto presto. Immagino che si possa dire che avevamo biglietti di prima classe!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Llegamos bien temprano. Supongo que se podría decir que teníamos billetes de primera clase.
Portuguese: Nós chegamos muito cedo. Acho que poderia dizer que tínhamos bilhetes de primeira classe!
Turkish: Çok erken geldik. Birinci sınıf biletlerimiz vardı da diyebiliriz!
German: Wir kamen sehr früh dort an. Man könnte wohl sagen, wir hatten Tickets erster Klasse!

English: I’ve been told that things were very good before more and more riff-raff started turning up.þ
French: On m'a dit que tout se passait bien avant que de plus en plus de voyous n'arrivent.
Russian: Мне говорили, что все было очень хорошо, пока не стало появляться все больше и больше всякого сброда.
Chinese (Simplified): 原本一切都很美好，直到越来越多的下等人出现。
Japanese: 下品な連中が現れるようになる前は、万事がとても良好だったと聞く。
Korean: 쓸모 없는 사람들이 점점 많아지기 전까지만 해도 상황이 아주 좋았다고 들었어.
Chinese (Traditional): 聽說以前這裡的情況很好，直到越來越多不三不四的人出現。
Thai: ฉันฟังมาว่าทุกอย่างไปได้สวยก่อนที่พวกยาจกทั้งหลายจะย้ายเข้ามากันมากขึ้นเรื่อยๆ
Indonesian: Katanya, semuanya sangat baik sebelum makin banyak orang amburadul yang mulai bermunculan.
Italian: Mi è stato detto che le cose andavano molto bene prima che iniziasse ad arrivare sempre più gentaglia.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Me han dicho que todo iba muy bien hasta que empezó a aparecer mucha gentuza.
Portuguese: Disseram-me que as coisas eram muito boas antes da gentalha começar a chegar.
Turkish: Önceleri her şey çok iyiymiş ama daha fazla ayaktakımı gelmeye başlamış.
German: Mir wurde gesagt, alles sei bestens gewesen, bevor sich immer mehr Gesindel breit machte.

English: <no>Wanting to be fed, wanting a place to sleep and generally just wanting more than they could afford.þ
French: <no>Ils voulaient être nourris, logés, en fait ils en voulaient plus que ce qu'ils pouvaient se permettre.
Russian: <no>Эти люди хотели жрать, искали, где поспать, и в целом просто хотели больше, чем могли себе позволить.
Chinese (Simplified): <no>他们想要食物，想要睡觉的地方，想要根本负担不起的东西。
Japanese: <no>食べ物や寝る場所を求めたりして、すべてにおいて買える以上のものを期待する連中だ。
Korean: <no>먹을 거랑 잠잘 곳을 달라고 하고, 자기 형편보다 더 많은 걸 원하는 사람들 말이야.
Chinese (Traditional): <no>想要吃的，想要睡覺的地方，總是想要比自己負擔得起的更多。
Thai: <no>เดี๋ยวก็อยากได้อาหารบ้างล่ะ อยากได้ที่ซุกหัวนอนบ้างล่ะ สรุปคืออยากได้โน่นนี่เกินกว่าที่ตัวเองจะจ่ายไหว
Indonesian: <no>Ingin diberi makan, ingin tempat untuk tidur dan kebanyakan menginginkan lebih dari yang mereka mampu beli.
Italian: <no>Tutti desiderosi di essere nutriti, di avere un posto dove dormire e, in generale, di avere più di quanto possano permettersi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Querían algo para comer, un lugar donde dormir y, en general, más de lo que podían permitirse.
Portuguese: <no>Querendo ser alimentadas, querendo um lugar para dormir e, normalmente, querendo mais do que aquilo que poderiam pagar.
Turkish: <no>Beslenme ihtiyacı, barınma ihtiyacı ve genel olarak karşılayabildiklerinden daha fazla şeye ihtiyacı olan insanlar.
German: <no>Diese Leute wollten Nahrung, einen Platz zum Schlafen und ganz allgemein mehr, als sie sich leisten konnten.

English: Luckily, my family kept our inheritance and passed it down generation to generation.þ
French: Heureusement, ma famille a conservé son héritage qui s'est transmis de génération en génération.
Russian: К счастью, моя семья сохранила наше наследство и передавала его из поколения в поколение.
Chinese (Simplified): 幸好我们家族留有遗产并代代相传。
Japanese: 幸い、私の家族は遺産を守り、それを何世代にもわたって受け継いできたんだ。
Korean: 다행히도 우리 가족은 유산을 물려받아 잘 보관해서 대대로 물려주었단다.
Chinese (Traditional): 幸運的是，我們家族一直保留著遺產，並且一代一代地傳承下來。
Thai: ดีนะที่ตระกูลของฉันรักษาสมบัติเอาไว้ได้แล้วส่งต่อกันมาจากรุ่นสู่รุ่น
Indonesian: Untungnya, keluargaku menjaga warisan kami dan mewariskannya dari generasi ke generasi.
Italian: Fortunatamente, la mia famiglia ha conservato la nostra eredità e l'ha tramandata di generazione in generazione.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Por suerte, mi familia conservó nuestra herencia y la transmitió de generación en generación.
Portuguese: Por sorte, a minha família manteve a nossa herança e passou essa riqueza de geração a geração.
Turkish: Neyse ki ailem mirasını korudu ve nesilden nesle aktardı.
German: Zum Glück hat meine Familie das Erbe behalten und es von Generation zu Generation weitergegeben.

English: Hmph, nice to know that the rich stay rich, eh, <PlayerName>?þ
French: Pff, il est bon de savoir que les riches restent riches, pas vrai, <PlayerName> ?
Russian: Хмм, приятно знать, что богатые остаются богатыми, да, <PlayerName>?
Chinese (Simplified): 嗯，知道富人会永远保持富有很开心吧，<PlayerName>？
Japanese: フン、金持ちが金持ちであり続けるのだよ。<PlayerName>。
Korean: 흠, 한 번 부자는 평생 부자라는 걸 배우니 좋지, <PlayerName>?
Chinese (Traditional): 嗯哼，知道有錢人就是會一直有錢不錯吧，<PlayerName>？
Thai: ฮึ่ม รู้สึกดีเนอะที่เศรษฐีที่ยังรวยไปเรื่อยๆ ว่าไหม <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Hmph, senang rasanya kalau tahu orang kaya tetap kaya, ya, <PlayerName>?
Italian: Hmph, è bello sapere che i ricchi continuano a essere ricchi, eh <PlayerName>?
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pfff, es bueno saber que los ricos nunca dejan de serlo, ¿no, <PlayerName>?
Portuguese: Hum, é bom saber que os ricos continuam ricos, né, <PlayerName>?
Turkish: Zenginlerin yine zengin kaldığını bilmek güzel, değil mi <PlayerName>?
German: Pff, schön zu wissen, dass die Reichen reich bleiben, was, <PlayerName>?

English: As soon as my obligations are met here on <IslandName> I will be leaving post haste.þ
French: Dès que j'aurai rempli mes obligations ici sur <IslandName> je partirai en toute hâte.
Russian: Как только мои обязательства здесь на острове <IslandName> будут выполнены, я поспешу уехать.
Chinese (Simplified): 等<IslandName>的事忙完，我将立即离开。
Japanese: <IslandName>での義務を果たしたら、今すぐにでも去るよ。
Korean: <IslandName>에서 내 의무를 다 마치면 서둘러 떠날 거야.
Chinese (Traditional): 一旦我在<IslandName>這邊的事情處理完，我就會馬上離開。
Thai: ทันทีที่ฉันทำตามข้อผูกมัดครบทั้งหมดบนเกาะ <IslandName> แห่งนี้ ฉันจะย้ายออกโดยเร็วที่สุด
Indonesian: Begitu kewajibanku terpenuhi di <IslandName> ini, aku akan segera pergi.
Italian: Non appena avrò adempiuto ai miei obblighi qui a <IslandName>, me ne andrò in fretta e furia.
Spanish (Latin Americas): En cuanto cumpla con todas mis obligaciones aquí en <IslandName>, me marcharé sin dudarlo.
Portuguese: Assim que as minhas obrigações estejam cumpridas aqui em <IslandName>, vou embora imediatamente.
Turkish: <IslandName> Adası'ndaki zorunlu görevimi tamamladıktan sonra hemen ayrılacağım buradan.
German: Sobald meine Verpflichtungen hier auf <IslandName> erfüllt sind, werde ich schleunigst abreisen.

English: <no>The people here are… too nice.þ
French: <no>Les gens ici sont… trop gentils.
Russian: <no>Люди здесь... слишком хороши.
Japanese: <no>だが、ここの連中は…あまりにも最高だ。
Chinese (Traditional): <no>這裡的人也……太好了吧。
Thai: <no>คนที่นี่… เป็นมิตรมากเกินไป
Indonesian: <no>Orang-orang di sini... terlalu baik.
Italian: <no>La gente qui è... troppo gentile.
Turkish: <no>Buradaki insanlar… çok iyi.
German: <no>Die Leute hier sind … zu freundlich.

English: Everyone seems to get along.þ
French: Tout le monde semble bien s'entendre.
Russian: Кажется, все ладят между собой.
Japanese: みんなが仲良くしているな。
Chinese (Traditional): 大家看起來都相處得不錯。
Thai: ทุกคนดูเข้ากันได้ดี
Indonesian: Semua orang tampak akur.
Italian: Sembra che tutti vadano d'accordo.
Portuguese: Todo mundo parece se dar bem.
Turkish: Herkes birbiriyle anlaşıyor.
German: Alle scheinen sich gut zu verstehen.

English: Hmph. Give me <SouthCity> any day.þ
French: Pff. Je préfère vraiment <SouthCity>.
Russian: Хмм. Дай мне <SouthCity> в любой день.
Chinese (Traditional): 嗯哼，隨便哪天給我<SouthCity>都可以。
Thai: ฮึ่ม ถึงยังไงฉันก็เลือก <SouthCity> ก่อนเสมอ
Indonesian: Hmph. Aku lebih suka <SouthCity> kapan saja.
Italian: Hmph. Preferisco di gran lunga <SouthCity>.
Turkish: Hmm. Ben <SouthCity>'ni istiyorum.
German: Pff. Ich würde <SouthCity> jederzeit vorziehen.

English: At least there, people know how I should be treated.þ
French: Au moins, là-bas, les gens savent comment me traiter.
Russian: Там по крайней мере знают, как со мной следует обращаться.
Chinese (Simplified): 至少那里的人懂得如何对待我。
Japanese: 少なくともあっちでは、みんな私の扱い方を知っている。
Korean: 적어도 그곳 사람들은 내가 어떤 대우를 받아야 하는지 알고 있거든.
Chinese (Traditional): 至少在那裡，大家都知道該怎麼對待我。
Thai: อย่างน้อยคนที่นั่นก็รู้ว่าควรปฏิบัติต่อฉันอย่างไร
Indonesian: Setidaknya di sana, orang-orang tahu bagaimana aku harus diperlakukan.
Italian: Almeno lì la gente sa come dovrei essere trattato.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Al menos allí saben cómo tratarme.
Portuguese: Pelo menos por lá, as pessoas sabem como eu devo ser tratado.
Turkish: En azından oradaki insanlar bana nasıl davranmaları gerektiğini biliyorlar.
German: Dort weiß man wenigstens, wie man mich zu behandeln hat.

English: <proud>Hmph, <SouthCity> is so much better than <IslandName>. þ
French: <proud>Pff, <SouthCity> est bien supérieure à <IslandName>.
Russian: <proud>Хмм, <SouthCity> намного лучше, чем <IslandName>.
Japanese: <proud>フン。<SouthCity>の方が<IslandName>より全然いいよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <proud>嗯哼，<SouthCity>還是比<IslandName>好太多了。
Thai: <proud>ฮึ่ม <SouthCity> ดีกว่าเกาะ <IslandName> มากๆ
Indonesian: <proud>Hmph, <SouthCity> jauh lebih baik daripada <IslandName>.
Italian: <proud>Hmph, <SouthCity> è molto meglio di <IslandName>.
Turkish: <proud>Hmm, <SouthCity> <IslandName> Adası'ndan daha iyi.
German: <proud>Pff, <SouthCity> ist so viel besser als <IslandName>.

English: <yes>There are so many more people willing to put money into banks and the like.þ
French: <yes>Il y a beaucoup plus de personnes qui veulent placer leur argent dans une banque.
Russian: <yes>Там намного больше желающих положить деньги в банк и все такое.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>那里有许多人愿意往银行里存钱。
Japanese: <yes>銀行などにお金を預ける人がいっぱいいる。
Korean: <yes>은행 같은 곳에 돈을 넣어 두려는 사람들이 훨씬 많거든.
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>現在有越來越多人願意把錢存進銀行之類的地方。
Thai: <yes>มีคนมากมายที่ยินดีเอาเงินมาฝากไว้กับธนาคาร และอะไรทำนองนี้
Indonesian: <yes>Ada banyak orang yang mau menyimpan uang di bank dan semacamnya.
Italian: <yes>Ci sono molte più persone disposte a mettere il proprio denaro in banca e cose simili.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Allí hay mucha más gente dispuesta a confiarles dinero a los bancos y esas cosas.
Portuguese: <yes>Há muito mais pessoas dispostas a colocar dinheiro nos bancos e coisas assim.
Turkish: <yes>Orada bankaya para yatırmak isteyen daha fazla insan var.
German: <yes>Es gibt dort so viel mehr Menschen, die bereit sind, Geld in Banken und dergleichen zu investieren.

English: Hmph, I must admit, <IslandName> is somewhat of an up and coming place to be.þ
French: Pff, je dois l'admettre, <IslandName> est en quelque sorte un lieu en devenir.
Russian: Хмм, должен признаться, <IslandName> — довольно перспективное место.
Chinese (Simplified): 嗯，不得不说，<IslandName>是一个未来光明的好地方。
Japanese: フン。<IslandName>が将来有望な場所であることは認めなければならない。
Korean: 흠, 하지만 <IslandName>도 어느 정도 발전하고 있다는 건 인정해야겠어.
Chinese (Traditional): 嗯哼，我得承認，<IslandName>還真是越來越有看頭了。
Thai: ฮึ่ม แต่ต้องยอมรับว่าเกาะ <IslandName> เป็นที่แห่งใหม่ซึ่งมีศักยภาพที่จะประสบความสำเร็จ
Indonesian: Hmph, harus kuakui, <IslandName> adalah tempat yang sedang naik daun.
Italian: Hmph, devo ammetterlo, <IslandName> è un posto in ascesa.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pfff, debo admitir que <IslandName> es un lugar bastante prometedor para quedarse.
Portuguese: Hum, tenho de admitir que <IslandName> é um lugar que pode trazer oportunidades.
Turkish: Ama kabul etmeliyim ki <IslandName> Adası'nda da bir yükseliş trendi başladı.
German: Pff, ich muss schon zugeben, dass <IslandName> ein aufstrebender Ort ist.

English: <thinking>Maybe I should invest in some property here...þ
French: <thinking>Je devrais peut-être investir dans des propriétés ici...
Russian: <thinking>Возможно, мне стоит вложиться здесь в какую-то недвижимость...
Chinese (Simplified): <thinking>也许我应该在这里投资一些地产…
Japanese: <thinking>私もここで不動産に投資すべきかもな…
Korean: <thinking>아무래도 이곳에서 부동산 투자를 하는 게 좋겠군...
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>或許我該在這裡買塊地吧……
Thai: <thinking>ฉันว่าฉันควรลงทุนอสังหาริมทรัพย์บนเกาะนี้...
Indonesian: <thinking>Mungkin aku harus berinvestasi di beberapa properti di sini...
Italian: <thinking>Forse dovrei investire in qualche proprietà qui...
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Quizás debería invertir en alguna propiedad aquí…
Portuguese: <thinking>Talvez eu devesse investir em algumas propriedades daqui...
Turkish: <thinking>Belki de burada birkaç mülke yatırım yapmalıyım...
German: <thinking>Vielleicht sollte ich hier in ein Grundstück investieren …

English: Hmph. <IslandName> sure has changed a lot since you got here, <PlayerName>.þ
French: Pff. <IslandName> a vraiment changé depuis que tu es là, <PlayerName>.
Russian: Хмм, <IslandName> несомненно очень изменился с тех пор. как ты здесь, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Simplified): 嗯。自从你到之后，<IslandName>迎来了翻天覆地的变化，<PlayerName>。
Japanese: フン。<PlayerName>が来て以来、<IslandName>は大いに変わったものだな。
Korean: 흠. 네가 온 뒤로 <IslandName> 섬이 정말 많이 바뀌었구나, <PlayerName>.
Chinese (Traditional): 嗯哼，<PlayerName>，自從你來到這裡之後，<IslandName>這裡真的變了好多啊。
Thai: ฮึ่ม เกาะ <IslandName> เปลี่ยนไปอย่างมากตั้งแต่ที่เธอย้ายมานะ <PlayerName>
Indonesian: Hmph. <IslandName> memang sudah banyak berubah sejak kamu tiba di sini, <PlayerName>.
Italian: Hmph. <IslandName> è sicuramente cambiata molto da quando sei arrivato qui, <PlayerName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Pfff. Definitivamente, <IslandName> ha cambiado mucho desde que llegaste, <PlayerName>.
Portuguese: Hum. <IslandName> mudou muito desde que você chegou aqui, <PlayerName>.
Turkish: Hmm. Sen geldiğinden beri <IslandName> çok değişmiş <PlayerName>.
German: Pff. <IslandName> hat sich ganz schön verändert, seit du hierher gekommen bist, <PlayerName>.

English: <shy>Hmph, it’s definitely no <SouthCity>, but I guess it’s not all bad here.þ
French: <shy>Pff, cela n'a absolument rien à voir avec <SouthCity>, mais je suppose que ce n'est pas si mal ici.
Russian: <shy>Хмм, это определенно не <SouthCity>, но думаю, здесь не так уж плохо.
Chinese (Simplified): <shy>嗯，虽然这里比不上<SouthCity>，但也还不错。
Japanese: <shy>フン。<SouthCity>とは大違いだが、ここも悪いものではない。
Chinese (Traditional): <shy>嗯哼，這裡雖然比不上<SouthCity>，但也還不算太糟啦。
Thai: <shy>ฮึ่ม ถึงจะดีได้ไม่เท่า <SouthCity> แต่ฉันว่าที่นี่ก็ไม่เลว
Indonesian: <shy>Hmph, ini memang jelas bukan <SouthCity>, tapi kurasa tidak semuanya buruk di sini.
Italian: <shy>Hmph, sicuramente non è <SouthCity>, ma credo che non sia poi così male.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <shy>Pfff, claro que no es <SouthCity>, pero supongo que no está tan mal.
Portuguese: <shy>Hum, realmente não é como o <SouthCity>, mas não é completamente ruim.
Turkish: <shy>Kesinlikle bir <SouthCity> değil ama burası o kadar da kötü değil.
German: <shy>Pff, natürlich ist es mit <SouthCity> nicht vergleichbar, aber ich denke, es ist nicht alles schlecht hier.

English: <thinking>I remember when I constantly wanted to get off <IslandName>.
French: <thinking>Je me souviens du temps où je voulais sans cesse quitter <IslandName>.
Russian: <thinking>Помню, как мне постоянно хотелось уехать с острова <IslandName>.
Japanese: <thinking>私がずっと<IslandName>を去りたいと思っていた頃を思い出すよ。
Chinese (Traditional): <thinking>我記得那時候我一直想要放棄<IslandName>。
Thai: <thinking>ฉันจำได้ว่าฉันเคยนึกอยากย้ายออกจากเกาะ <IslandName> อยู่ตลอด
Indonesian: <thinking>Aku ingat ketika aku ingin keluar dari <IslandName>.
Italian: <thinking>Ricordo quando volevo costantemente andarmene da <IslandName>.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <thinking>Recuerdo cuando todo lo que quería era irme de <IslandName>.
Portuguese: <thinking>Lembro-me de quando eu estava constantemente querendo sair de <IslandName>.
Turkish: <thinking>Sürekli <IslandName> Adası'ndan ayrılmak istediğim zamanları hatırlıyorum.
German: <thinking>Ich weiß noch, wie ich <IslandName> immer verlassen wollte.

English: <yes>But it is actually very tolerable here.þ
French: <yes>Mais c'est en fait très tolérable ici.
Russian: <yes>Но тут на самом деле вполне терпимо.
Chinese (Simplified): <yes>但我现在其实能忍受这里了。
Japanese: <yes>だが実のところ、この地は許容範囲だ。
Chinese (Traditional): <yes>其實這裡還蠻不錯的啦。
Thai: <yes>แต่ก็พบว่าที่นี่ก็ไม่แย่เกินทน
Indonesian: <yes>Namun, sebenarnya tempat ini sangat bisa ditoleransi.
Italian: <yes>Ma qui la situazione è davvero molto tollerabile.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <yes>Pero es un lugar que se tolera muy bien.
Portuguese: <yes>Mas, a verdade é que é até bem suportável aqui.
Turkish: <yes>Ama burayı artık tolere etmeye başladım.
German: <yes>Aber eigentlich ist es ganz erträglich hier.

English: <no>These days, I only occasionally want to escape this wretched place.þ
French: <no>Ces jours-ci, ce n'est qu'occasionnellement que je veux m'échapper de cet endroit misérable.
Russian: <no>В последнее время мне только изредка хочется сбежать из этого никудышного места.
Chinese (Simplified): <no>最近只是偶尔想逃离这破地方。
Japanese: <no>最近は、たまにしかこの粗末な地から逃れたいとは思わないよ。
Korean: <no>요즘에는 이 초라한 곳에서 벗어나고 싶은 생각이 가끔씩만 들거든.
Chinese (Traditional): <no>這些日子，我偶爾才會想逃離這個鬼地方。
Thai: <no>ทุกวันนี้ฉันนึกอยากย้ายออกจากดินแดนกันดารนี่แค่เป็นครั้งคราว
Indonesian: <no>Sekarang ini, aku hanya sesekali saja ingin keluar dari tempat yang menyedihkan ini.
Italian: <no>Ultimamente, solo ogni tanto ho voglia di scappare da questo posto miserabile.
Spanish (Latin Americas): <no>Hoy solo cada tanto me dan ganas de abandonar este desdichado lugar.
Portuguese: <no>Por agora, a vontade de escapar deste local miserável só me ocorre de vez em quando.
Turkish: <no>Şimdilerde sadece "bazen" bu sefil yerden kaçmak istiyorum.
German: <no>Dieser Tage möchte ich diesem elenden Ort nur noch gelegentlich entkommen.

English: None
French: Aucun
Russian: Нет
Chinese (Traditional): 無
Thai: None
Indonesian: Tidak ada
Italian: Nessuno
Turkish: Yok
German: Keine

English: Picking fruit and logs off the ground will get you far in this place. Here is a milestone for gathering lots of stuff up.
French: Ramasser des fruits et des bûches sur le sol te permettra d'aller loin ici. Voici un jalon pour avoir ramassé beaucoup de choses.
Russian: Собирая фрукты и бревна с земли, вы далеко здесь пойдете. Вот цель за сбор множества материалов.
Chinese (Simplified): 多捡一些地上的水果和木头才能在这里走得更远。完成“收集大量材料”里程碑。
Japanese: この世界では、地面から果物や丸太を拾うことで先に進むことができるんだ。これはたくさん集めた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 여기서는 바닥의 과일과 나무토막을 주우면 유용할 거예요. 물건을 많이 모았으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 在地上撿水果和木材，你會越來越厲害喔！這是你收集這麼多東西的里程碑。
Thai: เธอจะก้าวหน้าไปได้ไกลถ้าหมั่นเก็บผลไม้และท่อนไม้เป็นประจำ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการเก็บสะสมของมากมาย
Indonesian: Mengambil buah dan batang kayu dari tanah akan sangat bermanfaat bagimu. Ini milestone dari mengumpulkan banyak barang.
Italian: Raccogliere frutta e tronchi da terra ti porterà lontano in questo posto. Ecco un obiettivo per la raccolta di oggetti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Recoger frutas y troncos del suelo te hará llegar lejos en este lugar. Aquí tienes un hito por haber recolectado muchas cosas.
Portuguese: Coletar frutas e troncos do chão ajudará no seu progresso por aqui. Aqui está um prêmio por coletar muitas coisas.
Turkish: Yerden meyve ve kütük topladığında ilerleme kaydedersin. Bu topladıkların için başarı kazandın.
German: Mit dem Aufsammeln von Obst und Stämmen vom Boden kommst du hier weit. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Sammeln von Material.

English: Planting seeds in the red dirt. They grow up so fast. Here is a milestone for planting some seeds.
French: Semer des graines dans la terre rouge. Elles poussent si vite. Voici un jalon pour avoir planté des graines.
Russian: Сажаем семена в краснозем. Они растут так быстро. Вот цель за посадку семян.
Chinese (Simplified): 在红土里撒下种子，种子会迅速地生长。完成“播种”里程碑。
Japanese: 赤い土にまいた種は、ぐんぐんと成長するよ。これは種をまいた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 붉은 흙에 씨앗을 심으면 금세 자라요. 씨앗을 심었으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 把種子種在紅土裡，種子就會很快發芽長大。這是種下一些種子的里程碑。
Thai: ปลูกเมล็ดพันธุ์ในดินสีแดงแล้วต้นอ่อนจะเติบโตในพริบตา นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการปลูกเมล็ดพันธุ์
Indonesian: Bibit yang ditanam di tanah merah akan tumbuh cepat. Ini milestone dari menanam bibit.
Italian: Piantare semi nella terra rossa. Crescono molto in fretta. Ecco un obiettivo per la semina.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Planta semillas en la tierra roja, ¡crecen muy rápido! Aquí tienes un hito por haber plantado algunas semillas.
Portuguese: Plantar sementes na terra roxa. Elas crescem tão rápido. Aqui está um prêmio por plantar algumas sementes.
Turkish: Kırmızı toprağa ekilen tohumlar hızla büyür. Tohum ektiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Pflanze Samen in der roten Erde. Sie wachsen so schnell. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Einpflanzen von Samen.

English: Who isn’t above selling a rare space rock for some cash? Here is a milestone for selling a meteorite.
Japanese: 宇宙から来た希少な石を売ってお金を稼ぐのは誰もがすることだろう。これは隕石を売った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 희귀한 우주 암석을 현금으로 팔고 싶지 않은 사람이 누가 있을까요? 운석 판매에 대한 이정표는 다음과 같습니다.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Quién no cambiaría una extraña roca espacial por dinero? Aquí tienes un hito por haber vendido un meteorito.
Portuguese: Quem nunca trocou uma rocha espacial rara por dinheiro? Aqui está um prêmio por vender um meteorito.

English: Be careful what you wish for… Or don't? Here is a milestone for making a wish at the Wish Fountain.
Japanese: 願い事は慎重に。さもないと…？これは願いの泉で祈りを上げた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 원하는 것을 조심하세요… 아니면 하지 않나요? 여기 소원분수에서 소원을 빌기 위한 이정표가 있습니다.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Ten cuidado con lo que deseas… ¿o mejor no? Aquí tienes un hito por haber pedido un deseo en la fuente de los deseos.
Portuguese: Cuidado com o que você deseja... Ou não? Aqui está um prêmio por fazer um desejo na Fonte dos Desejos.

English: Watering plants is good for your soul and good for the plant's general health. It's win-win. So here is a milestone for watering a lot of plants!
French: Arroser les plantes, c'est bon pour l'âme et pour la santé globale de la planète. Tout le monde y gagne. Donc, voici un jalon pour avoir arrosé beaucoup de plantes !
Russian: Поливать растения хорошо как для вашей души, так и для их общего здоровья. Обоюдный выигрыш. Так что вот цель за полив множества растений!
Chinese (Simplified): 浇灌植物既对植物发育有好处，又能滋养个人灵魂，不失为双赢。这是浇灌大量植物的里程碑！
Japanese: 種に水をやると、君の心も植物も元気になる！いわゆるWin-Winの関係だね。これは大量に水やりをした人へのマイルストーンだ！
Korean: 식물에 물을 주면 기분이 좋아지고 식물도 튼튼하게 자랄 수 있어요. 식물에 물을 잘 줬으니 추억 조각을 드립니다!
Chinese (Traditional): 幫植物澆水對你的心靈有益，對植物的健康也有益。這是雙贏耶。這是替大量植物澆水的里程碑！
Thai: การรดน้ำจะเติมความสดชื่นให้จิตใจเธอชุ่มฉ่ำและทำให้ต้นไม้แข็งแรง แบบนี้เท่ากับดีสองเด้ง นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการรดน้ำต้นไม้มากมาย!
Indonesian: Menyiram tanaman baik untuk jiwamu dan baik untuk kesehatan tanaman. Sama-sama menguntungkan. Jadi, ini milestone dari menyiram banyak tanaman!
Italian: Annaffiare le piante fa bene alla tua anima e alla salute generale della pianta. È un vantaggio per tutti. Ecco un obiettivo per aver annaffiato un sacco di piante!
Spanish (Latin Americas): Regar las plantas es bueno para su salud y también para tu alma. ¡Es bueno para todos! ¡Aquí tienes un hito por haber regado muchas plantas!
Portuguese: Regar as plantas é bom para sua alma e bom para a saúde das plantas. Bom para todos. Assim, aqui está um prêmio por regar muitas plantas!
Turkish: Bitkileri sulamak hem senin ruhuna hem de bitkinin sağlığına iyi gelir. Çok bitki suladığın için başarı kazandın!
German: Das Gießen von Pflanzen ist gut für die Seele und gut für die Gesundheit der Pflanzen. Alle gewinnen. Hier ist also ein Meilenstein für das Gießen vieler Pflanzen!

English: Smashing rocks is hard work. But sometimes they have stuff in them! Here is a milestone for smashing rocks.
French: C'est dur de casser des pierres. Mais il y a parfois quelque chose à l'intérieur ! Voici un jalon pour avoir cassé des pierres.
Russian: Разбивать камни — тяжелая работа. Но иногда в них кое-что встречается! Вот цель за разбивание камней.
Chinese (Simplified): 粉碎岩石是项辛苦的工作，但石头里面有时藏着好东西！这是粉碎岩石的里程碑。
Japanese: 岩を砕くのは大変なことだが、中から何か見つかることもあるよ！これは岩を砕いた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 돌을 깨는 일은 고되지만 가끔 물건이 나올 때가 있어요! 돌을 깼으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 敲石頭是苦差事，但有時石頭裡面會有東西！這是敲開多塊石頭的里程碑。
Thai: ทุบก้อนหินเป็นงานที่หนักหนา แต่ว่าบางครั้งก็เจอของดีอยู่ข้างใน! นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการทุบก้อนหิน
Indonesian: Menghancurkan batu adalah pekerjaan yang sulit. Namun, kadang ada sesuatu di dalam batu! Ini milestone dari menghancurkan batu.
Italian: Rompere le rocce è un lavoro duro. Ma a volte ci trovi delle cose dentro! Ecco un obiettivo per la frantumazione delle rocce.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Romper rocas es un trabajo duro, pero vale la pena si tienen cosas dentro. Aquí tienes un hito por haber roto rocas.
Portuguese: Quebrar pedras é um trabalho pesado. Mas, às vezes, elas têm coisas por dentro! Aqui está um prêmio por quebrar pedras.
Turkish: Kayaları parçalamak yorucu bir iş. Ama bazen kayaların içinde bir şeyler bulabilirsin! Kayaları parçaladığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Steine zu zertrümmern ist harte Arbeit. Aber manchmal haben sie es in sich! Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Zertrümmern von Steinen.

English: You've smashed a couple of them rocks filled with ore. Here is a milestone for smashing ore deposits.
French: Tu as cassé des pierres contenant du minerai. Voici un jalon pour avoir cassé un gisement de minerai.
Russian: Вы разбили пару камней, наполненных рудой. Вот цель за разбивание залежей руды.
Chinese (Simplified): 你粉碎的一些岩石蕴藏着矿石。这是粉碎矿床的里程碑。
Japanese: 鉱石の含まれた岩を砕いたね。これは鉱脈を掘った人のマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 광물이 든 돌을 깼군요. 광석을 깼으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你敲開好幾塊有礦石的石頭了。這是你敲開這麼多礦藏的里程碑。
Thai: เธอทุบเจอหินที่มีแร่อยู่ข้างใน นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการทุบก้อนแร่
Indonesian: Kamu menghancurkan beberapa batu yang berisi bijih. Ini milestone dari menghancurkan endapan bijih.
Italian: Hai frantumato alcune rocce piene di minerali. Ecco un obiettivo per la frantumazione dei depositi di minerali.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Destrozaste un par de rocas llenas de minerales. Aquí tienes un hito por haber destrozado depósitos de minerales.
Portuguese: Você quebrou algumas que estavam cheias de minério. Aqui está um prêmio por quebrar depósitos de minério.
Turkish: İçinde maden olan kayaları parçaladın. Maden yataklarını parçaladığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Du hast ein paar mit Erz gefüllte Steine zertrümmert. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Aufbrechen von Erzvorkommen.

English: Smelting. Oh, you've been smelting alright. Here is a milestone for smelting ore into bars.
French: Fusion. Oh, c'est sûr, tu t'es mis en fusion. Voici un jalon pour avoir fusionné du minerai en barres.
Russian: Плавка. О, вы плавите как надо. Вот цель за плавку руды в слитки.
Chinese (Simplified): 冶炼工作进行得不错。这是冶矿为锭的里程碑。
Japanese: うまく製錬できたようだね。これは鉱石を延べ棒に精錬した人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 제련을 잘 해냈군요. 광석을 주괴로 제련했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 冶煉。喔，你冶煉不少礦石了。這是將礦石冶煉成金屬錠的里程碑。
Thai: หลอม หลอม หลอมเข้าไป นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการหลอมแร่ให้เป็นแท่ง
Indonesian: Peleburan. Ya, kamu sudah melakukan peleburan dengan baik. Ini milestone dari melebur bijih menjadi batangan.
Italian: Fusione. Cosa c'è di meglio? Ecco un obiettivo per la fusione dei minerali in lingotti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¡Ah, estuviste fundiendo! Aquí tienes un hito por haber convertido minerales en barras.
Portuguese: Derreter. Ah, você está derretendo muito bem. Aqui está um prêmio por derreter minério em barras.
Turkish: Maden eritmek müthiş bir şey. Madenleri külçelere dönüştürdüğün için başarı kazandın.
German: Verhüttung. Oh, du hast ja schon etwas verhüttet. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für die Verhüttung von Erz zu Barren.

English: Grinding rocks down into powder. Here is a milestone for using a stone grinder a bunch.
French: Broyer des pierres en poudre. Voici un jalon pour avoir beaucoup utilisé un broyeur de pierres.
Russian: Измельчение камней в порошок. Вот цель за измельчение кучки в камнедробилке.
Chinese (Simplified): 岩石研磨成粉末。这是多次使用磨石器的里程碑。
Japanese: 岩を砕いて粉にしたね。これはストーングラインダーをたくさん使った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 돌을 갈아서 가루로 만들었군요. 돌절구를 잘 사용했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 把石頭磨成粉末。這是多次使用石磨的里程碑。
Thai: โม่หินให้ละเอียดเป็นผง นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการใช้เครื่องโม่หินบ่อยๆ
Indonesian: Menggerinda batu menjadi bubuk. Ini milestone dari banyak menggunakan gerinda batu.
Italian: Macinare le rocce fino a ridurle in polvere. Ecco un obiettivo per la macinazione della pietra.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Tritura rocas hasta convertirlas en polvo. Aquí tienes un hito por haber usado un molinillo de piedra.
Portuguese: Transformar pedras em pó. Aqui está um prêmio por usar bastante um moedor de pedras.
Turkish: Kayaları öğütüp toza dönüştürüyorsun. Taş öğütücü kullandığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Felsen zu Pulver zermahlen. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für die Verwendung eines Steinschleifers.

English: Sometime trees get in the way and sometimes you just need to borrow their wood for a bit. Here is a milestone for chopping down trees.
French: Parfois, les arbres se mettent en travers du chemin et parfois, tu as besoin d'emprunter leur bois pendant un moment. Voici un jalon pour avoir abattu des arbres.
Russian: Иногда деревья стоят на пути, а иногда нужно просто у них позаимствовать немного древесины. Вот цель за рубку деревьев.
Chinese (Simplified): 树木有时会挡道，而你有时正好需要木材。这是砍树的里程碑。
Japanese: 木が道を塞いでいたり、少しだけ木材が必要だったりすることがあるよね。これは木を切った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 나무가 길을 막을 때도 있고 가끔 목재가 필요할 때도 있어요. 나무를 자른 대가로 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 有時樹會擋路，有時你只是需要借樹的木材一用。這是砍樹的里程碑。
Thai: บางครั้งก็เพราะเกะกะ แต่บางครั้งก็เพราะมีเหตุให้ต้องใช้ไม้ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการโค่นต้นไม้
Indonesian: Kadang pepohonan menghalangi kita sehingga kayunya perlu diambil sedikit. Ini milestone dari menebang pohon.
Italian: A volte gli alberi sono un intralcio, altre volte hai solo bisogno di un po' di legna. Ecco un obiettivo per l'abbattimento degli alberi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): A veces los árboles estorban y otras simplemente necesitas usar su madera. Aquí tienes un hito por haber talado árboles.
Portuguese: Algumas vezes, as árvores atrapalham um pouco, e em outras, precisamos de um pouco de madeira. Aqui está um prêmio por cortar árvores.
Turkish: Bazen ağaçlar sana engel çıkarır bazen de odunlarını ödünç alman gerekir. Ağaç kestiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Manchmal stehen Bäume einfach nur im Weg und manchmal muss man sich ihr Holz für eine Weile ausleihen. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Fällen von Bäumen.

English: You can't just chop a tree down and leave the stump. Here is a milestone for getting rid of the lil' stumps that are there after the tree falls down.
French: Tu ne peux pas abattre un arbre et laisser la souche. Voici un jalon pour avoir retiré les petites souches qui restent après l'abattage des arbres.
Russian: Нельзя просто так срубить дерево и оставить пень. Вот цель за избавление от пеньков, остающихся после падения деревьев.
Chinese (Simplified): 砍完树之后，留着树桩不管可不行。这是清理砍树留下的小树桩的里程碑。
Japanese: 木を切ったあとに切り株を放置してはダメ！これは木を切った後の小さな切り株を取り除いた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 나무를 자른 후에는 그루터기를 남기면 안 돼요. 쓰러진 나무의 그루터기를 없앤 대가로 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你不能只砍樹而把樹樁留在原地。這是你砍完樹後清除小樹樁的里程碑。
Thai: โค่นต้นไม้เสร็จแล้วจะทิ้งตอไว้ทั้งอย่างนั้นไม่ได้นะ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการจำกัดตอน้อยใหญ่หลังล้มไม้
Indonesian: Kita tidak bisa menebang pohon dan meninggalkan tunggulnya begitu saja. Ini milestone dari menyingkirkan tunggul kecil yang ada setelah pohon tumbang.
Italian: Non puoi semplicemente abbattere un albero e lasciare il ceppo. Ecco un obiettivo per esserti sbarazzato dei piccoli ceppi che rimangono una volta abbattuti gli alberi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): No puedes talar un árbol y dejar el tronco ahí. Aquí tienes un hito por haberte deshecho de los pequeños troncos que quedan tras la caída del árbol.
Portuguese: Você não pode simplesmente cortar uma árvore e deixar o toco. Aqui está um prêmio por se livrar dos toquinhos que ficam depois que a árvore cai.
Turkish: Ağaçları kestikten sonra köklerini orada bırakmamalısın. Ağaçlar kesildikten sonra kalan kökleri temizlediğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Man kann einen Baum nicht einfach fällen und danach den Stumpf stehen lassen. Hier ist ein Meilenstein, weil du die kleinen Stümpfe beseitigt hast, die nach dem Fällen des Baumes übrig bleiben.

English: You like wood, right? But what about square wood? Here is a milestone for cutting wood into planks.
French: Tu aimes le bois, pas vrai ? Mais qu'en est-il du bois carré ? Voici un jalon pour avoir coupé du bois en planches.
Russian: Любите древесину? А как насчет квадратной? Вот цель за нарезку на доски.
Chinese (Simplified): 你喜欢木头吗？方形的木头怎么样？这是切割木板的里程碑。
Japanese: 木が好きなら、四角い木もお好きかな？これは木を木材にカットした人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 목재를 좋아하나요? 하지만 나무토막은 어때요? 나무를 판자로 자른 대가로 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你喜歡木材，對吧？但你也喜歡方形木材吧？這是把木材切割成木板的里程碑。
Thai: รู้นะว่าชอบไม้ซุง แต่ก็ชอบไม้ท่อนด้วยใช่ไหมล่ะ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการเลื่อยไม้เป็นแผ่น
Indonesian: Kamu suka kayu, bukan? Bagaimana dengan kayu persegi? Ini milestone dari pemotongan kayu menjadi papan.
Italian: Ti piace il legno, vero? Ma che dire del legno squadrato? Ecco un obiettivo per il taglio del legno in assi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te gusta la madera, ¿verdad? Pero ¿qué opinas de la madera con perfil cuadrado? Aquí tienes un hito por haber cortado tablones de madera.
Portuguese: Você gosta de madeira, certo? E que tal madeira quadrada? Aqui está um prêmio por cortar madeira em tábuas.
Turkish: Odunları seviyorsun değil mi? Peki ya düzgün odunları? Odunu keserek kalasa dönüştürdüğün için başarı kazandın.
German: Du magst Holz, oder? Aber was ist mit quadratischem Holz? Hier ist ein Meilenstein für's Zuschneiden von Holz in Bretter.

English: You've caught a bunch of fish. Here is a milestone for catching a bunch of fish!
French: Tu as attrapé beaucoup de poissons. Voici un jalon pour avoir attrapé beaucoup de poissons.
Russian: Вы поймали немного рыбы. Вот цель за улов!
Chinese (Simplified): 你捕获了好多鱼。这是丰厚鱼获的里程碑！
Japanese: すっごい大漁だね！これはたくさん魚を捕まえた人へのマイルストーンだ！
Korean: 물고기를 잡았군요. 물고기를 많이 잡았으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你釣了好多魚喔！這是釣到一堆魚的里程碑！
Thai: ตกปลาได้เพียบเลย นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการจับปลาได้มากมาย!
Indonesian: Kamu menangkap banyak ikan. Ini milestone dari menangkap banyak ikan!
Italian: Hai pescato un sacco di pesci. Ecco un obiettivo per la pesca!
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¡La pesca fue muy fructífera! ¡Aquí tienes un hito por haber pescado un montón de peces!
Portuguese: Você pegou um monte de peixes. Aqui está um prêmio por pegar um monte de peixes!
Turkish: Bir sürü balık yakaladın. Bu kadar çok balık yakaladığın için başarı kazandın!
German: Du hast einen Haufen Fische gefangen. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Fangen eines Haufens Fische!

English: Being friendly and making friends is an adventure on its own! Be sure to chat with everyone every day! You might learn something.
French: Être amical et se faire des amis, c'est déjà toute une aventure ! N'hésite pas à discuter avec tout le monde chaque jour ! Tu pourrais apprendre des choses.
Russian: Быть дружелюбным и заводить друзей — само по себе приключение! Не забывайте каждый день со всеми общаться. Вы можете кое-что узнать.
Chinese (Simplified): 亲切待人和结交朋友本身就是一种冒险！记得每天都和大家聊聊天！或许会有新的收获。
Japanese: 仲良くして友達になるのは、それ自体が冒険そのもの！毎日みんなとおしゃべりしよう！何か発見があるかもね。
Korean: 친절하게 행동하며 친구들을 사귀는 것도 나름의 모험이 될 수 있어요! 매일 모든 사람들과 대화하면 배우는 게 있을 거예요.
Chinese (Traditional): 友善待人、交朋友，本身就是一場冒險喔！一定要每天都跟大家聊天！你可能會學到一些東西喔。
Thai: ถ้าอยากจะเข้ากับคนง่ายและหาเพื่อนใหม่เก่งก็ต้องฝึกปรือบ่อยๆ! อย่าลืมคุยกับคนอื่นทุกวัน! อาจมีอะไรดีๆ ให้เรียนรู้ก็ได้นะ
Indonesian: Bersikap ramah dan berteman adalah petualangan tersendiri! Pastikan mengobrol dengan semua orang setiap hari! Kamu mungkin akan belajar sesuatu.
Italian: Essere amichevoli e fare amicizia è un'avventura di per sé! Assicurati di chiacchierare con tutti ogni giorno! Potresti imparare qualcosa.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¡Ser amigable y hacer amigos es una gran aventura! ¡Asegúrate de conversar con todo el mundo, todos los días! Podrías aprender cosas nuevas.
Portuguese: Ser agradável e fazer amigos é uma aventura e tanto! Certifique-se de conversar com todo mundo todos os dias! Você pode aprender algo.
Turkish: Arkadaş canlısı olmak ve arkadaş edinmek başlı başına bir macera! Her gün herkesle sohbet etmeyi unutma çünkü bir şeyler öğrenebilirsin.
German: Freundlich zu sein und Freundschaften zu schließen ist schon ein Abenteuer für sich! Unterhalte dich unbedingt jeden Tag mit allen! Du könntest etwas lernen.

English: No matter how much you clear it seems to come back. Mowing never ends. Here is a milestone for chopping grass.
French: Quel que soit le nombre de fois où tu t'en débarrasses, cela revient sans cesse. La tonte est sans fin. Voici un jalon pour avoir tondu l'herbe.
Russian: Сколько бы вы ни косили траву, она возвращается. Кошение никогда не заканчивается. Вот цель за рубку травы.
Chinese (Simplified): 野火烧不尽，春风吹又生，修剪小草没有结束一说。这是割草的里程碑。
Japanese: 刈っても刈っても元通り。芝刈りに終わりはない。これは草を刈った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 잡초의 생명이 얼마나 끈질긴지, 아무리 베도 금방 자라나네요. 풀을 열심히 벤 대가로 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 不管你清除了多少雜草，它們好像都會長回來。除草永無止境。這是除草的里程碑。
Thai: จัดการไปไม่ทันไรก็ยาวใหม่อีกแล้ว ตัดหญ้าวนไปไม่จบไม่สิ้น นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการตัดหญ้า
Indonesian: Tidak peduli seberapa banyak dibersihkan, rumput selalu tumbuh lagi. Memotong rumput tidak ada habisnya. Ini milestone dari memotong rumput.
Italian: Per quanto la tagli, l'erba continua a ricrescere. Ecco un obiettivo per il taglio dell'erba.
Spanish (Latin Americas): No importa cuán seguido cortes el césped, siempre vuelve a crecer: es una tarea de nunca acabar. Aquí tienes un hito por haber cortado el césped.
Portuguese: Não importa o quanto você corte, sempre vai crescer. Cortar a grama é um trabalho sem fim. Aqui está um prêmio por cortar a grama.
Turkish: Ne kadar temizlersen temizle bitmeyecek gibi görünüyor. Çim biçmenin sonu yok. Çimleri biçtiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Egal, wie viel man mäht, das Gras scheint immer wiederzukommen. Man mäht ohne Ende. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Mähen von Gras.

English: Hunting is sometimes necessary. Here is a milestone for hunting creatures.
French: Il est parfois nécessaire de chasser. Voici un jalon pour avoir chassé des créatures.
Russian: Охотиться иногда необходимо. Вот цель за охоту на животных.
Chinese (Simplified): 狩猎有时是必要的。这是捕猎生物的里程碑。
Japanese: 狩らねばならない場合もある。これは狩りをした人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 가끔은 사냥이 필요할 때도 있어요. 동물을 사냥했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 狩獵有時是必要的。這是狩獵生物的里程碑。
Thai: การล่าสัตว์เป็นเรื่องสำคัญที่เลี่ยงไม่ได้ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการล่าสัตว์
Indonesian: Kadang kita perlu berburu. Ini milestone dari berburu makhluk.
Italian: A volte cacciare è necessario. Ecco un obiettivo per la caccia.
Spanish (Latin Americas): A veces es necesario cazar. Aquí tienes un hito por haber cazado criaturas.
Portuguese: Às vezes, caçar é necessário. Aqui está um prêmio por caçar criaturas.
Turkish: Bazen avcılık da yapmak gerekir. Hayvanları avladığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Ohne Jagen geht es manchmal nicht. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für die Jagd auf Kreaturen.

English: Trapping animals for relocation is a kind way to deal with them. It's not easy to do, either! Here is a milestone for trapping an animal.
French: Piéger des animaux en vue de leur transfert, c'est une manière bienveillante de les aider. Et ce n'est pas facile à faire ! Voici un jalon pour avoir piégé un animal.
Russian: Ловить животных для перемещения — гуманный способ справляться с ними. Но и это нелегко! Вот цель за поимку животного.
Chinese (Simplified): 诱捕等待迁移的动物是在善待它们，但是这活儿并不轻松！这是诱捕动物的里程碑。
Japanese: 動物を罠にかけて追い払うのは、思いやりのある対処法。でも簡単なことじゃない！これは動物を罠にかけた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 동물을 옮길 때는 가둬서 보내면 안 다치게 보낼 수 있어요. 하지만 그렇게 쉽지는 않아요! 동물을 가뒀으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 用陷阱捕捉動物來把牠們移到別處，是一種友善的處理方式。這也不容易做到耶！這是用陷阱捕捉動物的里程碑。
Thai: การดักสัตว์ไปปล่อยที่อื่นเป็นวิธีรับมือแบบใจดีมีเมตตา แต่ว่าทำยากเอาการ! นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการดักสัตว์
Indonesian: Menjebak hewan untuk dipindahkan adalah cara yang terbaik. Ini juga tidak mudah dilakukan! Ini milestone dari menjebak binatang.
Italian: Intrappolare gli animali per trasferirli è un modo gentile di gestirli. Non è una cosa facile, però! Ecco un obiettivo per l'utilizzo di trappole.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Atrapar animales para trasladarlos a otro lugar es una forma amable de lidiar con ellos. ¡Y no es fácil! Aquí tienes un hito por haber atrapado un animal.
Portuguese: Prender animais em armadilhas para transportá-los até outro local é uma maneira gentil de lidar com eles. Também não é fácil! Aqui está um prêmio por prender um animal.
Turkish: Hayvanlarla başa çıkmanın daha nazik bir yöntemi var: Tuzak ile yakalayıp yerlerini değiştirmek. Hiç kolay bir iş değil! Bir hayvanı tuzakla yakaladığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Tiere zu fangen, um sie umzusiedeln, ist eine freundliche Art, mit ihnen umzugehen. Aber es ist auch nicht einfach! Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Einfangen eines Tieres.

English: Buying furniture for your home? Maybe a gift? Here is a milestone for buying furniture.
French: Tu achètes des meubles pour ta maison ? Pour en faire cadeau ? Voici un jalon pour avoir acheté des meubles.
Russian: Покупаете мебель для дома? Или, может, в подарок? Вот цель за покупку мебели.
Chinese (Simplified): 是给自己家添置家具？或者是送礼？这是购买家具的里程碑。
Japanese: 買ったのは家に置く用の家具？それともプレゼント？これは家具を買った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 집에 둘 가구를 사려고요? 아니면 선물하게요? 가구를 구입했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 買家具來布置你的家嗎？還是買來送禮？這是購買家具的里程碑。
Thai: เธอซื้อเฟอร์นิเจอร์ไปแต่งบ้านตัวเองหรือเป็นของขวัญให้คนอื่นเหรอ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการซื้อเฟอร์นิเจอร์
Indonesian: Membeli perabotan untuk rumah? Atau untuk hadiah? Ini milestone dari membeli furnitur.
Italian: Stai acquistando arredamento per la tua casa? O magari un regalo? Ecco un obiettivo per l'acquisto di arredamento.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Necesitas muebles para tu hogar? ¿Tienes que hacer un regalo? Aquí tienes un hito por haber comprado muebles.
Portuguese: Decidiu comprar móveis para sua casa? Talvez um presente? Aqui está um prêmio por comprar móveis.
Turkish: Evine mobilya mı alıyorsun? Yoksa hediye mi bakıyorsun? Mobilya aldığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Hast du Möbel für dein Zuhause gekauft? Vielleicht ein Geschenk? Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Kauf von Möbeln.

English: New walls. Same old house. Here is a milestone for buying wallpaper.
French: Nouveaux murs. Même vieille maison. Voici un jalon pour avoir acheté du papier peint.
Russian: Новые стены. Тот же дом. Вот цель за покупку обоев.
Chinese (Simplified): 旧屋换新墙。这是购买壁纸的里程碑。
Japanese: 新しい壁。家はそのまま。これは壁紙を買った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 집은 변함없지만 벽지는 새로 갈 수 있죠. 벽지를 구입했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 舊屋新牆壁。這是購買壁紙的里程碑。
Thai: บ้านเก่าแต่ผนังใหม่ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการซื้อวอลล์เปเปอร์
Indonesian: Dinding baru. Rumah tua yang sama. Ini milestone dari membeli wallpaper.
Italian: Nuove pareti, stessa vecchia casa. Ecco un obiettivo per l'acquisto di carta da parati.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Paredes renovadas. La misma casa de siempre. Aquí tienes un hito por haber comprado papel tapiz.
Portuguese: Novas paredes. Mesma casa antiga. Aqui está um prêmio por comprar papel de parede.
Turkish: Yeni duvarlar eski bir eve ferahlık katar. Duvar kağıdı satın aldığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Neue Wände. Gleiches altes Haus. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Kauf von Tapeten.

English: Here is a milestone for buying flooring.
French: Voici un jalon pour avoir acheté du plancher.
Russian: Вот цель за покупку напольного покрытия.
Chinese (Simplified): 这是购买地板的里程碑。
Japanese: これは床材を買った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Chinese (Traditional): 這是買地板的里程碑。
Thai: นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการซื้อวัสดุปูพื้น
Indonesian: Ini milestone dari membeli lantai.
Italian: Ecco un obiettivo per l'acquisto di pavimenti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Aquí tienes un hito por haber comprado pisos nuevos.
Portuguese: Aqui está um prêmio por comprar o piso.
Turkish: Yer döşemesi satın aldığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Kauf von Bodenbelägen.

English: Here is a milestone for buying seeds.
French: Voici un jalon pour avoir acheté des graines.
Russian: Вот цель за покупку семян.
Chinese (Simplified): 这是购买种子的里程碑。
Japanese: これは種を買った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Chinese (Traditional): 這是買種子的里程碑。
Thai: นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการซื้อเมล็ดพันธุ์
Indonesian: Ini milestone dari membeli bibit.
Italian: Ecco un obiettivo per l'acquisto di semi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Aquí tienes un hito por haber comprado semillas.
Portuguese: Aqui está um prêmio por comprar sementes.
Turkish: Tohum satın aldığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Kauf von Samen.

English: Reap what you have sown. Here is a milestone for harvesting crops.
French: Récolte ce que tu as semé. Voici un jalon pour avoir récolté les cultures.
Russian: Пожинайте, что посеяли. Вот цель за сбор урожая.
Chinese (Simplified): 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。这是收获作物的里程碑。
Japanese: 自分で植えたものは、自分で刈り取ろう！これは作物を収穫した人のマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 씨앗을 뿌렸으면 수확해야죠. 작물을 수확했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 種下什麼就收穫什麼。這是收穫作物的里程碑。
Thai: เก็บเกี่ยวความงอกเงยจากน้ำพักน้ำแรง นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการเก็บเกี่ยวพืชผล
Indonesian: Siapa yang menanam, dia yang menuai. Ini milestone dari memanen tanaman.
Italian: Raccogli quello che hai seminato. Ecco un obiettivo per i raccolti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Cosecha lo que has sembrado. Aquí tienes un hito por haber cosechado cultivos.
Portuguese: Colha o que você plantou. Aqui está um prêmio por colher a safra.
Turkish: Ne ekersen onu biçersin. Ürün hasat ettiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Du kannst ernten, was du gesät hast. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für die Ernte von Feldfrüchten.

English: Looking good in some new threads. Here is a milestone for buying clothes
French: Pas mal ces nouveaux habits. Voici un jalon pour avoir acheté des vêtements.
Russian: В новых шмотках вам идет. Вот цель за покупку одежды
Chinese (Simplified): 新衣服穿起来很漂亮。这是购买衣服的里程碑。
Japanese: 新しい服でオシャレになろう！これは服を買った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 옷이 잘 어울리네요. 옷을 구매했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 穿上新衣服，看起來真不錯。這是購買衣服的里程碑
Thai: ชุดใหม่ใส่แล้วดูดีใช่ย่อย นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการซื้อชุดใหม่
Indonesian: Tampak bagus dengan baju baru. Ini milestone dari membeli pakaian.
Italian: Gli abiti nuovi aggiungono sempre un tocco di eleganza. Ecco un obiettivo per l'acquisto di vestiti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Te ves bien con tu nuevo look. Aquí tienes un hito por haber comprado ropa.
Portuguese: Ficou bem com as roupas novas. Aqui está um prêmio por comprar roupas.
Turkish: Çok şık görünüyorsun. Giysi satın aldığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Du siehst gut aus in deinen neuen Klamotten. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Kauf von Kleidung.

English: Cooked fruit. Sounds gross, I know. It might be... Anyway, here is a milestone for cooking fruit.
French: Des fruits cuits. Cela a l'air dégoûtant, je sais. C'est peut-être le cas... Bref, voici un jalon pour avoir cuisiné des fruits.
Russian: Вареные фрукты. Звучит так себе, знаю. Возможно... В любом случае вот цель за варение фруктов.
Chinese (Simplified): 水果做菜，听起来有点倒胃口。味道估计…总之，这是烹饪水果的里程碑。
Japanese: 果物を調理した。なんだか見た目が悪い…大丈夫かな？何はともあれ、これは果物で料理した人のマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 익힌 과일이라. 듣기에는 영 별로죠? 실제로는 어떨지... 어쨌든 과일을 요리했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 煮水果。聽起來很噁心，我知道。也許……總之，這是煮水果的里程碑。
Thai: ถึงจะฟังดูแปลก แต่ผลไม้ปรุงสุกก็... ก็เอาเป็นว่านี่คือเส้นชัยจากการปรุงผลไม้
Indonesian: Buah yang dimasak. Oke, kedengarannya aneh. Mungkin... Omong-omong, ini milestone dari memasak buah.
Italian: Frutta cotta. Sembra disgustosa, lo so. Forse lo è... In ogni caso, ecco un obiettivo per la cottura della frutta.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Fruta cocida. Suena asqueroso, lo sé. Puede que lo sea... De todos modos, aquí tienes un hito por haber cocinado fruta.
Portuguese: Frutas cozidas. Parece nojento, eu sei. Pode ser... De qualquer forma, aqui está um prêmio por cozinhar frutas.
Turkish: Meyve pişirmek mi? Kulağa iğrenç geliyor olsa da meyve pişirdiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Gekochtes Obst. Klingt eklig, ich weiß. Ist es vielleicht auch ... Wie auch immer, hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Kochen von Obst.

English: Catching bugs is a great activity. Here is a milestone for catching some of those creepy crawlies.
French: Attraper des insectes est une activité géniale. Voici un jalon pour avoir attrapé des insectes rampants et effrayants.
Russian: Ловить козявок — великое дело. Вот цель за поимку такой ползучей жути.
Chinese (Simplified): 捕虫是项很棒的活动。这是抓捕诡异昆虫的里程碑。
Japanese: 虫を捕まえるのは立派なアクティビティ。これは不気味な虫を捕獲した人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 벌레를 잡으면 덜 신경 쓰이죠. 소름 끼치는 벌레를 잡았으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 抓蟲子很棒的活動。這是抓蟲子的里程碑。
Thai: การจับแมลงเป็นกิจกรรมดีมีประโยชน์ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการจับแมลงน้อยใหญ่
Indonesian: Menangkap serangga adalah kegiatan yang menyenangkan. Ini milestone dari menangkap serangga-serangga itu.
Italian: Catturare insetti è un'attività fantastica. Ecco un obiettivo per la caccia a quei cosetti striscianti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Atrapar insectos es una actividad genial. Aquí tienes un hito por haber atrapado algunos de esos bichos espeluznantes.
Portuguese: Capturar insetos é uma ótima atividade. Aqui está um prêmio por pegar aqueles assustadores que rastejam.
Turkish: Böcek yakalamak müthiş bir aktivite. Kımıl kımıl böcekleri yakaladığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Käferfangen ist eine tolle Beschäftigung. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Fangen einiger dieser Krabbeltiere.

English: Mixing things all together to make something? You're a bloody chef, I'll tell you what. Here is a milestone for cooking at the cooking table.
French: Tout mélanger pour préparer quelque chose ? Laisse-moi te dire, tu es un vrai chef. Voici un jalon pour avoir cuisiné à la table de cuisson.
Russian: Смешиваете все подряд, чтобы что-то приготовить? Да вы чертов повар, скажу я вам. Вот цель за использование стола для готовки.
Chinese (Simplified): 各种食材一锅乱炖？你真是位大厨。这是在烹饪台做菜的里程碑。
Japanese: ぜんぶ混ぜ料理！？とんでもないシェフがいたもんだ！これは調理台で料理をした人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 각종 재료를 섞어 뭔가를 만든다고요? 요리사 기질이 다분하군요. 조리대에서 요리했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 把不同材料混在一起做成新東西？不得不說你真是個厲害的廚師。這是在料理台做菜的里程碑。
Thai: จับนี่ผสมนั่นให้เป็นเมนูอร่อย นี่มันเชฟเทวดาชัดๆ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการทำอาหารที่โต๊ะปรุงอาหาร
Indonesian: Mencampurkan semuanya untuk membuat sesuatu? Kamu memang koki yang luar biasa. Ini milestone dari memasak di meja masak.
Italian: Mescolare ingredienti per creare qualcosa? Sei uno chef nato, te lo dico io. Ecco un obiettivo per il cibo preparato al tavolo da cucina.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Mezclar diferentes ingredientes para preparar algo? Eres todo un chef, te lo aseguro. Aquí tienes un hito por haber cocinado en la mesa de cocina.
Portuguese: Mistura as coisas para preparar algo? Você realmente é um chef. Aqui está um prêmio por cozinhar na mesa de culinária.
Turkish: Her şeyi karıştırıp ortaya bir yemek çıkardın öyle mi? Gerçekten harika bir aşçısın! Pişirme masasında yemek pişirdiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Du mischst alles zusammen, um etwas Leckeres zu kochen? Du bist ein richtiger Chefkoch, das sage ich dir. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Kochen am Kochtisch.

English: Always replace what you've taken. Here is a milestone for planting tree seeds.
French: Il faut toujours remplacer ce qu'on prend. Voici un jalon pour avoir planté des graines d'arbres.
Russian: Всегда возмещайте то, что взяли. Вот цель за посадку семян деревьев.
Chinese (Simplified): 有借就有还。这是植树的里程碑。
Japanese: 切ったら植えるのを忘れずに。これは木の種子を植えた人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 뭔가를 가져갔으면 도로 채워야죠. 나무 씨앗을 심었으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 永遠記得，拿走什麼就要補什麼回來。這是種下樹苖的里程碑。
Thai: เอาอะไรไปก็ต้องเติมใหม่เสมอ นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการปลูกเมล็ดพันธุ์ต้นไม้
Indonesian: Selalu ganti apa yang sudah kamu ambil. Ini adalah milestone dari menanam bibit pohon.
Italian: Sostituisci sempre ciò che hai preso. Ecco un obiettivo per aver piantato semi di alberi.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Siempre que cosechas, reemplaza lo que has tomado. Aquí tienes un hito por haber plantado semillas de árboles.
Portuguese: Sempre reponha o que você usou. Aqui está um prêmio por plantar sementes de árvores.
Turkish: Doğadan aldıklarını doğaya geri vermelisin. Ağaç tohumları ektiğin için başarı kazandın.
German: Man muss immer ersetzen, was man genommen hat. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für das Pflanzen von Baumsamen.

English: What are fish doing in the ocean when they could be put to good use lining your pockets. Here is a milestone for selling fish.
French: Que font les poissons dans l'océan alors qu'ils pourraient être utiles et te remplir les poches. Voici un jalon pour avoir pêché.
Russian: Что делает рыба в океане, когда она могла бы набивать ваши карманы? Вот цель за продажу рыбы.
Chinese (Simplified): 既然鱼可以好好利用起来充实钱包，又何必让它们在海里游来游去。这是出售鱼的里程碑。
Japanese: 魚たちは海で何をしてるんだ。お金に換えてあげようというのに！これは魚を売った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 바다에 물고기가 많아봤자 내 수중에 안 들어오면 소용없죠. 물고기를 판매했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 魚待在海裡做什麼？不如拿來好好利用，讓你賺錢。這是賣魚的里程碑。
Thai: ปลาจะอยู่ในทะเลไปทำไม จับมาเปลี่ยนเป็นเงินให้เธอสิ ดีกว่ากันเยอะเลย นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการขายปลา
Indonesian: Untuk apa ikan berada di lautan jika bisa dimanfaatkan untuk mengisi kantongmu. Ini milestone dari menjual ikan.
Italian: Cosa ci fanno i pesci nell'oceano quando potrebbero essere usati per riempire le tue tasche? Ecco un obiettivo per la vendita del pesce.
Spanish (Latin Americas): ¿Qué hacen los peces en el océano cuando podrías usarlos para llenar tus bolsillos? Aquí tienes un hito por haber vendido pescado.
Portuguese: O que os peixes estão fazendo no oceano quando podem ter melhor uso, como encher os seus bolsos? Aqui está um prêmio por vender peixes.
Turkish: Okyanustan tuttuğun balıkları satarak para kazanabilirsin. Balık sattığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Was haben Fische im Meer zu suchen, wenn man sie auch gut für die eigenen Taschen gebrauchen kann? Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Verkauf von Fisch.

English: Bugs are everywhere. For some reason, John wants them. Here is a milestone for selling bugs.
French: Il y a des insectes partout. Pour une raison quelconque, John les veut. Voici un jalon pour avoir vendu des insectes.
Russian: Козявки везде. Зачем-то они понадобились Джону. Вот цель за продажу козявок.
Chinese (Simplified): 昆虫无处不在，约翰不知为何想要昆虫。这是出售昆虫的里程碑。
Japanese: 虫はあちこちにいる。なぜだか知らないが、ジョンはほしがっているようだ。これは虫を売った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 사방에 벌레투성이인데, 영문은 몰라도 존이 벌레를 원하네요. 벌레를 판매했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 蟲子無所不在。不知道為什麼，約翰想要這些蟲子。這是賣蟲子的里程碑。
Thai: ไปที่ไหนก็เจอแต่แมลง แต่ถ้าจอห์นอยากได้ก็จัดไป นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการขายแมลง
Indonesian: Serangga ada di mana-mana. Entah mengapa, John menginginkannya. Ini milestone dari menjual serangga.
Italian: Gli insetti sono ovunque. Per qualche motivo, John li vuole. Ecco un obiettivo per la vendita di insetti.
Spanish (Latin Americas): Los insectos están por todas partes. Por alguna razón, John los quiere. Aquí tienes un hito por haber vendido insectos.
Portuguese: Os insetos estão por toda parte. Por alguma razão, John os quer. Aqui está um prêmio por vender insetos.
Turkish: Böcekler her yerde ve nedense John bu böcekleri istiyor. Böcekleri sattığın için başarı kazandın.
German: Käfer sind überall. Aus irgendeinem Grund will John sie haben. Hier ist ein Meilenstein für den Verkauf von Käfern.

English: You've got to squeeze for every Dink you can. Even if it means dealing with shells. Here is a milestone for selling shells.
French: Tu dois presser pour obtenir chaque Dink possible. Même si cela veut dire s'occuper des coquilles. Voici un jalon pour avoir vendu des coquilles.
Russian: Вам нужно выжимать Динк из всего, что можете. Даже из ракушек. Вот цель за продажу ракушек.
Chinese (Simplified): 一枚汀克币都别放过，即便得处理贝类。这是出售贝类的里程碑。
Japanese: たとえ貝殻の取引でも、びた1ディンクたりともまけられない。これは貝殻を売った人へのマイルストーンだ。
Korean: 뭐든 머릴 쓰면 돈이 됩니다. 조가비를 판매했으니 추억 조각을 드립니다.
Chinese (Traditional): 你必須盡力賺到每一分錢。即使這代表要處理貝殼。這是賣貝殼的里程碑。
Thai: กว่าจะได้เงินทองมาทีก็ลำบาก ถ้าถึงขั้นต้องตรากตรำไปหาเปลือยหอยก็ยอม นี่คือเส้นชัยจากการขายเปลือกหอย
Indonesian: Kamu harus memeras Dink sebanyak mungkin. Bahkan jika itu berarti berurusan dengan kerang. Ini adalah milestone dari menjual kerang.
